verses.latin: Visio Isaiae, filii Amos, quam vidit de Iuda et Ierusalem in diebus Oziae, Ioatham, Achaz, et Ezechiae, regum Iuda.
verses.english: This is the vision of Isaiah, son of Amoz, concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, the kings of Judah.

verses.latin: Audite caeli, et auribus percipe terra, quoniam Dominus locutus est. Filios enutrivi, et exaltavi; ipsi autem spreverunt me.
verses.english: Listen, universe. Listen, Earth, for the Lord has spoken. “I have raised up children, but they have rejected me.”

verses.latin: Cognovit bos possessorem suum, et asinus praesepe domini sui: Israel autem me non cognovit, et populus meus non intellexit.
verses.english: The ox knows its owner, and the donkey its master’s crib, but Israel doesn't know me, and my people haven't understood me.

verses.latin: Vae genti peccatrici, populo gravi iniquitate, semini nequam, filiis sceleratis! Dereliquerunt Dominum, blasphemaverunt Sanctum Israël, abalienati sunt retrorsum.
verses.english: Woe to the sinful nation, to a people burdened with iniquity, to the evil seed, to the wicked sons! They have forsaken the Lord, blasphemed the Holy One of Israel, and turned back.

verses.latin: Super quo percutiamini ultra, addentes praevaricationem? Omne caput languidum, et omne cor moerens.
verses.english: Why will you be struck again, since you are adding to your sin? The whole head is sick, and the whole heart is heavy.

verses.latin: A planta pedis usque ad verticem, non est in eo sanitas; vulnus et livor et plaga tumens, non est circumligata, neque curata, nec ad mollitum olei.
verses.english: From the sole of the foot to the crown of the head, there is no soundness in it, but wounds, bruises, and open sores that are not bound up or softened with oil.

verses.latin: Terra vestra deserta, civitates vestrae incensae igni: regionem vestram coram vobis alieni devorant, et desolabitur sicut vastitas hostium.
verses.english: Your land is desolate. Your cities are burned with fire. In your presence, foreigners devour your land, and it is desolate as though destroyed by enemies.

verses.latin: Et derelinquetur filia Sion, quasi umbraculum in vinea, et quasi casa in cucumerario, sicut civitas quae vastatur.
verses.english: And the daughter of Zion will be left like a booth in a vineyard, like a hut in a cucumber field, like a city that is destroyed.

verses.latin: Nisi Dominus exercituum reliquisset nobis semen, quasi Sodoma fuissemus, et quasi Gomorrha similes essemus.
verses.english: Unless the Lord of hosts had left us a seed, we would have been like Sodom, and like Gomorrah.

verses.latin: Audite verbum Domini, principes Sodomorum; percipite auribus, legem Dei, populus Gomorrhæ.
verses.english: Hear the word of the Lord, you rulers of Sodom. Give ear to the law of our God, you people of Gomorrah.

verses.latin: Quo mihi multitudinem sacrificiorum vestrorum? dicit Dominus. Plenus sum holocaustorum arietum, et saginem pinguium, et sanguinem vitulorum et agnorum et hircorum nolo.
verses.english: “What are your many sacrifices to me?” says the Lord. “I am full of burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts, and I don’t want the blood of calves, lambs, or goats.”

verses.latin: Cum venitis coram me, quis requirit haec de manibus vestris, ut calcaretis atria mea?
verses.english: When you come before me, who has required this of you, that you tread my courts?

verses.latin: Nolite offerre ultra sacrificium frustra: incensum abominatio est mihi. Kalendas et sabbata et festivitates alias, non suffero: iniquitas et conventus vester.
verses.english: Don’t offer any further sacrifice in vain. Incense is an abomination to me. New moons, sabbaths, and other festivals I cannot endure. Your iniquity and your gatherings!

verses.latin: Kalendas vestras, et solemnitates vestras odit anima mea: facta sunt mihi oneri; laboravi sustinens.
verses.english: Your new moons and your appointed feasts, my soul hates. They have become a burden to me; I am weary of bearing them.

verses.latin: Et cum extenderitis manus vestras, avertam oculos meos a vobis: et cum multiplicaveritis orationem, non exaudiam: manus enim vestrae sanguine plenae sunt.
verses.english: And when you stretch out your hands, I will turn my eyes away from you. And when you multiply your prayer, I will not hear, for your hands are full of blood.

verses.latin: Lavate, mundamini, auferte malum cogitationum vestrarum, de oculis meis: quiescite facere perversum.
verses.english: Wash yourselves, be clean. Remove the evil of your thoughts from before my eyes. Stop doing evil!

verses.latin: Discite benefacere: quaerite judicium, subvenite oppresso, judicate pupillo, defendite viduam.
verses.english: Learn to do good. Seek judgment. Help the oppressed. Judge for the orphan. Defend the widow.

verses.latin: Et venite, et arguite me, dicit Dominus: si fuerint peccata vestra ut coccinum, quasi nix dealbabuntur: et si fuerint rubra quasi vermiculus, quasi lana erunt.
verses.english: “Come now, and let us reason together,” says the Lord. “Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow. Though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.”

verses.latin: Si volueritis, et audieritis me, bona terrae comedes.
verses.english: If you are willing, and if you listen to me, you shall eat the good of the land.

verses.latin: Sin autem nolueritis, et me ad iracundiam provocare, gladius devorabit vos: quia os Domini locutum est.
verses.english: But if you are not willing, and provoke me to anger, the sword shall devour you, for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.

verses.latin: Quomodo facta est in meretricem civitas fidelis, plena judicii? Justitia habitabat in ea, nunc autem homicidae.
verses.english: How has the faithful city become a prostitute, full of judgment? Justice dwelt in her, but now murderers.

verses.latin: Argentum tuum versum est in faeces, vinum tuum mistum est aqua.
verses.english: Your silver has become dross, your wine is mixed with water.

verses.latin: Principes tui infideles, socii furum: omnes diligunt munera, sequuntur retributiones. Pupillo non judicant, et causa viduae non intrat ad eos.
verses.english: Your leaders are disloyal. They are companions of thieves. Everyone loves bribes. They follow after rewards. They do not judge for the orphan, and the widow's case does not come before them.

verses.latin: Propter hoc dicit Dominus exercituum, Deus Israël: Heu! consolabor super adversariis meis, et vindicabor de inimicis meis.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Woe! I will console myself over my adversaries and take vengeance on my enemies.”

verses.latin: Et convertam manum meam ad te, et ad conflandum faeces tuas quasi in nitri, et auferam omnem stannum tuum.
verses.english: I will turn my hand against you, and I will melt your dross as with lye, and I will remove all your tin.

verses.latin: Et restituam judices tuos ut fuere prius, et consiliarios tuos sicut in principio. Post haec vocabberis civitas justi, urbs fidelis.
verses.english: I will restore your judges as they were at first, and your counselors as in the beginning. After that, you will be called the city of righteousness, the faithful city.

verses.latin: Sion in judicio redimetur, et convertentes in ea in justitia.
verses.english: Zion will be redeemed with judgment, and those who turn to her with righteousness.

verses.latin: Et contritio sceleratorum, et peccatorum simul: et qui dereliquerunt Dominum, consumentur.
verses.english: And the destruction of the wicked and sinners alike; and those who have forsaken the Lord will be consumed.

verses.latin: Erit enim confusio idolorum, eorum quae desideraverant: et erubescent super lucis, quas elegerunt.
verses.english: For they will be ashamed of the idols, those things that they desired, and they will be ashamed of the groves which they have chosen.

verses.latin: Erunt enim quasi quercus, cuius folia marcescunt, et quasi hortus, cuius aqua deficit.
verses.english: For they will be like an oak whose leaves wither, and like a garden whose water fails.

verses.latin: Et erit fortis quasi stupa, et opus ejus quasi scintilla, et conburentur pariter, nec est qui extinguat.
verses.english: And the strong will be like tow, and his work like a spark, and they will burn together, and there is no one to extinguish them.

verses.latin: Verbum quod vidit Isaias filius Amos super Iudam et Ierusalem.
verses.english: This is what Isaiah son of Amoz saw regarding Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et erit in novissimo dierum praeparatus mons domus Domini in vertice montium, et exaltabitur super colles, et fluent ad eum omnes gentes.
verses.english: In the end times, the mountain of the Lord's temple will be prepared, at the top of all the mountains, and will be raised above all hills. And all the nations will flow to it.

verses.latin: Et ibunt populi multi, et dicent: Venite, ascendamus ad montem Domini, et ad domum Dei Iacob, et docebit nos vias suas, et ambulabimus in semitis eius: quia de Sion exibit lex, et verbum Domini de Ierusalem.
verses.english: And many people will come and say, “Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob, and He will teach us His ways, and we will walk in His paths.” For the law will come forth from Zion, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et iudicabit gentes, et arguet populos multos: et conflabunt gladios suos in vomeres, et hastas suas in falces. Non levabit gladius gentem contra gentem, nec discent ultra pugnare.
verses.english: He will judge the nations and rebuke many people. They will beat their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not lift up sword against nation, nor will they learn war anymore.

verses.latin: Domus Iacob, venite, et ambulemus in lumine Domini.
verses.english: O house of Jacob, come, and let us walk in the light of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia proieceras populum tuum, domum Iacob, quia repleti sunt ut prius, et magi ipsorum, ut Philisthiim, et adulescentuli eorum in filiis alienis.
verses.english: For you have forsaken your people, the house of Jacob, because they have been filled with all sorts of wickedness like before. They are filled with fortune-tellers like the Philistines, and their young men are in league with foreigners.

verses.latin: Et repleta est terra argento et auro, et non est finis thesaurorum eius: et repleta est terra equis, et non est finis quadrigarum eius.
verses.english: Their land is filled with silver and gold, and there is no end to their treasures. Their land is filled with horses, and there is no end to their chariots.

verses.latin: Et repleta est terra idolis: opus manuum eorum, quod fecerunt digiti eorum.
verses.english: Their land is filled with idols: the work of their hands, what their fingers have made.

verses.latin: Et incurvabit se homo, et humiliabitur vir: et non relaxes eis.
verses.english: So man bows down, and the man is humbled, and you do not forgive them.

verses.latin: Intra in petram, et absconde te in foveis de facie formidinis Domini, et a gloria maiestatis eius.
verses.english: Enter into the rock, and hide yourself in the dust, from the face of the fear of the Lord and from the glory of His majesty.

verses.latin: Oculi sublimium hominum humiliati sunt, et incurvabitur elatio virorum: et exaltabitur Dominus solus in die illa.
verses.english: The eyes of the proud men are humbled, and the loftiness of the men will be bowed down. And the Lord alone will be exalted in that day.

verses.latin: Quia dies Domini exercituum super omnem superbum et excelsum, et super omnem elatum, et humiliabitur.
verses.english: For the day of the Lord of hosts will be against all who are proud and lofty, against everyone who is lifted up, and he will be humbled.

verses.latin: Et super omnes cedros Libani altas et sublimes, et super omnes quercus Basan,
verses.english: And it will be against all the cedars of Lebanon that are high and lofty, and against all the oaks of Bashan,

verses.latin: et super omnes montes excelsos, et super omnes colles elevatos,
verses.english: and against all the high mountains, and against all the elevated hills,

verses.latin: et super omnem turrim sublimem, et super omnem murum munitum,
verses.english: and against every high tower, and against every fortified wall,

verses.latin: et super omnes naves Tharsis, et super omne quod visum est picturae.
verses.english: and against all the ships of Tarshish and against everything that seems like a beautiful picture.

verses.latin: Et incurvabitur elatio hominum, et humiliabitur superbia virorum: et exaltabitur Dominus solus in die illa.
verses.english: So the loftiness of man will be bowed down, and the pride of men will be humbled. And the Lord alone will be exalted in that day.

verses.latin: Et idola penitus conterentur.
verses.english: And the idols will utterly vanish.

verses.latin: Et introibunt in speluncas petrarum, et in foveas terræ, a facie formidinis Domini, et a gloria maiestatis eius, cum surrexerit percutere terram.
verses.english: And men will enter into the caves of the rocks and into the holes of the earth, from the face of the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of His majesty, when He arises to strike the earth.

verses.latin: In die illa proiciet homo idola argenti sui, et idola auri sui, quæ fecerat sibi ut adoraret talpas et vespertiliones.
verses.english: In that day, a man will throw away his idols of silver and his idols of gold, which he made for himself to worship moles and bats,

verses.latin: ut intret cavernas petrarum, et scissuras saxorum, a facie formidinis Domini, et a gloria maiestatis eius, cum surrexerit percutere terram.
verses.english: so that he may enter the caverns of the rocks and the crevices of the cliffs, from the face of the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of His majesty, when He arises to strike the earth.

verses.latin: Desinite ergo ab homine, cujus spiritus in naribus ejus est, quia excelsus est: cujus enim est ipse ?
verses.english: Therefore cease to be proud of man, in whose nostrils is breath, for he is esteemed, of what account is he?

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus exercituum auferet a Jerusalem et a Juda omne robur panis et omne robur aquae,
verses.english: Behold, the Lord of hosts will take away all the bread and all the water that is needed to live from Jerusalem and Judah,

verses.latin: fortem et virum et fortem bellatorem, et judicem et prophetam et ariolum et senem,
verses.english: He will remove their strong and brave soldiers, their judges, their prophets, their fortune-tellers, and their elders,

verses.latin: principem quinquagenarium et honorabilem et consiliarium et sapientem artíficem et prudentem eloquio.
verses.english: their rulers, those held in high regard, their counselors, their skilled craftsmen, and those eloquent in speech.

verses.latin: Et dabo pueros principes eorum, et effeminati dominabuntur eis.
verses.english: And I will make children their princes, and the immature will rule them.

verses.latin: Et ruent populi, vir ad virum, et unusquisque ad proximum suum; tumultuabitur puer contra senem, et ignobilis contra honorificum.
verses.english: The people will be in chaos, one person against another, each against his neighbor. The child will insult the elder, and the vulgar will disrespect the noble.

verses.latin: Sane adprehendet vir fratrem suum domum patris sui: Habes pallium, esto dux noster, et, sub hac manu tua, gladius.
verses.english: Surely a man will seize his brother in the house of his father, saying, “You have a cloak, so be our leader, and under your hand, let there be a sword.”

verses.latin: In die illa elevabit voce sua, dicens: Non ero medicus; et in domo mea non est panis neque vestimentum: nolite constituere me ducem populi.
verses.english: In that day, he will cry out, saying, “I will not be a physician; for in my house there is no bread nor clothing. Do not make me the leader of the people.”

verses.latin: Ruet enim Jerusalem, et Juda corruet, quia lingua eorum et stultitia operum eorum contra Dominum, ut provocarent oculos majestatis ejus.
verses.english: For Jerusalem will fall, and Judah will be brought down, because their language and the foolishness of their deeds are against the Lord, provoking the eyes of His majesty.

verses.latin: Species faciei eorum respondit eis, et peccatum suum quasi Sodoma praedicaverunt, nec absconderunt. Vae animae eorum, quoniam retribuerunt sibi malum.
verses.english: The expression on their faces testifies against them, and they proclaim their sin like Sodom, without hiding it. Woe to their souls, for they have brought evil upon themselves.

verses.latin: Dicite justo quod bene, quia fructu operum suorum comedent.
verses.english: Tell the just that it is well, because they will enjoy the fruit of their deeds.

verses.latin: Vae impio in malum: retributio enim manuum ejus dabitur ei.
verses.english: Woe to the wicked! For the reward of his hands will be given to him.

verses.latin: Populus meus, qui beat te, errare te facientes, et viam gressuum tuorum subvertentes.
verses.english: My people, those who bless you are deceiving you and turning the path of your footsteps upside down.

verses.latin: Dominus stat in judicio, et stat ut judicet populos.
verses.english: The Lord stands in judgment, and He stands to judge the peoples.

verses.latin: Dominus ad judicium veniet cum senibus populi sui et principibus ejus: vos enim consumpsistis vineam, et rapina pauperis in domibus vestris.
verses.english: The Lord will come to judgment with the elders of His people and its princes, for you have consumed the vineyard, and the plunder of the poor is in your houses.

verses.latin: Quid vobis quod atteratis populum meum, et facies pauperum conteratis? dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: Why do you crush my people and grind the faces of the poor? says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus: Eo quod elevatae sint filiae Sion, et ambulent collo elato, et nutibus oculorum petulantibus, et incessu parvo gradientes, et crepitu pedum currentes,
verses.english: And the Lord said, “Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, walking with outstretched necks, ogling with their eyes, strutting as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet,

verses.latin: deradent Dominus verticem filiarum Sion, et Dominus nudabit crinem earum.
verses.english: therefore the Lord will scrape the heads of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will expose their hair.”

verses.latin: In die illa auferet Dominus ornatum calciamenti, et lunulas, et torques,
verses.english: In that day the Lord will take away the finery of their sandals, the crescents, and the necklaces,

verses.latin: et monilia, et bacas, et de cincinnis, et de armillis, et de vasa unguentorum,
verses.english: the bracelets, the pendants, and the headbands, the anklets, the sashes, and the perfume bottles,

verses.latin: et de anulis, et de speculis, et sindonem, et mitras, et amictus,
verses.english: the rings, the mirrors, the fine linen garments, the turbans, and the veils.

verses.latin: Et erit pro odore unguenti, foetor; et pro zona, funiculus; et pro crispantibus crinibus, calvitium; et pro fascia, cincinnus; pro amictu, saccus.
verses.english: Instead of perfume, there will be a stench; instead of a belt, a rope; instead of elaborate hairstyles, baldness; instead of a robe, a sackcloth.

verses.latin: Viris tui cadent in gladio, et fortes tui in praelio.
verses.english: Your men will fall by the sword, and your strong ones in battle.

verses.latin: Et lugebunt et maerebunt portae ejus, et desolata sedebit terra.
verses.english: And its gates will lament and mourn, and the land, desolated, will sit.

verses.latin: Et adprehendent septem mulieres virum unum in die illa, dicentes: Panem nostrum comedemus, et vestimentis nostris induemur: tantummodo invocetur nomen tuum super nos, aufer opprobrium nostrum.
verses.english: And seven women will seize one man in that day, saying, “We will eat our own bread and wear our own clothes; only let us be called by your name, take away our reproach.”

verses.latin: In die illa abjiciet Dominus ornatum calciamenti, et lunulas, et torques, et monilia,
verses.english: In that day the Lord will take away the finery of their sandals, the crescents, the necklaces, and the pendants,

verses.latin: et in vestimentis variis, et in pallis, et in amictibus, et in saccis.
verses.english: the dresses, the cloaks, the veils, and the shawls.

verses.latin: Et erit pro deliciis, putredo; et pro balteo, funiculus; et pro crinibus, calvitium; et pro zona, saccus.
verses.english: And there will be decay instead of fragrance, a rope instead of a belt, baldness instead of elaborate hairstyles, and a sackcloth instead of a robe.

verses.latin: Et remanebit filia Sion quasi umbraculum in vinea, et quasi cucumerarium in cucurbitarium, et quasi civitas quae vastata est.
verses.english: And the daughter of Zion will remain like a shelter in a vineyard, like a watchman’s hut in a cucumber field, and like a city that has been destroyed.

verses.latin: Et adprehendent septem mulieres virum unum in die illa, dicentes: Panem nostrum comedemus, et vestitu nostro induemur: tantummodo invocetur nomen tuum super nos, aufer opprobrium nostrum.
verses.english: And in that day, seven women will take hold of one man, saying: "We will eat our own bread, and dress ourselves in our own clothes; only let us be called by your name, and take away our disgrace."

verses.latin: In die illa erit germen Domini in magnificentia et gloria, et fructus terræ sublimis, et gloriæ, his qui salvati fuerint de Israël.
verses.english: In that day, the Messiah will be the glory and honor of God, and the fruit of the earth will be the pride and glory of those of Israel who are saved.

verses.latin: Et erit qui relinquetur in Sion, et residuus in Jerusalem, sanctus, omnis qui scriptus est in vita in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And it will be that those who are left in Zion, and those who remain in Jerusalem, will be holy, all who are written in the book of life in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Si abluerit Dominus sordes filiarum Sion, et sanguinem Jerusalem eliminaverit de medio ejus, in spiritu justitiæ, et in spiritu succensionis.
verses.english: When the Lord washes away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and purges the blood of Jerusalem from within her, by the spirit of justice and the spirit of fire.

verses.latin: Et creabit Dominus super omnem locum montis Sion, et super congregationes ejus, nubem per diem, et fumum, et splendorem ignis flammantis in nocte: super omnem enim gloriam protectio.
verses.english: The Lord will create a cloud by day and smoke by night over the whole area of Mount Zion, and over all its assemblies; the glory will be a defense for all.

verses.latin: Et erit tabernaculum in umbraculum diei a fervore, et in securitatem, et absconditorium a tempestate, et a pluvia.
verses.english: There will be a tent to provide shade from the heat of the day, and a place of refuge and a shelter from the storm and from the rain.

verses.latin: Cantabo dilecto meo canticum patruelis mei in vineam eius. Vineam habuit dilectus meus in colle fertile.
verses.english: I will sing to my Beloved a song of my cousin concerning his vineyard. My Beloved had a vineyard on a fertile hill.

verses.latin: Et sepivit eam, et lapides elegit ex illa, et plantavit eam electam: et aedificavit turrim in medio eius, et torcular exstruxit in ea: et exspectavit ut faceret uvas, et fecit labruscas.
verses.english: He enclosed it, and cleared the stones from it. He planted the best vines. He built a tower in the middle, and he built a wine press in it. He waited for it to yield grapes, but it yielded wild grapes.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, habitatores Ierusalem, et viri Iuda, iudicate inter me et vineam meam.
verses.english: So now, inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge between me and my vineyard.

verses.latin: Quid est quod debui ultra facere vineae meae, et non feci ei? quod exspectavi ut faceret uvas, et fecit labruscas?
verses.english: What more could I have done for my vineyard, that I have not done? Why did I wait for it to yield grapes, but it yielded wild grapes?

verses.latin: Et nunc ostendam vobis quid ego faciam vineae meae: auferam sepem eius, et erit in direptionem; diruam maceriam eius, et erit in conculcationem.
verses.english: Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away its hedge, and it shall be destroyed; I will break down its wall, and it shall be trodden down.

verses.latin: Et ponam eam desolatam; non putabitur, neque sarcietur, et ascendent vepres et spinas: et nubibus mandabo ne pluant super eam imbrem.
verses.english: I will make it desolate; it shall not be pruned, nor shall it be tilled. Thorns and thistles shall come up, and I will command the clouds not to rain upon it.

verses.latin: Vineam enim Domini exercituum domus Israel est: et viri Iuda, germen eius: et exspectavi ut faceret iudicium, et ecce iniquitas; et iustitiam, et ecce clamor.
verses.english: For the vineyard of the Lord of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah are its chosen plants. I waited for judgment, but behold, oppression; and for justice, but behold, a cry.

verses.latin: Vae qui coniungitis domum ad domum, et agrum agro copulatis, ut veniatis ad alterum: numquid habitabitis soli in medio terrae?
verses.english: Woe to those who join house to house, and add field to field, so that you come to another's property. Will you alone dwell in the midst of the earth?

verses.latin: In auribus meis inquit Dominus exercituum, quia multa domus desolatae erunt, grandes et insignes sine habitatore.
verses.english: In my ears, the Lord of hosts said, "Surely many houses shall be desolate, great and beautiful, without inhabitant.

verses.latin: Nam decem iugera vineae unum vas vini dabunt, et modius sementis faciet sextarium.
verses.english: For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath of wine, and a bushel of seed shall yield only a quart.

verses.latin: Vae qui mane surgitis ad ebrietatem sequendam, et potationem inebriati, usque ad vesperam, ut vino ferventes sitis.
verses.english: Woe to those who rise early in the morning to follow drunkenness, who linger over wine until late in the evening, and are inflamed by wine.

verses.latin: In cithara et lyra, et tympano, et tibia, et vino, opera eorum: et opus Domini non respiciunt, nec opera manuum eius considerant.
verses.english: In harp and lyre, tambourine and flute, and wine, are their works, but they do not regard the work of the Lord, nor do they consider the work of his hands.

verses.latin: Propterea captivus ductus est populus meus, quia non habuit scientiam: et gloria eius in fame, et multitudo eius siti exaruit.
verses.english: Therefore my people have been led captive, because they have no knowledge, and their glory is famished, and their multitude is dried up with thirst.

verses.latin: Idcirco dilatavit infernus animam suam, et aperuit os suum absque ulla mensura: et descendent fortes eius, et populus eius, et sublimes, et iucundissimi.
verses.english: Therefore hell has enlarged its soul, and opened its mouth without limit, and its glorious and famous people shall go down there.

verses.latin: Et incurvabitur homo, et humiliabitur vir, et oculi elatorum deprimentur.
verses.english: And the man shall be bowed down, and the mighty man shall be brought low, and the eyes of the proud shall be humbled.

verses.latin: Et exaltabitur Dominus exercituum in iudicio, et Deus sanctus sanctificabitur in iustitia.
verses.english: And the Lord of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and the holy God shall be sanctified in justice.

verses.latin: Et pascentur agni juxta morem suum, et solitudo crassabitur in transitu pingue.
verses.english: And the lambs shall feed as in their pasture, and the waste places of the fat shall be for the wanderers.

verses.latin: Vae qui trahitis iniquitatem in funibus vanitatis, et quasi funiculum trahit plaustrum peccatum!
verses.english: Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as with a cart rope.

verses.latin: Qui dicitis: Festinet, et cito veniat opus eius, ut videamus: et properet consilium Sancti Israel, et veniat, ut sciamus.
verses.english: Who say, "Let him hasten, and let his work come quickly, that we may see it; and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, that we may know it!"

verses.latin: Vae qui dicitis malum bonum, et bonum malum: ponentes tenebras lucem, et lucem tenebras: ponentes amarum dulce, et dulce amarum!
verses.english: Woe to those who call evil good and good evil, who put darkness for light and light for darkness, who put bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter!

verses.latin: Vae qui sapientes estis in oculis vestris, et prudentes coram vobis!
verses.english: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight!

verses.latin: Vae qui potentes estis ad bibendum vinum, et viri fortes ad miscendam ebrietatem!
verses.english: Woe to those who are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink!

verses.latin: Qui iustificant impium pro muneribus, et iustitiam iusti auferunt ab eo!
verses.english: Who justify the wicked for a bribe, and take away the justice of the just!

verses.latin: Ideo sicut lingua vorat stipulam, ita radix eorum putredo est, et flos eorum sicut pulvis in ventum: quia spreverunt legem Domini exercituum, et eloquium Sancti Israel blasphemaverunt.
verses.english: Therefore, as the tongue of fire devours the stubble, so their root shall be rottenness, and their flower shall go up like dust in the wind: because they have despised the law of the Lord of hosts, and have blasphemed the word of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Propter hoc iratus est furor Domini in populum suum, et extendit manum suam super eos, et percussit eos: et conturbati sunt montes, et facti sunt sicut cadavera in medio platearum.
verses.english: Therefore the anger of the Lord has been kindled against his people, and he has stretched out his hand against them, and struck them, and the mountains were troubled, and they were made as corpses in the middle of the streets.

verses.latin: Super hoc non est aversum furor eius, sed adhuc manus eius extenta.
verses.english: For all this his anger is not turned away, and his hand is stretched out still.

verses.latin: Et levabit vexillum gentibus procul, et sibilabit eis de finibus terrae: et ecce velociter cito venient.
verses.english: He will lift up an ensign to the nations from afar, and he will whistle to them from the ends of the earth; and behold, they will come quickly, swiftly.

verses.latin: Non est qui fatigans, neque qui dormiat, neque qui declinet, neque qui solvat cingulum lumborum suorum, neque qui solvat corrigiam calceamenti.
verses.english: There is none who is weary or stumbles among them; none will slumber or sleep. Nor will the belt of their loins be untied, nor the strap of their sandals be broken.

verses.latin: Sagittae eorum acutae, et omnes arcus eorum intenti: ungulae equorum eorum quasi silex, et rotae curruum quasi turbo.
verses.english: Their arrows are sharp, and all their bows are bent. The hooves of their horses are like flint, and the wheels of their chariots are like a whirlwind.

verses.latin: Rugitus eorum quasi leonis, rugient: et frendent sicut catuli leonum, et fremitus eorum sicut mare fremet: et aspicies terram, et ecce tenebrae tribulationis, et lux obtenebrata est in caligine eius.
verses.english: Their roaring is like a lion, and they will roar; and they will snarl like lions. They will roar like the sea, and if you look at the land, behold, there is darkness of distress, and the light is darkened in its gloom.

verses.latin: Anno quo mortuus est rex Ozia, vidi Dominum sedentem super solium excelsum et elevatum: et ea quae sub eo erant, replebant templum.
verses.english: In the year King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord seated on His throne, high and lifted up; and the temple was filled with the train of His robe.

verses.latin: Seraphim stabant super illud: sex alae uni, et sex alae alteri: duabus velabant faciem eorum, et duabus velabant pedes eorum, et duabus volabant.
verses.english: Above Him stood the Seraphim: each one had six wings; with two wings they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with two they were flying.

verses.latin: Et clamabat alter ad alterum, et dicebat: Sanctus, sanctus, sanctus Dominus Deus exercituum: plena est omnis terra gloria ejus.
verses.english: And one cried to another and said: "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God of hosts; the whole earth is full of His glory."

verses.latin: Et commota sunt superliminaria cardinum a voce clamantis, et domus impleta est fumo.
verses.english: And the doorposts of the temple shook at the voice of the one crying out, and the house was filled with smoke.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Vae mihi, quia tacui, quia vir inmundus labiorum ego sum, et in medio populi inmundis labiis habito, et regem Dominum exercituum vidi oculis meis.
verses.english: Then I said: "Woe is me, for I have been silent, because I am a man of unclean lips and I live among a people of unclean lips, and my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts!"

verses.latin: Et volavit ad me unus de Seraphim, et in manu ejus calculus, quem forcipe tulerat de altari.
verses.english: Then one of the Seraphim flew to me, and in his hand was a live coal, which he had taken with tongs from the altar.

verses.latin: Et tetigit os meum, et dixit: Ecce tetigit hoc labia tua, et auferetur iniquitas tua, et peccatum tuum expiabitur.
verses.english: And he touched my mouth and said: "Behold, this has touched your lips, and your iniquity is taken away, and your sin will be purged."

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem Domini, dicentis: Quem mittam, et quis ibit nobis? Et dixi: Ecce ego, mitte me.
verses.english: And I heard the voice of the Lord saying, "Whom shall I send, and who will go for us?" And I said: "Here I am, send me."

verses.latin: Et dixit: Vade, et dic populo huic: Audite audientes, et nolite intelligere: et videte videntes, et nolite cognoscere.
verses.english: And He said: "Go, and tell this people: 'Keep on hearing, but do not understand; keep on seeing, but do not perceive.'"

verses.latin: Excæca cor populi hujus, et aures ejus aggrava, et oculos ejus claude: ne forte videat oculis, et auribus audiat, et corde intelligat, et convertatur, et sanem eum.
verses.english: Harden the hearts of this people, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes: lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and I heal them."

verses.latin: Et dixi: Usquequo Domine? Et dixit: Donec desolentur civitates absque habitatore, et domus absque homine, et terra deserta desoletur.
verses.english: And I said: "How long, O Lord?" And He said: "Until the cities are laid waste, without inhabitants, and the houses without people, and the land is utterly desolate."

verses.latin: Et auferetur homo, et relinquetur multa in medio terrae.
verses.english: And the Lord will take away the people, and there will be much left in the midst of the land.

verses.latin: Et erit adhuc in ea decimam, et convertetur, et erit in consummationem: sicut terebinthus, et sicut quercus, quae jacit radicem suam in terra: semen sanctum erit id quod steterit in ea.
verses.english: And if there is still a tenth part left in it, it will return, and it will be consumed, as a terebinth and as an oak that casts its root in the earth, the holy seed will stand in it.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus Ahaz filii Ioatham filii Oziæ regis Iuda, abiit Rasin rex Syriæ, et Phacee filius Romeliæ rex Israël, in Ierusalem ad pugnandum contra eam, et non potuerunt expugnare eam.
verses.english: When Ahaz, the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, was king of Judah, Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to fight against it, but they couldn't conquer it.

verses.latin: Nuntiatum est autem domui David, dicentes: Syrus requiescit super Ephraim. Et commotum est cor ejus, et cor populi ejus, sicut moventur ligna silvarum a facie venti.
verses.english: The news came to the house of David that the Syrians were allied with Ephraim. The heart of the king was disturbed, and the heart of his people was disturbed, just as the trees of the forest are shaken by the wind.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Isaiam: Egressus es, obvia regi Ahaz, tu et Iasub filius tuus, ad extremum aquæductus piscinae superioris, in via campi Fuller.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Isaiah: "Go out to meet King Ahaz, you and your son, near the end of the aqueduct of the upper pool, on the road to the fuller's field."

verses.latin: Et dices ei: Cave, et tace: ne timeas, et cor tuum ne formidet a duobus caudis titionum istorum fumigantium, in ira furoris Rasin, et Syriæ, et filii Romeliæ.
verses.english: Say to him, 'Be careful, and keep calm. Don't be afraid, and don't let your heart be troubled by the two smoldering stumps of these firebrands, in the fury of Rezin, the Syrians, and the son of Remaliah.'

verses.latin: Quia statuit contra te malum Syria, et Ephraim, et filius Romeliæ, dicentes:
verses.english: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have plotted evil against you, saying:

verses.latin: Eamus contra Iudam, et adfligamus eum, et dividamus eum, et partiamur eum, et constituamus in medio ejus filium Tabeel regem.
verses.english: 'Let us go against Judah, and weaken it, and divide it, and take it for ourselves, and set up the son of Tabeel as king in its midst.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Non stabit, et non erit.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: "It shall not stand, and it shall not happen."

verses.latin: Quia caput Syriæ, Damascum: et caput Damasci, Rasin: et adhuc sexaginta et quinque anni, et conteretur Ephraim ut non sit populus.
verses.english: Because the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin, and within sixty-five years, Ephraim will be so broken that it will no longer be a people.

verses.latin: Et caput Ephraim, Samaria: et caput Samariæ, filius Romeliæ. Nisi credideritis, non permanebitis.
verses.english: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. Unless you believe, you will not endure."

verses.latin: Et addidit Dominus loqui ad Ahaz, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke again to Ahaz, saying:

verses.latin: Pete tibi signum a Domino Deo tuo, in profundum inferni, sive in excelsum.
verses.english: "Ask a sign for yourself from the Lord your God, either in the depths below or in the heights above."

verses.latin: Et dixit Ahaz: Non petam, et non tentabo Dominum.
verses.english: But Ahaz said, "I will not ask, and I will not test the Lord."

verses.latin: Et dixit: Audite ergo, domus David: Numquid parum vobis est, molestos esse hominibus, quod et Deo molesti estis?
verses.english: Then Isaiah said: "Hear now, O house of David: Is it not enough for you to be wearying to men, that you are also wearying to God?

verses.latin: Propter hoc dabit Dominus ipse vobis signum. Ecce virgo concipiet, et pariet filium, et vocabit nomen ejus Emmanuel.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord Himself will give you a sign: Behold, the Virgin shall conceive, and bear a Son, and shall call His name Emmanuel.

verses.latin: Butyrum et mel comedet, ut sciat reprobare malum, et eligere bonum.
verses.english: He shall eat butter and honey, so that He may know how to reject evil and choose good.

verses.latin: Quia antequam sciat puer reprobare malum, et eligere bonum, derelinquetur terra, quam tu abhorres, a facie duorum regum ejus.
verses.english: For before the Child knows how to refuse evil and choose good, the land which you dread shall be forsaken by the face of its two kings.

verses.latin: Adducet Dominus super te, et super populum tuum, et super domum patris tui, dies, qui non venerunt a die separationis Ephraim a Iuda, regem Assyriorum.
verses.english: The Lord will bring upon you, and upon your people, and upon your father's house, days that have not come since the day that Ephraim separated from Judah--the king of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: sibilabit Dominus muscam, quæ est in extremis rivorum AEgypti, et apem, quæ est in terra Assur.
verses.english: In that day, the Lord will whistle for the fly that is in the farthest parts of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

verses.latin: Et venient, et requiescent omnes in torrentibus vallium, et in cavernis saxorum, et super omnes sentes, et super universas pascuas.
verses.english: They will come, and they will all rest in the steep valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and on all thorns, and on all pastures.

verses.latin: In die illa radet Dominus in manu conductitia, in his qui sunt trans Flumen, in manu regis Assur, caput, et pilos pedum: et barbam auferet.
verses.english: In that day, the Lord will shave with a hired razor, those who are beyond the River, with the king of Assyria's hand, the head, and the hair of the feet, and will take away the beard.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: pascere vir vivam vaccam, et duas oves.
verses.english: And it shall be in that day, that a man shall feed a young cow, and two sheep.

verses.latin: Et erit prae multitudine lactantium, dabit lac, et comedet butyrum: butyrum enim et mel comedet omnis qui relictus fuerit in terra.
verses.english: And because of the abundance of milk they give, he will eat butter, because butter and honey will be eaten by everyone who is left in the land.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: erit omnis locus, ubi fuerant mille vineæ, ad mille argenteos, in tribulis et vepribus.
verses.english: And it shall be in that day, that every place where there were a thousand vines, worth a thousand silver coins, shall be for thorns and briers.

verses.latin: Cum sagittis et arcubus veniet illuc, quia erunt omnis terra tribuli et vepres.
verses.english: With arrows and bows they will come there, because all the land will be thorns and briers.

verses.latin: Et ad omnes montes, qui in falce sarculo sarrientur, non veniet timor tribulorum et veprum, sed erunt in pascuam boum, et in conculcationem pecorum.
verses.english: And on all the mountains that are cultivated with a hoe, you will not fear thorns and briers, but they will be for grazing cattle and for the treading of sheep.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Sume tibi librum grandem, et scribe in eo stilo hominis, Velox ad praedandum, festina ad diripiendum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: “Get a big book, and write on it with a human stylus: ‘Quick to plunder, hurry to take spoils.’”

verses.latin: Et adhibui mihi testes fideles, Urian sacerdotem, et Zachariam filium Barachiæ.
verses.english: I called reliable witnesses to myself, including Uria the priest, and Zechariah, the son of Barachiah.

verses.latin: Et accessi ad prophetissam, et concepit, et peperit filium. Et dixit Dominus ad me: Voca nomen ejus, Cito praeda, festina ad diripiendum.
verses.english: I went to the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son. And the Lord said to me: “Call his name, ‘Quick spoils, hurry to take spoils.’”

verses.latin: Quia antequam sciat puer dicere patrem et matrem, auferetur fortitudo Damasci, et spolia Samariæ, coram rege Assyriorum.
verses.english: Because before the child knows how to say ‘father’ and ‘mother,’ the power of Damascus will be taken away, along with the spoils of Samaria, before the king of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Et adjecit Dominus mihi loqui, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to me again, saying:

verses.latin: Pro eo quod abjecit populus iste aquas Siloë, quæ vadunt cum silentio, et suscepit Rasin, et filium Romeliæ:
verses.english: “Because this people has rejected the waters of Siloë, which flow quietly, and has embraced Rasin, and the son of Remaliah:

verses.latin: propter hoc ecce Dominus adducet super eos aquas fluminis fortes et multas, regem Assyriorum, et omnem gloriam ejus: et ascendet super omnes rivos ejus, et fluet super universos ripas ejus.
verses.english: for this reason, see, the Lord will bring upon them the strong and abundant waters of the river, the king of the Assyrians, and all his glory: and it will rise over all its channels, and will flow over all its banks.

verses.latin: Et ibit per Judam, inundans et transiliens, usque ad collum: et extendet alas suas implens latitudinem terræ tuæ, o Emmanuel.
verses.english: And it will go through Judah, overflowing and passing through, even to the neck: and it will stretch out its wings, filling the breadth of your land, O Emmanuel.

verses.latin: Conjungimini gentes, et vincimini, et audite, omnes de longinquo: confortamini, et vincimini. Accingimini, et vincimini.
verses.english: Be joined together, you peoples, and be overcome, and listen, all those far off: strengthen yourselves, and be overcome. Gird yourselves, and be overcome.

verses.latin: Inite consilium, et dissipabitur: loquimini verbum, et non fiet: quoniam nobiscum Deus.
verses.english: Take counsel together, and it will be broken: speak a word, and it will not happen: for God is with us.

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus ad me in manu forti, et docuit me, ne irem in via populi istius, dicens:
verses.english: For thus the Lord said to me with a strong hand, and taught me not to go the way of this people, saying:

verses.latin: Ne dicatis conjurationem: omnia enim quæ loquitur populus iste, conjuratio est: et timorem eorum ne timueritis, neque paveatis.
verses.english: “Do not call it a conspiracy: for everything that this people speaks is a conspiracy: and do not fear their fear, nor be afraid.

verses.latin: Dominum exercituum ipsum sanctificate: ipse timor vester, et ipse pavor vester.
verses.english: Sanctify the Lord of hosts himself: let Him be your fear, and let Him be your terror.

verses.latin: Et erit in sanctificationem, et in lapidem offensionis, et in petram scandali duabus domibus Israël, in laqueum et in ruinam habitatoribus Jerúsalem.
verses.english: And He will become a sanctuary, and a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offense to the two houses of Israel, a snare and a ruin to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et impingent in eis plurimi, et cadent, et conterentur, et irretientur, et capientur.
verses.english: And many will stumble against them, and will fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.

verses.latin: Liga testimonium, signa legem in discipulis meis.
verses.english: Bind up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.

verses.latin: Et exspectabo Dominum, qui abscondit faciem suam a domo Jacob, et sperabo in eum.
verses.english: And I will wait for the Lord, who hides His face from the house of Jacob, and I will hope in Him.

verses.latin: Ecce ego et pueri, quos dedit mihi Dominus, in signum, et in prodigium in Israël a Domino exercituum, qui habitat in monte Sion.
verses.english: Behold, I and the children whom the Lord has given to me, are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the Lord of hosts, who dwells on Mount Zion.

verses.latin: Et cum dixerint vobis: Quærite a pythonibus, et a divinis, qui strident in incantationibus suis: numquid non populus a Deo suo quæret? pro vivis a mortuis?
verses.english: And when they say to you: “Seek out those who consult spirits and diviners, who chirp and mutter in their incantations: should not a people seek their God? Should they seek the living from the dead?

verses.latin: Ad legem magis et testimonium. Quod si non dixerint juxta verbum hoc, non erit eis aurora.
verses.english: Turn to the law and the testimony. If they do not speak according to this word, they will have no dawn.

verses.latin: Et transibit per eam, oppressa et esuriens: et cum esurierit, irascetur, et maledicet Regem suum, et Deum suum, et suspiciet sursum.
verses.english: And it will pass through it, oppressed and hungry: and when it is hungry, it will be angry, and will curse its king and its God, and will look up.

verses.latin: Et respiciet terram, et ecce tribulatio et tenebræ, caligo et angustia, et obscuritas opprimens, et non poterit ex angustia dissipari.
verses.english: And it will look to the earth, and see distress and darkness, gloom and anguish, and a darkness oppressing, and it will not be able to escape from the anguish.

verses.latin: Populus, qui ambulabat in tenebris, vidit lucem magnam: qui habitabant in regione umbræ mortis, lux orta est eis.
verses.english: The people who were walking in darkness saw a great light: those who inhabited the region of the shadow of death, light arose for them.

verses.latin: Multiplicasti gentem, et non magnasti lætitiam: lætabuntur coram te, sicut qui lætantur in messe, quomodo exultant victores capta præda.
verses.english: You multiplied the people, but You didn't increase their joy: they will rejoice before you, just as those who rejoice in the harvest, in the way victors exult with seized spoils.

verses.latin: Jugum enim onus ejus, et virgam humeri ejus, et virgam exactoris ejus contrivisti, sicut in die Madian.
verses.english: For the yoke of His burden, and the rod of His shoulder, and the rod of His oppressor, You have shattered, as in the day of Midian.

verses.latin: Quia omnis vasatis cum tumultu, et cum sanguine, et ignis escae.
verses.english: Because all of the boots of the war are with tumult, and with blood, and with fire as fuel.

verses.latin: Parvulus enim natus est nobis, et filius datus est nobis, cujus imperium super humerum ejus: et vocabitur nomen ejus, Admirabilis, consiliarius, Deus fortis, pater futuri sæculi, princeps pacis.
verses.english: For a child is born to us, and a son is given to us, whose government is upon his shoulder: and His name will be called Wonderful, Counselor, Strong God, Father of the age to come, Prince of Peace.

verses.latin: Multiplicabitur ejus imperium, et pacis non erit finis: super solium David, et super regnum ejus sedebit, ut confirmet illud et corroboret in judicio et justitia, amodo et usque in sempiternum. Zelus Domini exercituum faciet hoc.
verses.english: His government will be multiplied, and there will be no end of peace: He will sit upon the throne of David, and upon His kingdom, to establish it and strengthen it in judgment and justice, from now on and forever. The zeal of the Lord of hosts will do this.

verses.latin: Verbum misit Dominus in Jacob, et cecidit in Israël.
verses.english: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it fell on Israel.

verses.latin: Sciet omnis populus, Ephraim et habitator Samariæ, qui in superbia et arrogantia cordis dicunt:
verses.english: All the people will know, Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, who in pride and arrogance of heart, say:

verses.latin: Lateres ceciderunt, sed quadris lapidibus ædificabimus: sycomoros succiderunt, sed cedros implebimus.
verses.english: The bricks have fallen, but we will rebuild with squared stones: the sycamores were cut down, but we will fill with cedars.

verses.latin: Et elevavit Dominus adversarios Rasin super eum, et inimicos ejus concitavit.
verses.english: And the Lord raised up the adversaries of Rasin over him, and roused up his enemies.

verses.latin: Syriam, ex oriente, et Philisthinorum ex occidente: qui devoraverunt Israël toto ore. In omnibus his non est aversus furor ejus, sed adhuc manus ejus extenta.
verses.english: Syria from the east, and the Philistines from the west: who devoured Israel with their whole mouth. In all these, His wrath is not turned away, but still His hand is outstretched.

verses.latin: Et populus non est reversus ad percutientem se, et Dominum exercituum non quæsierunt.
verses.english: And the people have not turned back to Him who strikes them, nor have they sought the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et amputavit Dominus ab Israël caput et caudam, senem et junctiorem, in die una: caput, propheta, et caudam, doctor mendacii.
verses.english: And the Lord cut off from Israel head and tail, the elder and the younger, in one day: the head, the prophet, and the tail, the doctor of lies.

verses.latin: Et erant qui beatificarent populum istum, et erant qui beatificarentur ab eo: ergo qui beatificant te, decipiunt te, et viam pedum tuorum dissipant.
verses.english: And there were those who blessed this people, and there were those who were blessed by it: therefore those who bless you deceive you, and they destroy the way of your feet.

verses.latin: Propter hoc in gaudio suo non lætabitur Dominus, et super pupillum ejus non miserebitur: propter hoc erunt, qui de juventute ejus gaudebunt, et viduæ ejus non miserebitur.
verses.english: Because of this, the Lord will not rejoice in His joy, and will not have mercy on His orphan: because of this, there will be those who will rejoice in his youth, and He will not have mercy on his widow.

verses.latin: Quia omnis populus, et qui loquuntur nequitiam: in omnibus his non est aversus furor ejus, sed adhuc manus ejus extenta.
verses.english: Because all the people and those who speak wickedness: in all these, His wrath is not turned away, but still His hand is outstretched.

verses.latin: Quoniam succensa est quasi ignis nequitia, spinas et vepres devorabit, et succendet ea silvas, et involvet fumo elationis.
verses.english: Because wickedness is kindled as a fire, it will devour thorns and briers, and it will burn the forests, and will envelop the smoke of the elevation.

verses.latin: In ira Domini exercituum contristata est terra, et factus est populus cibus ignis: vir fratri suo non pepercit.
verses.english: In the wrath of the Lord of hosts, the earth is distressed, and the people have become food for the fire: man did not spare his brother.

verses.latin: Comedet ad dexteram, et esuriet: et comedet ad sinistram, et non saturabitur: vir carnem brachii sui comederit:
verses.english: He will eat to the right, and will hunger: and he will eat to the left, and will not be satisfied: man will eat the flesh of his own arm:

verses.latin: Manasses Ephraim, et Ephraim Manassen, et ambo simul in Juda. In omnibus his non est aversus furor ejus, sed adhuc manus ejus extenta.
verses.english: Manasseh against Ephraim, and Ephraim against Manasseh, and both together against Judah. In all these, His wrath is not turned away, but still His hand is outstretched.

verses.latin: Vae qui condunt leges iniquas, et scribentes iniustitiam scripserunt:
verses.english: Woe to those who make unjust laws, and write that which is against justice:

verses.latin: Ut opprimerent in judicio pauperes, et vim facerent causae humilium populi mei: ut sint viduarum praeda, et pupillorum praedam diripiant.
verses.english: They would oppress the poor in judgment, and force the cause of the lowly of my people: that they may take widows for prey, and rob the orphans.

verses.latin: Quid facietis in die visitationis, et calamitatis procul venientis? ad quem confugietis pro auxilio? et ubi derelinquetis gloriam vestram?
verses.english: What will you do in the day of visitation, and of the calamity coming from afar? To whom will you flee for help? And where will you leave your glory?

verses.latin: Absque eo ut flectamini sub vinclis, et sub cadaveribus interfectorum corruatis: in his omnibus non est aversus furor ejus, sed adhuc manus ejus extenta.
verses.english: Unless you are bent down under the fetters, and fall under the corpses of the slain: in all these things, His anger has not turned away, but His hand is still stretched out.

verses.latin: Vae Assur, virga furoris mei, et baculus, in manu ejus indignationis meae.
verses.english: Woe to Assyria, the rod of my fury, and the staff in whose hand is my indignation.

verses.latin: In gentem simulatam mittam eum, et super populum furoris mei mandabo illi, ut auferat spolia, et diripiat praedam, et conculcet eum ut lutum platearum.
verses.english: I will send him against a dissembling nation, and I will give him orders against the people of my wrath, to take away the spoils, and to seize the prey, and to tread him down like the mire of the streets.

verses.latin: Ipse autem non sic arbitrabitur, et cor ejus non sic existimabit: sed ad conterendum erit in corde ejus, et ad delendum gentes non paucas.
verses.english: But he will not think this way, and his heart will not consider it this way: but it will be in his heart to destroy, and to cut off not a few nations.

verses.latin: Dicit enim: Numquid non principes mei simul reges sunt?
verses.english: For he says: “Are not my princes also kings?

verses.latin: Numquid non Chalanon sicut Carchemis? numquid non Emath sicut Arphan? numquid non Samaria sicut Damasco?
verses.english: Is not Chalanon just like Carchemis? Is not Emath just like Arphan? Is not Samaria just like Damascus?

verses.latin: Quia dixit manus mea sicut regna idolorum, et simulacra eorum quae erant in Jerusalem et in Samaria.
verses.english: Because he said, “My hand has made the kingdoms of idols, and their images which were in Jerusalem and in Samaria.”

verses.latin: Numquid non sicut feci in Samaria et in idolis ejus, sic faciam in Jerusalem et in simulacris ejus?
verses.english: Shall I not, as I have done in Samaria and its idols, do the same in Jerusalem and its images?

verses.latin: Et erit cum expluerit Dominus omnia opera sua in monte Sion, et in Jerusalem, visitabo fructum magnanimitatis cordis regis Assur, et gloriam oculorum superbiae ejus.
verses.english: And it shall come to pass when the Lord has finished all His works on Mount Zion, and in Jerusalem, I will visit the fruit of the proud heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of the eyes of his pride.

verses.latin: Dixit enim: In fortitudine manus meae feci, et in sapientia mea intellexi: et abstuli fortitudinem populorum, et robur gentium contrivi.
verses.english: For he has said: “In the strength of my hand I have done it, and in my wisdom I have understood: and I have taken away the strength of the people, and broken the power of the nations.”

verses.latin: Et convertam super te Assur: et conteram te, sicut confringitur vas figuli.
verses.english: And I will turn against you, Assyria: and I will break you, as a potter’s vessel is broken.

verses.latin: Quia postquam compleverit Dominus omnia opera sua in monte Sion, et in Jerusalem, visitabo fructum cordis magni regis Assur, et gloriam oculorum superbiae ejus.
verses.english: For after the Lord has finished all His works on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, I will visit the fruit of the great heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of the eyes of his pride.

verses.latin: Propterea mittet Dominus exercituum in pinguibus ejus maciem, et sub gloria ejus succendet quasi incendium ignis.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord of hosts will send leanness upon his fat, and under his glory he will kindle a fire.

verses.latin: Et erit lumen Israël in igne, et sanctus ejus in flamma: et succendetur et devorabit spinas ejus et tribulos in die una.
verses.english: And the light of Israel will be as a fire, and his Holy One as a flame: and it will burn and devour his thorns and thistles in one day.

verses.latin: Et gloria silvae ejus et Carmeli, ab anima usque ad carnem consumetur: et erit quasi effugiens fugitivus.
verses.english: And the glory of his forest, and Carmel, will be consumed from the soul even to the flesh: and it will be as a fugitive fleeing away.

verses.latin: Et reliquiae lignorum silvae ejus, numerabuntur, et puer scribet ea.
verses.english: And the remaining trees of his forest will be numbered, and a child will write them down.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: non adjiciet reliquiae Israël, et qui salvati fuerint de domo Jacob, inniti super eum qui percusserat eos: sed innitentur super Dominum, Sanctum Israël, in veritate.
verses.english: And it will be in that day: the remnant of Israel, and those who will be saved from the house of Jacob, will no longer rely on him who struck them: but they will rely on the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

verses.latin: Reliquiae convertentur, reliquiae, inquam, Jacob, ad Deum fortissimum.
verses.english: A remnant will return, the remnant, I say, of Jacob, to the most powerful God.

verses.latin: Nam si fuerit populus tuus Israël quasi arena maris, reliquiae convertentur ex eo: consummatio praecisa redundabit justitia.
verses.english: For if your people, Israel, will be as the sand of the sea, the remnant of them will return: a consummation that is decreed with justice will overflow.

verses.latin: Consummationem enim, et praecisionem Dominus Deus exercituum faciet in medio universae terrae.
verses.english: For the Lord God of hosts will make a consummation, and a decree in the midst of the whole earth.

verses.latin: Propter hoc dicit Dominus Deus exercituum: Noli timere popule meus habitator Sion, a Assur: in virga percutiet te, et baculum suum levabit super te in via Ægypti.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God of hosts says: “Do not fear, my people, the inhabitant of Zion, from Assyria: with a rod he will strike you, and he will lift up his staff over you in the way of Egypt.”

verses.latin: Pauca enim post modicum, et consummabitur indignatio: et furor meus in interitu eorum.
verses.english: For yet a little while, and the indignation will be finished: and my fury in their destruction.

verses.latin: Et suscitabit super eum Dominus exercituum flagellum secundum plagam Madian in petra Oreb: et virgam suam super mare, et sublevabit eam in via Ægypti.
verses.english: And the Lord of hosts will stir up a scourge against him according to the slaughter of Midian in the rock of Oreb: and his rod over the sea, and he will lift it up in the way of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: auferetur onus ejus de umeris tuis, et jugum ejus de collo tuo, et auferetur jugum a facie tua.
verses.english: And it will be in that day: his burden will be taken away from your shoulders, and his yoke from your neck, and the yoke will be removed from your face.

verses.latin: Introibit in Ajath, transibit in Magron, apud Machmas commendabit sarcinas suas.
verses.english: He will enter into Ajath, he will pass through Magron, he will commend his baggage near Machmas.

verses.latin: Transierunt de Geba, et Loth filii: civitas Geba exspectat me: Rama pavit, Gabaath Saul fugit.
verses.english: They have passed from Geba, and Loth’s sons: the city of Geba expects me: Rama trembled, Gabaath of Saul has fled.

verses.latin: Clama filia Gallim: audi, Lesa: pauper Anathoth.
verses.english: Cry aloud, daughter of Gallim: hear, Lesa: poor Anathoth.

verses.latin: Madmenna migravit: habitatores Gebim congregati sunt.
verses.english: Madmenna has moved away: the inhabitants of Gebim are gathered together.

verses.latin: Adhuc hodie morabitur in Nob: agitabit manum suam super montem filiæ Sion, montem Jerusalem.
verses.english: Today he will yet stay in Nob: he will shake his hand over the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the mountain of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus Deus exercituum confringet vas cum horrore: et qui excelsi sunt statura, succidentur: et qui elati, humiliabuntur.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord God of hosts will break the vessel with horror: and those who are of great stature will be cut down: and those who are high, will be brought low.

verses.latin: Et succidetur saltus silvarum ferro, et Libanus cum excelsis cadet.
verses.english: And the forest of the trees will be cut down with iron, and Lebanon will fall with the high ones.

verses.latin: Et egredietur virga de radice Iesse, et flos de radice ejus ascendet.
verses.english: A new king will come from the lineage of Jesse, and a leader will rise from his roots.

verses.latin: Et requiescet super eum spiritus Domini: spiritus sapientiae et intellectus, spiritus consilii et fortitudinis, spiritus scientiae et pietatis.
verses.english: The Spirit of God will rest on him: a spirit of wisdom and understanding, a spirit of counsel and power, a spirit of knowledge and love of God.

verses.latin: Et implebit eum spiritus timoris Domini. Non secundum visionem oculorum judicabit, neque secundum auditu aurium arguet.
verses.english: He will be filled with fear and awe of God. He will not judge by mere appearances, nor decide by what he hears.

verses.latin: Sed judicabit in paupertate justorum, et arguet in mansuetudine terrae: et percutiet terram virga oris sui, et spiritu labiorum suorum interficiet impium.
verses.english: He will judge with justice for the poor and decide with equity for the oppressed. He will strike the land with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips he will slay the wicked.

verses.latin: Et erit justitia cingulum lumborum ejus: et fides cinctorium renium ejus.
verses.english: Righteousness will be the belt around his waist, and faithfulness the belt around his loins.

verses.latin: Habitabit lupus cum agno, et pardus cum haedo dormiet: vitulus, et leo, et ovis simul morabuntur, et puer parvus minabit eos.
verses.english: The wolf will live with the lamb, and the leopard will lie down with the kid; the calf and the lion and the fatling will be together, and a little child will lead them.

verses.latin: Vacca et ursa pascentur: simul requiescent pulli eorum: et leo quasi bos comedet paleas.
verses.english: The cow and the bear will graze; their young will lie down together; and the lion will eat straw like the ox.

verses.latin: Et pascetur infans ludens super foramine aspis: et in caverna reguli manum suam mittet puer parvulus.
verses.english: The nursing child will play over the hole of the asp, and the weaned child will put his hand on the viper’s den.

verses.latin: Non nocebunt, neque occident in universo monte sancto meo, quia repleta est terra scientia Domini, sicut aquae maris operientes.
verses.english: They will neither hurt nor destroy on all my holy mountain, for the earth will be filled with the knowledge of God as the waters cover the sea.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa radix Iesse, qui stat in signum populorum, ipsum gentes deprecabuntur, et erit sepulchrum ejus gloriosum.
verses.english: In that day the root of Jesse will stand as a signal for the peoples; the nations will seek him, and his resting place will be glorious.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: addet Dominus secundo manum suam ad possidendum reliquias populi sui, quae reliquae fuerunt de Assur, et de Aegypto, et de Phathros, et de Aethiopia, et de Elam, et de Sennaar, et de Emath, et de insulis maris.
verses.english: In that day the Lord will again lift his hand to recover the remnant of his people who are left from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, from Elam, from Shinar, from Hamath, and from the coastlands of the sea.

verses.latin: Et levabit signum in nationes, et congregabit profugos Israel, et dispersos Juda colliget a quatuor plagis terrae.
verses.english: He will raise a signal for the nations, and will assemble the banished of Israel, and gather the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

verses.latin: Et auferetur zelus Ephraim, et qui calumniabantur Juda peribunt: Ephraim non aemulabitur Judam, et Juda non pugnabit contra Ephraim.
verses.english: The jealousy of Ephraim will depart, and those who persecute Judah will be cut off; Ephraim will not envy Judah, and Judah will not harass Ephraim.

verses.latin: Sed volabunt in humeros Philisthinorum per mare: pariter spoliabunt filios orientis: Idumaeum et Moab manum eorum, et filii Ammon obedientes erunt eis.
verses.english: But they will swoop down on the shoulders of the Philistines in the west; together they will plunder the people of the east. They will lay their hand on Edom and Moab, and the Ammonites will obey them.

verses.latin: Et auferet Dominus linguam maris Aegypti, et ventilabit manum suam super flumen in fortitudine spiritus sui: et dividet illud in septem rivos, ita ut transeant per eam calceati.
verses.english: The Lord will utterly destroy the tongue of the Sea of Egypt; he will wave his hand over the River [Euphrates] with his scorching wind, and will split it into seven streams, so that one can cross on foot.

verses.latin: Et erit via reliquiis populi sui, qui reliqui fuerint de Assur: sicut fuit Israëli in die qua ascendit de terra Aegypti.
verses.english: There will be a highway for the remnant of his people who are left from Assyria, as there was for Israel when they came up from the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et dicies in die illa: Confitebor tibi, Domine, quoniam iratus es mihi, conversus est furor tuus, et consolatus es me.
verses.english: In that day, you will say, “I will give thanks to You, Lord, because though You were angry with me, Your anger has turned away, and You have comforted me.”

verses.latin: Ecce Deus salvator meus: fiduciam agam, et non timebo: quia fortitudo mea et laus mea Dominus, et factus est mihi in salutem.
verses.english: Behold, God is my Savior. I will be confident and will not be afraid, because the Lord is my strength and my praise. He has become my salvation.

verses.latin: Haurietis aquas in gaudio de fontibus Salvatoris.
verses.english: With joy, you will draw water from the fountains of salvation.

verses.latin: Et dicetis in die illa: Confitemini Domino, et invocate nomen ejus: notas facite in populis adinventiones ejus: mementote quoniam excelsum est nomen ejus.
verses.english: And you will say in that day, “Give thanks to the Lord and call upon His name. Make His works known among the peoples. Remember that His name is exalted.”

verses.latin: Cantate Domino, quoniam magnifice fecit: annuntiate hoc in universa terra.
verses.english: Sing praise to the Lord, because He has done great things. Proclaim this throughout all the earth.

verses.latin: Exulta et lauda, habitatio Sion: quia magnus in medio tui Sanctus Israël.
verses.english: Shout aloud and praise, O dwelling of Zion, for the Holy One of Israel is great in your midst.

verses.latin: Onus Babylonis, quod vidit Isaias, filius Amos.
verses.english: This is the prophecy of Babylon, which Isaiah, son of Amos, received.

verses.latin: Super montem sterilem levate signum, exaltate vocem, levate manum, et inportate in domos potentium.
verses.english: On a bare mountain, raise a banner. Raise your voice. Lift your hand, and let it reach the homes of the powerful.

verses.latin: Ego mandavi sanctificatis meis, et vocavi fortes meos in iram meam, exultantes in gloria mea.
verses.english: I have given a command to those I have set apart for my service, and I have summoned the strong ones to pour out my wrath on those who are boasting of their glory.

verses.latin: Sonitus turbæ in montibus, quasi populorum multorum, sonitus tumultus regnorum gentium congregatarum: Dominus exercituum præcepit bellatoribus.
verses.english: Listen to the uproar on the mountains, like a multitude of people. Hear the loud noise, the tumult of kingdoms assembled: The Lord of hosts has commanded warriors.

verses.latin: Venient de terra longinqua, a summitate cæli: Dominus et vasa furoris ejus, ut dissipent universam terram.
verses.english: They are coming from a faraway land, from the edge of the universe. The Lord and the instruments of his wrath will destroy the entire earth.

verses.latin: Ululate, quia prope est dies Domini, quia venit quasi vastatio a Fortissimo.
verses.english: Wail, for the day of the Lord is near, it will come like an unexpected disaster sent by the Almighty.

verses.latin: Propter hoc omnes manus dissolventur, et omne cor hominis contristabitur.
verses.english: Because of this, every hand will go limp, and every heart will be filled with sorrow.

verses.latin: Et conterentur, formidines et dolores tenuerunt eos: quasi parturiens dolet, dolebunt; unusquisque in proximo suo stupescet; facies flammae facies eorum.
verses.english: They will be terrified, and fear and pain will grip them. They will writhe in agony, like a woman giving birth. They will look in shock at each other; their faces will be aflame.

verses.latin: Ecce dies Domini veniet durus, et iræ et furoris, ad ponendam terram in solitudinem, et peccatores ejus conterendos de ea.
verses.english: Behold, the day of the Lord will come, a cruel day, filled with wrath and anger, to make the land a wasteland, and to destroy the sinners who live in it.

verses.latin: Quoniam stellæ cæli, et splendor earum, non dabunt lumen suum: obtenebrabitur sol in ortu suo, et luna non ostendet lumen suum.
verses.english: The stars of the sky and their constellations will not give off their light. The sun will be darkened at its rising, and the moon will not shine.

verses.latin: Et visitabo super orbis mala, et super impios in iniquitate eorum; et quiescere faciam superbiam infidelium, et arrogantiam fortium humiliabo.
verses.english: I will punish the world for its evil, and the wicked for their sin. I will end the pride of the arrogant, and I will humble the arrogance of the mighty.

verses.latin: Et adducam homines pretiosiores auro: et viros magis quam aurum de Ophir.
verses.english: I will make people rarer than gold: men more valuable than the gold of Ophir.

verses.latin: Propter quod movebo cælum, et movebitur terra de loco suo, in ira Domini exercituum, et in die furoris ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, I will make the universe shake, and the earth will move from its place, in the wrath of the Lord of hosts, and in the day of his fury.

verses.latin: Et erit quasi cervus fugiens, et quasi ovis, et non erit qui congreget: unusquisque ad populum suum convertetur, et singuli ad terram suam fugient.
verses.english: They will be like a frightened deer, or like a sheep without a shepherd, and there will be no one to gather them together. Each will return to his own people, and each will flee to his own land.

verses.latin: Omnis qui inventus fuerit, interficietur: et universi qui reliqui fuerint, gladio cadent.
verses.english: Everyone who is captured will be killed, and all who remain will fall by the sword.

verses.latin: Infantes eorum contundentur coram oculis eorum: domus eorum diripientur, et uxores eorum opprimetur.
verses.english: Their children will be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their homes will be plundered, and their wives will be raped.

verses.latin: Ecce ego suscitabo super eos Medos, qui argentum non quærunt, nec aurum cupiunt.
verses.english: Behold, I will stir up against them the Medes, who do not care for silver, nor are they greedy for gold.

verses.latin: Et arcus puerorum conterent, et fructum ventris non miserebuntur, et filiorum oculus non parcet.
verses.english: Their bows will crush the young men. They will show no compassion for the fruit of the womb, nor will their eyes pity the children.

verses.latin: Et erit Babylon, gloria regnorum, decor superbiæ Chaldæorum, sicut subversio Dei, et sicut Gomorra et Amorrha.
verses.english: Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the pride of the Chaldeans, will be like Sodom and Gomorrah when God destroyed them.

verses.latin: Non habitabitur in ea ultra in perpetuum, nec ædificabitur usque ad generationem et generationem: nec ponet ibi tentorium Arabes, nec pascent ibi pastores.
verses.english: It will never be inhabited again, nor will it be rebuilt from generation to generation. No Arab will pitch his tent there, and no shepherds will rest there.

verses.latin: Sed requiescent ibi bestiæ, et implebuntur domus eorum draconibus, et habitabunt ibi struthiones, et pilosi ibi saltitabunt.
verses.english: But wild animals will rest there, and the houses will be filled with jackals. Ostriches will dwell there, and hairy demons will leap around.

verses.latin: Et respondebunt ibi ululæ in domibus ejus, et sirenes in deliciis: et brevi veniet tempus ejus, et dies ejus non prolongabuntur.
verses.english: Hyenas will howl in its fortresses, and wild dogs will howl in its luxurious palaces. Its time is almost here, and its days will not be prolonged.

verses.latin: In die qua requiem dederit tibi Deus a labore tuo, et a motu tuo, et a servitute tua dura, qua ante servieras,
verses.english: In the day when God gives you rest from your hard labor, and your wandering, and your harsh servitude, in which you formerly served,

verses.latin: tolles parabolam hanc contra regem Babylonis, et dices:
verses.english: you will recite this parable against the king of Babylon, saying:

verses.latin: Quomodo cessavit exactor? Quievit tribus?
verses.english: “How has the oppressor ceased? The exactor, gone?

verses.latin: Contrivit Dominus baculum impiorum, virgam dominantium:
verses.english: The Lord has broken the staff of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers:

verses.latin: qui percutiebat populos in indignatione plaga insanabili, qui subjiciebat in nationibus in furore, cum persecutione insanabili.
verses.english: who struck the peoples with an incurable wound in anger, who subdued the nations in fury, with an unceasing persecution.

verses.latin: Qui percutiebat populos in indignatione plaga insanabili, qui subjiciebat in nationibus in furore, cum persecutione insanabili.
verses.english: He struck peoples with an incurable wound, and subdued the nations with fury, with a persecution that never ceased.

verses.latin: Quomodo cecidisti de caelo, lucifer, qui mane oriebaris? Corruisti in terram, qui vulnerabas gentes?
verses.english: How have you fallen from the sky, O Lucifer, who rose in the morning? You have fallen to the earth, who wounded the nations?

verses.latin: Qui dicebas in corde tuo: In caelum ascendam, super astra Dei exaltabo solium meum: sedebo in monte testamenti, in lateribus aquilonis:
verses.english: You said in your heart: “I will ascend into the sky, above the stars of God I will raise my throne, I will sit on the mountain of the covenant, on the sides of the north:”

verses.latin: ascendam super altitudinem nubium, similis ero Altissimo.
verses.english: “I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, and I will be like the Most High.”

verses.latin: Verumtamen in infernum detraheris, in profundum lacus.
verses.english: Yet you will be brought down to hell, to the depths of the pit.

verses.latin: Qui viderant te, inclinabuntur super te, et dicent: Iste est vir, qui conturbabat terram, qui movebat regna,
verses.english: Those who see you will gaze at you, and say: “Is this the man who troubled the earth, who moved kingdoms,

verses.latin: qui posuit orbem solitudinem, et urbes destruxit, qui vinctos suos non aperiebat carcerem?
verses.english: who made the world a wilderness and destroyed cities, who did not open the prison to his bound ones?”

verses.latin: Universi reges gentium universi dormierunt in gloria, singuli in domibus suis.
verses.english: All the kings of the nations have slept in glory, each in their own houses.

verses.latin: Tu autem ejectus es de sepulcro tuo, quasi germen abortivum: opertus es interfectis gladio, et descendentibus in fundamenta laci, quasi cadaver putridum.
verses.english: But you are cast out of your tomb like an aborted branch, covered with the slain by the sword, and by those descending to the foundations of the pit, like a rotting corpse.

verses.latin: Non habitabis cum eis in sepulcro: quia tu terram tuam disperdidisti, tu populum tuum interfecisti: non reputabitur in sempiternum semen pessimorum.
verses.english: You will not dwell with them in the tomb, because you have destroyed your land, you have slain your people: the seed of the wicked shall not be reckoned forever.

verses.latin: Parate filiis ejus occisionem, iniquitatem patrum ejus: ne consurgant, et hereditent terram, et impleant faciem orbis cum interfectione.
