verses.english: Prepare slaughter for his sons, for the iniquity of their fathers, lest they rise, and inherit the land, and fill the face of the world with slaughter.

verses.latin: Et consurgam super eos, dicit Dominus exercituum, et disperdam nomen Babylonis, et reliquias, et semen, et germen, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And I will rise up against them, says the Lord of hosts, and I will destroy the name of Babylon, and its remnants, and its seed, and its offspring, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ponam eam in possessionem ericii, et in paludes aquarum, et scopabo eam in scopa perditionis, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: And I will make it a possession for hedgehogs, and pools of water, and I will sweep it with the broom of destruction, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus exercituum, dicens: Quia sicut cogitavi, sic erit: et sicut mente tractavi, ita eveniet:
verses.english: The Lord of hosts has sworn, saying: “Surely, as I have thought, so shall it be, and as I have planned, so shall it happen:

verses.latin: ut conteram Assyrium in terra mea, et in montibus meis conculcabo eum: et auferetur ab eis jugum ejus, et onus ejus auferetur de humero eorum.
verses.english: “That I will break the Assyrian in my land, and on my mountains I will trample him down: and his yoke shall be taken away from them, and his burden shall be removed from their shoulder.”

verses.latin: Hoc est consilium quod cogitavi super universam terram: et haec est manus extenta super omnes gentes.
verses.english: This is the plan that I have planned over the whole earth, and this is the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.

verses.latin: Quia Dominus exercituum decrevit, et quis poterit infirmare? Et manus ejus extenta: et quis avertet eam?
verses.english: For the Lord of hosts has decreed, and who can make it void? And his hand is stretched out, and who can turn it back?

verses.latin: In anno quo mortuus est Achaz, facta est haec prophetia.
verses.english: In the year that Ahaz died, this prophecy was made:

verses.latin: Ne gaudeat Philisthaea universa, eo quod contritus sit virga percutientis te: quia de radice colubri egredietur regulus, et semen ejus absorbuit volucrem.
verses.english: Do not rejoice, O Philistia, because the rod that struck you is broken: for from the root of the serpent will come forth a basilisk, and his seed will devour the bird.

verses.latin: Et pascentur primi pauperum, et pauperes requiescent in confidentia: et perdam radicem tuam in fame, et reliquias tuas interficiam.
verses.english: And the firstborn of the poor shall be fed, and the poor will rest in confidence: and I will destroy your root with famine, and I will kill your remnants.

verses.latin: Ulula, porta; clama, civitas; contremisce, Philisthi, universa: quia fumus ab aquilone veniet, et non est qui recedat a turba ejus.
verses.english: Howl, gate; cry out, city; tremble, Philistia, all of you, for smoke will come from the north, and there is no one to retreat from his throng.

verses.latin: Quid respondebitur nuntiis gentis? Quia Dominus fundavit Sion, et in ea sperabunt pauperes populi ejus.
verses.english: What will be answered to the messengers of the nation? That the Lord has founded Zion, and in it the poor of his people will hope.

verses.latin: Onus Moab. Quoniam in nocte perierunt Ar Moab, siluit.
verses.english: The burden concerning Moab. In one night, Ar of Moab was destroyed, and it became silent.

verses.latin: Quoniam in nocte perierunt Moab, siluit. Et in nocte perierunt Chîr Moab, siluit.
verses.english: In one night, Moab was destroyed and became silent. In one night, Chîr of Moab was destroyed and became silent.

verses.latin: Ascendit domus, et Dîbon ad excelsa ad ploratum: super Nebo, et super Medaba Moab ululat: in cunctis capitibus ejus, cinciderunt barbas, omnis manus abscisa est.
verses.english: The house of Moab goes up to the high places to weep. Moab wails over Nebo and over Medaba. They have shaved off their beards and cut off every hand.

verses.latin: In plateis ejus cinxerunt saccum: in tectis ejus et in plateis ejus, ululatio descendit flens.
verses.english: In its streets, they wear sackcloth. On its rooftops and in its squares, there is wailing, weeping.

verses.latin: Cor meum ad Moab plorabit: usque ad Segor tribus vitulae: quoniam in ascensu Luith plorans ascendet: in via Horonaim, clamorem contritionis clamoris.
verses.english: My heart will wail for Moab. Its refugees flee to Zoar, and they weep as they go up the ascent of Luhith. On the road to Horonaim, they cry out a cry of destruction.

verses.latin: Aquae enim Nemrim desertae erunt: quoniam siccata est herba, defecit virens, non erat.
verses.english: The waters of Nimrim will be desolate, because the grass is dried up and the green things have withered, and there is nothing.

verses.latin: Ideo reliquias acquisitionis eorum et omne quod reservavere, trans Flumen salices ploratus.
verses.english: Therefore, the remnant of their possessions and everything they saved will be carried across the stream to the weeping willows.

verses.latin: Quoniam circuivit clamor in finibus Moab: usque ad Gallim ululatus ejus: usque ad puteum Elim ululatus ejus.
verses.english: For a cry has gone around the borders of Moab. Its wailing reached as far as Gallim and its cries as far as the well of Elim.

verses.latin: Plena est enim aqua Dimon sanguine: ponam super Dimon additamenta, leoni Moab, et reliquis terrae.
verses.english: For the waters of Dibon are full of blood. I will put more troubles on Dibon, and upon the lion of Moab, and upon the remnant of the land.

verses.latin: Mittite agnum dominatori terræ, de Petra deserti, ad montem filiæ Sion.
verses.english: Send tribute to the ruler of the land, from the desert fortress, to the mountain of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et erunt fili Moab quasi aves fugientes, et quasi pulli volantes foras de nido.
verses.english: And the people of Moab will be like frightened birds, or like fledglings driven from their nests.

verses.latin: Proponete consilium, celebrate judicium: pone umbram tuam in meridie quasi nocte, absconde fugientes, et ne prodas vagantes.
verses.english: Give advice and make decisions. Provide shade in the heat of the day, as if it were night. Protect the fugitives, and do not betray the wanderers.

verses.latin: Habitaverunt apud te profugi Moab, esto eis latibulum a facie subversoris: finitus est enim, consummatus est rapax, derelicta est præda, cessavit tribulatio.
verses.english: Let the outcasts of Moab stay with you; be a refuge from the destroyer. For the oppressor is finished, the devastation is complete, the plunder is ended, and the oppression has ceased.

verses.latin: Et præparabitur solium in misericordia, et sedebit super eo in vero, in tabernaculo David, judicans et quærens judicium, et velociter faciens justitiam.
verses.english: A throne will be established in mercy, and on it will sit, in truth, a judge of the house of David. He will be a just judge, seeking justice, and quick to do righteousness.

verses.latin: Audivimus superbiam Moab, superbum nimis, superbiorem quam gloriam suam, et iram ejus, et superbo ejus non fecit ut vera sint.
verses.english: We have heard of Moab's pride—exceedingly proud—and its arrogance and boastfulness. But his boasting is empty.

verses.latin: Ideo plorabit Moab ad Moab, universi ululabunt: ad fundamenta murorum fictiles, universi conturbati.
verses.english: Therefore Moab will wail for Moab, and everyone will lament. You will all mourn for the raisin cakes of Kir-hareseth.

verses.latin: Quia suburbana Hesebon contrita sunt, domini gentium calcabant vineam Sabama: flagellæ eorum venerunt usque ad Jazer, errantes in solitudine: propagati sunt rami ejus, transierunt mare.
verses.english: The terraces of Heshbon are destroyed. The lords of the nations have trampled the choice vines of Sibmah, whose branches extended across the sea, even to Jazer. They reached into the desert.

verses.latin: Ideo plorabo cum fletu Jazer vineam Sabama: irrigabo te lacrimis meis Hesebon et Eleale: quia vox calcantium irruit super messem tuam, et super vindemiam tuam.
verses.english: So I weep with the weeping of Jazer over the vines of Sibmah. I will drench you, Heshbon and Elealeh, with my tears, because the shouts of those who trample the grapes have fallen on your summer fruits and your harvest.

verses.latin: Et auferetur gaudium, et exultatio de pomariis, et in vineis non cantabunt, nec jubilabunt: calcantes in torcularibus, vinum ego cohibebo.
verses.english: Gladness and joy are gone from the orchards; in the vineyards there will be no singing or shouting; those who tread the winepress will not tread out wine.

verses.latin: Propterea viscera mea ad Moab quasi cithara sonabunt, et interiora mea ad Cir-Hares.
verses.english: Therefore, my heart mourns for Moab like a harp, and my inmost being for Kir-hareseth.

verses.latin: Cum apparuerit quod laboraverit Moab in excelso, et intraverit ad fanum suum orare, non valebit.
verses.english: When Moab appears, weary on the high places, and goes to its sanctuary to pray, it will not prevail.

verses.latin: Hoc est verbum quod locutus est Dominus ad Moab ex tunc.
verses.english: This is the word that the Lord has spoken concerning Moab in the past.

verses.latin: Et nunc locutus est Dominus, dicens: In tribus annis, quasi annis mercennarii, gloriosa Moab contemnetur cum omni multitudine magna: et reliquiæ paucae, nullæ valentes.
verses.english: But now the Lord says: 'Within three years, as a hired worker counts the years, Moab's glory will be despised, with all its great multitude, and those who remain will be few and feeble.'

verses.latin: Onus Damasci. Ecce, Damascum auferetur, et erit quasi acervus lapidum ruinosus.
verses.english: The prophecy concerning Damascus. Pay attention! Damascus will fall, and it will be like a pile of rubble.

verses.latin: Relictae sunt civitates Aroër, gregum, et erunt pecorum absque ullo qui deterreat.
verses.english: The cities of Aroer are abandoned and left for flocks to roam, with no one to scare them away.

verses.latin: Et auferetur robur ab Ephraim, et regnum a Damasco, et reliquiae Syriæ, sicut gloria filiorum Israël, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: Ephraim will be stripped of its fortifications, and Damascus of its kingdom, and the remnant of Syria will be like the glory of the sons of Israel, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: attenuabitur gloria Jacob, et pinguedo carnis ejus macrescet.
verses.english: In that day, the glory of Jacob will be diminished, and his flesh will become lean.

verses.latin: Et erit sicut congregans messem spicas, manu sua metet fruges; et erit sicut colligens spicas in valle Raphaim.
verses.english: It will be like gathering the grain, and his arm will cut down the harvest. It will be like gathering the remaining grain in the valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Et relinquetur in eo sicut racemi, quando ventilantur olivae: duo vel tres grana in summitate rami, vel quatuor vel quinque in angulis ejus, dicit Dominus Deus Israël.
verses.english: Only a few survivors will remain, like the grapes that are left after the harvest, or a few olives left on the branch, or a few olives on the top, or in the corners of the branches, says the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: In die illa respiciet homo ad Factorem suum, et oculi ejus ad Sanctum Israël intuebuntur.
verses.english: In that day, mankind will look to the One who made him, and his eyes will look to the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Et non respiciet ad altaria, opus manuum suarum; et quod fecerunt digiti ejus, non respiciet, et lucos et delubra non intuetur.
verses.english: He will not look to the altars, the work of his own hands, nor will he look to what his fingers have made. He will not regard the groves or temples of idols.

verses.latin: In die illa erunt civitates fortitudinis ejus derelictae, sicut derelicta armenta et pecora, quae reliquerunt a facie filiorum Israël, et erit desolatio.
verses.english: In that day, his fortified cities will be abandoned, like the abandoned forests and fields which the sons of Israel left. Everything will become desolation.

verses.latin: Quia oblita es Deus salutis tuæ, et fortitudinis tuæ non es memor: propterea plantabis plantationem credulitatis, et semen alienum seminabis.
verses.english: Because you have forgotten God, your salvation, and have not remembered your strength, you will plant the planting of faithlessness and sow the seed of the foreigner.

verses.latin: In die plantationis tuæ conteres, et mane semen tuum florebit: in die obitus tui auferetur messis.
verses.english: On the day you plant, you will make a barrier. And in the morning your seed will blossom, but the harvest will be taken away on the day of your death.

verses.latin: Væ multitudini populorum, qui fremunt sicut fremitus maris; et tumultus gentium, qui tumultuantur sicut tumultus aquarum impetuum.
verses.english: Woe to the multitude of peoples who roar like the roaring of the sea, and to the tumult of the nations who rage like the raging of mighty waters.

verses.latin: Gentes quasi aquarum multarum, tumultuantes tumultu; et comminabitur eas Deus, et fugient procul: et sicut pulvis montium coram vento, et quasi turbo coram procella.
verses.english: The nations rage like the raging of many waters, but God will rebuke them, and they will flee far away, like the dust of the mountains before the wind, and like a whirlwind before the storm.

verses.latin: In tempore vespere, et ecce turbatio: antequam lux fieret, non est; et ecce calumnia multorum.
verses.english: At evening, there is chaos. Before dawn, there is nothing. And then, pay attention, there is the despoiling of many.

verses.latin: Populi autem, quasi cinis, consumpti sunt: ignis consumpsit eos, et non fuit qui exstingueret.
verses.english: The peoples, like ash, are consumed. Fire has consumed them, and there is no one to extinguish it.

verses.latin: Non erit, qui misereatur eorum: propterea iniquitates eorum portabunt.
verses.english: There will be no one to have mercy on them. Therefore, they will bear their iniquities.

verses.latin: Parata est gladius contra eos; et contra homines, qui timuerunt me. Dicit Dominus.
verses.english: The sword is prepared against them, and against the people who feared Me, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Vae terrae sonitus, quae est trans flumina Aethiopiae,
verses.english: Alas, O land where the drums sound, that is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia,

verses.latin: qui mittitis in mari legatos, et in vasis papyri super aquas. Ite, nuntii veloces, ad gentem dilaceratam et pilosam: ad populum terribilem exinde et post: gentem expectantem et conculcatam, cujus terra fluminum divisit.
verses.english: who send emissaries across the sea, in papyrus boats upon the waters. Go, swift messengers, to a nation that has been torn and worn down: to a fearsome people from then and after: a nation expecting and trampled down, whose land the rivers divide.

verses.latin: Omnes habitatores orbis, et qui moramini in terra, cum elevatum fuerit signum in montibus, audietis: et cum clangat tuba, audietis.
verses.english: All who live on earth, when the banner is raised on the mountains, you will hear: and when the trumpet sounds, you will hear.

verses.latin: Quia sic dicit Dominus ad me: Quiescam, et considerabo in loco meo, sicut aestas in calore, sicut nubes in die messis.
verses.english: For thus the Lord says to me: I will remain still, and I will consider in My place, like the summer in its heat, like clouds on the day of harvest.

verses.latin: Nam ante messem, quando perfectum fuerit germen, et acescet flos, et fiet uvam acerbam, abscidetur falcibus, et auferetur palmites, et succidetur flagella.
verses.english: For before the harvest, when the grain is perfected, and the flower ripens, and turns into sour grapes, it will be cut with sickles, and the branches will be taken, and the vines will be cut down.

verses.latin: Et relinquentur simul avibus montium, et bestiis terrae: et relinquetis eas avibus aestatis, et bestiis universis.
verses.english: And they will be left together for the birds of the mountains, and the beasts of the earth: and you will abandon them to the birds of summer, and all the beasts.

verses.latin: In tempore illo adferetur munus Domino exercituum a populo dilacerato et piloso, et a populo terribili exinde et ultra: a gente expectantium, et conculcata: cujus terra fluminum divisit; in locum nominis Domini exercituum, montem Sion.
verses.english: At that time a gift will be brought to the Lord of hosts by a people torn and worn down, and by a fearsome people from then and beyond: from a nation expecting, and trampled down: whose land the rivers divide; to the place of the name of the Lord of hosts, Mount Zion.

verses.latin: Onus AEgypti. Ecce Dominus ascendet super nubem levem, et ingredietur AEgyptum: et movebuntur simulacra AEgypti a facie ejus, et cor AEgypti contabescet in medio ejus.
verses.english: The burden of Egypt: Behold, the Lord will come swiftly in a cloud, and He will enter Egypt; and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at His presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst thereof.

verses.latin: Et suscitabo AEgyptios contra AEgyptios, et pugnabit vir contra fratrem suum, et vir contra proximum suum, civitas contra civitatem, regnum contra regnum.
verses.english: And I will stir up the Egyptians against the Egyptians, and they shall fight every one against his brother, and every one against his neighbor, city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

verses.latin: Et dissipabitur spiritus AEgypti in medio ejus, et consilium ejus praecipitabo: et consulent simulacra et ariolos, et pythones et divinos.
verses.english: And the spirit of Egypt shall be broken in the midst thereof, and I will cast down its counsel; and they shall consult idols and wizards, and those who have familiar spirits and diviners.

verses.latin: Et tradam AEgyptum in manu dominorum crudelium, et dominabitur eis rex durus, ait Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: And I will deliver Egypt into the hand of cruel lords, and a hard king shall rule over them, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et auferentur aquae de mari, et flumen desolabit et siccabitur.
verses.english: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dry.

verses.latin: Et deficient flumina, attenuabuntur et siccabuntur rivi defluentium: arundo et iuncus marcescent.
verses.english: And the rivers shall fail, and the flowing streams shall be diminished and dried up: the reed and the bulrush shall wither.

verses.latin: Prata juxta fluvium, in ore fluminis, omnis cultura fluminis arebit, et auferetur, et non erit.
verses.english: The meadows by the river, in the mouth of the river, and every thing that is sown by the river, shall be dried up, and shall be no more.

verses.latin: Et gement filii, et plangent cuncti ponentes piscinam: omnes qui spargunt semen in flumine, arescunt, et dissipantur in aquis.
verses.english: And the fishermen shall mourn, and all that cast a hook into the river shall lament, and they that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.

verses.latin: Confusi sunt operantes linum, et qui texunt subtilia, et qui faciunt velamenta.
verses.english: The workers in fine flax shall be confounded, and the weavers of fine linen, and they that make the webs.

verses.latin: Eritque in terra ejus in die illa quinque civitates loquentes lingua Chanaan, et jurantes in Domino exercituum: una vocabitur civitas Solis.
verses.english: And there shall be in that day five cities in the land of Egypt, speaking the language of Chanaan, and swearing by the Lord of hosts: one shall be called the city of the sun.

verses.latin: In die illa erit altare Domini in medio terrae AEgypti, et titulus Domini juxta terminum ejus.
verses.english: In that day there shall be an altar of the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a title of the Lord near its borders.

verses.latin: Et erit in signum et testimonium Domino exercituum in terra AEgypti: clamabunt enim ad Dominum a prae timore eorum, et mittet eis salvatorem et defensorem, et liberabit eos.
verses.english: And it shall be for a sign and for a testimony to the Lord of hosts in the land of Egypt: for they shall cry to the Lord because of the oppressors, and He will send them a Savior and a defender, and He will deliver them.

verses.latin: Et cognoscetur Dominus ab AEgyptiis, et cognoscent AEgyptii Dominum in die illa, et colent sacrificiis et muneribus: et vovebunt vota Domino, et solvent.
verses.english: And the Lord shall be known by the Egyptians, and the Egyptians shall know the Lord in that day, and they shall worship with sacrifices and oblations: and they shall vow vows to the Lord, and perform them.

verses.latin: Et percutiet Dominus AEgyptum plaga, et sanabit eam: et convertentur ad Dominum, et exaudiet eos, et sanabit eos.
verses.english: And the Lord will strike Egypt with a plague, and will heal it: and they shall turn to the Lord, and He will hear them, and will heal them.

verses.latin: In die illa erit via de AEgypto in Assyrios: et intrabit Assyrius in AEgyptum, et AEgyptius in Assyrios, et servient AEgyptii cum Assyriis.
verses.english: In that day there shall be a way from Egypt to the Assyrians: and the Assyrian shall enter into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria, and the Egyptians shall serve with the Assyrians.

verses.latin: In die illa erit AEgyptus tertia in Israel, cum benedictione Domini exercituum, dicens: Benedictus populus meus AEgyptius, et opus manuum mearum Assyrius, et haereditas mea Israel.
verses.english: In that day shall Egypt be the third to Israel, with the blessing of the Lord of hosts, saying: Blessed be my people of Egypt, and the work of my hands of the Assyrians, and my inheritance of Israel.

verses.latin: In anno quo missus est Tharthan in Azotum, cum misisset eum Sargon rex Assyriorum, et pugnavisset contra Azotum, et cepisset eam,
verses.english: In the year the general Tharthan was sent to Ashdod by Sargon, the king of Assyria. The general then fought against Ashdod, and captured it,

verses.latin: in tempore illo locutus est Dominus in manu Isaiae filii Amos, dicens: Vade, et solve saccum de lumbis tuis, et calceamenta tua tolle de pede tuo. Et fecit ita, vadens nudus et discalciatus.
verses.english: At that time, the Lord gave a message through Isaiah, the son of Amoz. He said: “Go, take off the sackcloth from your waist, and take off your sandals.” Isaiah did as he was told, going about naked and barefoot.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus: Sicut ambulavit servus meus Isaias nudus et discalciatus tribus annis, in signum et prodigium super AEgyptum et super AEthiopiam,
verses.english: Then the Lord said: “As My servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years, as a sign and a wonder regarding Egypt and Ethiopia,

verses.latin: sic impellet rex Assyriorum captivitatem AEgypti, et transmigrationem AEthiopiae, juvenes et senes, nudus et discalciatos, et nudos et discalciatos confusionis AEgypti.
verses.english: So will the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Ethiopia, both young and old. They will be naked and barefoot, and their backsides will be exposed—the humiliation of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et pavebunt, et confundentur super AEthiopiam, et super AEgyptum, spes eorum, et gloria eorum: et dicent in die illa: Sic est spes nostra, ad quam confugimus, et in qua ponebamus salutem, in conspectu regis Assyriorum: et quomodo effugiemus nos?
verses.english: They will be terrified and ashamed of Ethiopia and Egypt, their hope and glory. On that day, they will say, “That is what happened to our hope. We fled to Egypt for help, but the king of Assyria will come and destroy us.”

verses.latin: Onus deserti maris. Sicut turbinis in meridiano, veniens de deserto, de terra terribili,
verses.english: This is a prophecy about the desert by the sea. As a sudden storm from the south, sweeping in from the desert, from a terrifying land,

verses.latin: visio dura mihi nuntiata est. Qui praedicator, annuntiabo?
verses.english: a difficult vision was announced to me. Who will tell it to everyone?

verses.latin: Qui videt, conturbatus est; et qui audit, obstupuit.
verses.english: The one who sees it is troubled. The one who hears it is stunned.

verses.latin: Propterea conversa est retro dolor meus: quasi parturiens doleo; angustiata sum, ut non audiam; conturbata sum, ut non videam.
verses.english: My pain is turned into something terrifying: as if I am in labor and writhing. I am so worried that I can't hear clearly; I am so upset that I can't see clearly.

verses.latin: Conturbatus est cor meum; terrorem timui: nox desiderii mei, versata est mihi in metum.
verses.english: My heart is troubled. Fear and trembling have come over me. The night that I longed for is now a nightmare.

verses.latin: Pone mensam, prospice in specula; comede, bibite; surgite principes, ornate clypeos.
verses.english: Set the table. Station the guards. Eat and drink! Prepare to stand up, and polish your shields.

verses.latin: Hoc ait mihi Dominus: Vade, pone speculatorem; et quod viderit, annuntiet.
verses.english: The Lord said to me, “Go, appoint a watchman. Let him announce whatever he sees.

verses.latin: Et vidit currum duorum equorum, et equitem ascendentem super asinum, et super camelum: et adtendebat diligenter, cum multo timore.
verses.english: The watchman saw a chariot with two horses, and a rider on a donkey and a camel. He paid careful attention to what he saw, with a great deal of fear.

verses.latin: Et clamavit leo: Super speculam Domini ego sto jugiter per diem, et super custodias meas ego sto totus noctibus.
verses.english: Then the watchman, sounding the alarm, cried out: “Lord, I stand continually on the watchtower during the day, and I am standing on my guard all night.

verses.latin: Ecce iste venit, ascendens super currum duorum equorum: et respondit, et dixit: Cecidit, cecidit Babylon, et omnes sculptiles ejus contriti sunt in terram.
verses.english: Behold, here comes a chariot with two horses! He gave the answer and said, “Babylon has fallen, and all of its carved idols are shattered on the ground.”

verses.latin: Onus Duma. Ad me clamat ex Seir: Custos, quid de nocte? Custos, quid de nocte?
verses.english: This is a prophecy about the land of Edom. The people of Seir are calling to me: “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”

verses.latin: Dixit custos: Venit mane, et nox. Si vultis, consulite; convertimini, venite.
verses.english: The watchman said: “Morning is coming, and also night. If you wish to know more, then come back again.”

verses.latin: Onus in Arabia. In saltu silvarum in Arabia dormite, itinerantes Dodanim.
verses.english: This is a prophecy about Arabia. Those who travel through the thickets of the forests in Arabia, you Dodanites, should prepare to rest.

verses.latin: Obviam sitienti aqua; qui habitatores terrae Thema, cum panibus occurrite fugienti.
verses.english: Bring water to the thirsty. You who live in the land of Tema, meet the fleeing people with food.

verses.latin: A facie enim gladiorum fugerunt, a facie gladii stricti, et a facie arcus extenti, et a facie belli.
verses.english: For they have fled before the swords, before the drawn sword, before the stretched bow, and before the battle.

verses.latin: Hoc enim dixit mihi Dominus: Adhuc in uno anno, sicut anni mercennarii, et auferetur omnis gloria Cedar:
verses.english: For the Lord said to me: “Within one year, as a hired worker would count, all the glory of Kedar will be gone:

verses.latin: et reliqui numerus sagittariorum fortium filiorum Cedar, minuentur: Dominus enim Deus Israël locutus est.
verses.english: and the remaining number of the strong archers of the sons of Kedar will be diminished.” This is the Lord God of Israel speaking.

verses.latin: Onus vallis visionis. Quid est tibi quod ascendisti, quod tu quoque ascendisti in tecta?
verses.english: This prophecy concerns the valley of Jerusalem. Why have you gathered everyone and ascended to the roofs?

verses.latin: Plena clamoris, urbs frequens, civitas exultans. Interfecti tui non interfecti gladio, nec mortui in praelio.
verses.english: Jerusalem is full of shouting. It is a city of exultation. Your slain are not slain by the sword, nor have they died in battle.

verses.latin: Omnes principes tui fugerunt simul, et ligati sunt a sagittarius; omnes qui inventi sunt tui, vincti sunt simul.
verses.english: Your leaders have all fled together. They were bound by archers, and all your captives were bound together.

verses.latin: Propterea dixi: Recedite a me, amaro; plorabo amaritudinem: nolite urgere me, ut consoler super vastationem filiae populi mei.
verses.english: Therefore I said: “Turn away from me. Let me weep bitterly. Do not press me to console myself because of the desolation of the daughter of my people.”

verses.latin: Dies enim conturbationis, et conculcationis, et incantationis Domini Dei exercituum in valle visionis, ad confringendum murum, et ad clamorem montis.
verses.english: For the day of the Lord of hosts will be a day of tribulation, and of trampling, and of confusion in the valley of vision, to break down the wall, and to cry to the mountain.

verses.latin: Et Elam sumpsit pharetram, in curru viri equitis; et clypeus detegit fortitudinem ejus.
verses.english: Elam took up the quiver with the chariot of the horseman; the shield uncovered its strength.

verses.latin: Et erunt electissimae valles tuae pleni quadrigis, et equites ponent ante portam.
verses.english: Your choicest valleys will be full of chariots, and the horsemen will set themselves in array before the gate.

verses.latin: Et revelata est opertura Juda: et vidisti in armis domus silvae.
verses.english: Then the covering of Judah was revealed, and you looked to the armor of the house of the forest.

verses.latin: Et scidistis scissuras civitatis David; et vidistis quod multiplicastis aquas piscinae inferioris.
verses.english: You saw that the breaches in the city of David multiplied, and that you gathered the waters of the lower pool.

verses.latin: Et numerastis domos Hierusalem, et destruxistis domos ad muniendum murum.
verses.english: You have counted the houses of Jerusalem, and have torn down houses to fortify the wall.

verses.latin: Et lacum inter duos muros aquae fecistis, et non considerastis ad eum qui fecit illud, neque ad eum qui fabricatus est illud, respicitis.
verses.english: You made a reservoir between the two walls for the water, but you did not look to him who made it, nor did you have any regard for him who formed it long ago.

verses.latin: Et vocabit Dominus Deus exercituum in die illa ad fletum, et ad planctum; ad calvitium, et ad praecinctionem sacco.
verses.english: In that day, the Lord God of hosts summoned you to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth.

verses.latin: Et ecce gaudium et laetitia, occidere vaccam, et jugulare pecus; comedere carnes, et bibere vinum: Comedamus et bibamus, cras enim moriemur.
verses.english: But instead, there is joy and gladness, slaughtering cattle and killing sheep, eating meat, and drinking wine: “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we shall die.”

verses.latin: Et revelata est in auribus meis a Domino exercituum: Nequaquam dimittetur iniquitas haec vobis donec moriamini, dicit Dominus Deus exercituum.
verses.english: Then the Lord of hosts revealed it in my ears: “Surely this iniquity shall not be forgiven you until you die,” says the Lord God of hosts.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus exercituum: Vade, ingredere ad eum qui habitat in tabernaculo hoc, ad Sobnam praepositum templi,
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God of hosts: “Go, enter to this one who dwells in the temple, to Shebna, who is over the house.

verses.latin: Dic: Quid tu hic? aut quasi quis hic? quia excidisti tibi sepulchrum hic, excidisti in excelso sepulchrum tuum, et in petra habitaculum tibi.
verses.english: Say, “What do you have here? Or whom do you have here, that you have cut out a tomb for yourself here, cutting out a tomb on high, and carving a dwelling for yourself in the rock?”

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus disperget te, et validissime expellere te, et convolvet te.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord will hurl you away violently. He will toss you. He will wind you up.

verses.latin: Convolvens, volvens sicut pilam, in terram latam et spatiosam; ibi morieris, et ibi erit currus gloriae tuae, ignominiosissime domus domini tui.
verses.english: He will wrap you up and toss you like a ball, into a vast and spacious land. There you will die, and there will be the chariot of your glory, the shame of your master’s house.

verses.latin: Et eiciam te de statu tuo, et a ministerio tuo deponam te.
verses.english: I will hurl you from your position, and I will cast you down from your office.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: vocabo servum meum Eliacim filium Helciae,
verses.english: And it shall be in that day: I will summon my servant Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah,

verses.latin: Et induam illum tunicam tuam, et cingulo tuo confortabo eum, et potestatem tuam dabo in manu ejus: et erit quasi pater habitantibus in Hierusalem, et domui Juda.
verses.english: And I will clothe him with your tunic, and I will strengthen him with your belt, and I will give your authority into his hand. He will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.

verses.latin: Et dabo clavem domus David super humerum ejus: et aperiet, et non erit qui claudat: et claudet, et non erit qui aperiat.
verses.english: And I will place the key of the house of David on his shoulder. He will open, and no one will shut. He will shut, and no one will open.

verses.latin: Et configam eum quasi paxillum in loco fideli: et erit in solium gloriae domus patris sui.
verses.english: And I will fasten him like a peg in a secure place, and he will become a throne of glory to his father’s house.

verses.latin: Et suspendunt super eum omnem gloriam domus patris sui, vasa parva, a vasis craterarum usque ad omnia vasa organorum.
verses.english: And they will hang on him all the glory of his father’s house, the small vessels, from the vessels of cups even to all the vessels of musical instruments.

verses.latin: In die illa, dicit Dominus exercituum, amovebitur paxillus qui fixus fuerat in loco fideli: et confringetur, et cadet, et peribit onus quod impositium fuerat super eum: quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: In that day, says the Lord of hosts, the peg that was fastened in a secure place will be removed, and it will break and fall, and the burden that was upon it will perish, for the Lord has spoken.

verses.latin: Onus Tyri. Ululate naves maris, quia desolata est aedificatio, ingressus portus, deiecerunt eam.
verses.english: A prophecy about Tyre: Wail, all the ships on the sea, for the city of Tyre has been utterly destroyed. All the sailors will cry out once they come ashore.

verses.latin: Agnoscete, habitatores insulae, mercatorum Sidonis: transientes maris, repleverunt te.
verses.english: The sailors of Sidon, who come and go, will realize what happened to Tyre, and will cry out over what Tyre has lost.

verses.latin: In magnis aquis semen Nili: messis fluminis, frugum maris, facta est e cibo gentium.
verses.english: Tyre was a great merchant city, and the people of many nations relied on her for their food and goods, especially as she controlled the seas.

verses.latin: Erubesce, Sidon, dixit mare, quia non est locuta, nec peperi, nec enutrivi juvenes, nec educavi virgines.
verses.english: The sea will be ashamed, saying, "I have not given birth, nor have I given any life to those who live in Tyre."

verses.latin: Cum auditum fuerit in AEgypto, conturbabuntur cum dolore nuntia Tyri.
verses.english: When the news reaches Egypt, all the people will cry out with anguish over what has befallen Tyre.

verses.latin: Transite in Tharsis, ululate habitatores insulae.
verses.english: Go to Tarshish, and lament, you who live on the island of Tyre.

verses.latin: Haec est urbs exultationis, cujus origo est a die antiquo, ut transferret filios suos in longinqua.
verses.english: Is this the city of joy, which has always been a place of traders and the hub of sea commerce?

verses.latin: Cui contulit hoc Tyrius, coronata, cujus negotiatores principes, negotiatores terræ nobiles?
verses.english: Who is responsible for the downfall of Tyre? Tyre, the city of merchants, whose merchants are princes, and whose traders are the most honored people in the world?

verses.latin: Dominus exercituum cogitavit hoc, ut detraheret superbiam omnis gloriæ, et ad ignominiam deduceret cunctos nobiles terræ.
verses.english: The Lord of Hosts has decided to do this, to humble all the glory of Tyre, and bring shame to all the nobles on the earth.

verses.latin: Transgredere terram tuam quasi fluvius, filia Tharsis, jam non est cingulum.
verses.english: Go through your land like a river, daughter of Tarshish, and see what has happened to your wealth.

verses.latin: Manum suam extendit super mare, conturbavit regna: Dominus mandavit de Chanaan, ut dissiparet fortitudinem ejus.
verses.english: The Lord has reached out His hand over the sea and shaken the kingdoms. He has given a command against the land of Canaan, that Tyre be utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Non ultra exultabis, virgo oppressa, filia Sidonis: surge, transmigra in Cethim, nec illic requies: nec illic erit requies tibi.
verses.english: And He said, "You will never again be joyful, you oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon. Arise, go over to Cyprus. There you will find no rest." You will find no peace there.

verses.latin: Ecce terra Chaldaeorum: hic populus non fuit, Assur fundavit eam. In captivitatem adduxerunt fortes ejus, destruxerunt palatia ejus: posuerunt eam in ruinam.
verses.english: Look at the land of the Chaldeans, a nation that did not exist before the Assyrians founded it. They have captured the strongest soldiers of Tyre and destroyed its palaces. They have laid it waste.

verses.latin: Ululate naves Tharsis, quia desolata est fortitudo vestra.
verses.english: Wail, you ships of Tarshish, for your strength has been destroyed.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: obliviscetur Tyros septuaginta annis, secundum dies unius regis. Post septuaginta annos erit Tyros sicut meretricis, et cantabit sicut in cithara.
verses.english: In that day, Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years, the length of a king's reign. After seventy years, Tyre will be like a prostitute who sings and plays the harp to attract customers.

verses.latin: Et post septuaginta annos visitabitur Tyros, et revertetur ad mercatum suum, et exercebit fornicationem cum cunctis regnis terræ super faciem terræ.
verses.english: After seventy years, the Lord will visit Tyre and restore its prosperity. Tyre will return to her trade and will be in demand with all the kingdoms of the world.

verses.latin: Et erit mercatura ejus, et merces ejus sanctificata Domino: non condentur, neque reponentur: quia mercatura ejus erit eis qui habitant coram Domino, ut comedant in saturitate, et habeant pallia vetera.
verses.english: Her profits and her wages will be dedicated to the Lord. They will not be stored up or hoarded, but will be used for the benefit of those who live before the Lord, so that they may have plenty to eat and good clothing.

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus dissipat terram, et vastat eam, et conturbat faciem ejus, et dissipat habitatores ejus.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord will make the earth a desolation, and will lay it waste; and will turn it upside down, and will scatter its inhabitants.

verses.latin: Et sicut populus, sic sacerdos; et sicut servus, sic dominus ejus; sicut ancilla, sic domina ejus; sicut emens, sic is qui vendit; sicut mutuans, sic is qui mutuum accipit; sicut creditor, sic debitor.
verses.english: And as with the people, so with the priest; and as with the servant, so with his master; as with the handmaid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the creditor, so with the debtor.

verses.latin: Dissipatione dissipabitur terra, et direptione diripientur habitatores ejus: quia Dominus locutus est verbum hoc.
verses.english: The earth shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.

verses.latin: Moeret terra, et defluit; infirmata est, et fluit mundus; infirmati sunt excelsi populi terrae.
verses.english: The earth mourns and fades away, the world languishes and fades away, the lofty people of the earth languish.

verses.latin: Et terra contaminata est sub habitatoribus suis: quia transgressi sunt leges, mutaverunt jus, irriterunt foedus sempiternum.
verses.english: The earth is defiled under its inhabitants: because they have transgressed the laws, they have changed the ordinance, they have broken the everlasting covenant.

verses.latin: Propter hoc maledictio vorabit terram, et peccabunt habitatores ejus: ideo insanient cultores ejus, et relinquentur pauci homines.
verses.english: Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein shall be desolate: therefore the inhabitants thereof shall be mad, and few men shall be left.

verses.latin: Moeret vinum, infirmata est vinea, gemunt omnes laetantes corde.
verses.english: The wine mourns, the vine languisheth, all the merry of heart sigh.

verses.latin: Cessavit gaudium tympanorum, quievit sonitus ludentium, conticuit dulcedo citharae.
verses.english: The mirth of tabrets hath ceased, the noise of them that rejoice is ended, the joy of the harp is silent.

verses.latin: In cantico non bibent vinum; amara erit potio bibentibus eam.
verses.english: They shall not drink wine with a song; the drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.

verses.latin: Contrita est civitas vanitatis, clausa est omnis domus, ne introeat.
verses.english: The city of vanity is broken down: every house is shut up, that no man may come in.

verses.latin: Clamor erit in plateis propter vinum; consumpta est omnis laetitia; egressa est gloria terrae.
verses.english: There shall be a cry in the streets because of wine; all joy is forsaken; the mirth of the land is gone away.

verses.latin: Relicta est in civitate solitudo, et contrita est porta cum concussionibus.
verses.english: In the city there is desolation, and the gate is broken with pieces.

verses.latin: Quia sic erit in medio terrae in medio populorum: sicut si collecta fuerint poma aestatis, sicut si relicta fuerint racemi vindemiae.
verses.english: For it shall be thus in the midst of the earth, in the midst of the people: as if a few olives should remain, that have been shaken out of the olive tree: or grapes when the vintage is done.

verses.latin: Isti exaltabunt vocem suam, et laudabunt; in navibus maris glorificabunt Dominum.
verses.english: These shall lift up their voice, and give praise; in the islands of the sea they shall glorify the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Propter hoc in doctrina glorificate Dominum: in insulis maris nomen Domini Dei Israël.
verses.english: Therefore glorify ye the Lord in the doctrine of fire, in the islands of the sea the name of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: A finibus terrae laudes audivimus, gloria justi. Et dixi: Injusto mihi, injusto mihi! vae mihi! praevaricatores praevaricati sunt, et in praevaricatione praevaricationem fecerunt.
verses.english: From the ends of the earth we have heard praises, the glory of the just one. And I said: My secret to me, my secret to me. Woe is me! the prevaricators have prevaricated: and with the prevarication of transgressors they have prevaricated.

verses.latin: Terror, et fovea, et laqueus super te, habitator terrae.
verses.english: Fear, and the pit, and the snare are upon thee, O thou inhabitant of the earth.

verses.latin: Et erit: qui fugerit a voce terroris, cadet in foveam; et qui evaserit de fovea, capietur laqueo: quia cataractae de excelso apertae sunt, et concutientur fundamenta terrae.
verses.english: And it shall come to pass, that he that shall flee from the noise of the fear, shall fall into the pit: and he that shall get up out of the pit, shall be taken in the snare: for the floodgates from on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth shall be shaken.

verses.latin: Concutietur, conturbabitur terra, et concidet quasi ebrius, et transferetur quasi tabernaculum unius noctis.
verses.english: The earth shall be shaken, it shall be greatly moved, it shall be broken asunder as a cup, and shall be moved to and fro like a tent: and the iniquity thereof shall be heavy upon it.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: visitabit Dominus in gladio suo duro, et grandi, et forti super Leviathan serpentem vectem, et super Leviathan serpentem tortuosum, et occidet cetum qui in mari est.
verses.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall visit upon the sword his hard, and great, and strong one, upon Leviathan the piercing serpent, and upon Leviathan the winding serpent: and shall slay the whale that is in the sea.

verses.latin: In die illa cantabit vinum dilectum: cantate ei.
verses.english: In that day there shall be a vineyard of red wine: sing ye to it.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus conservo eam; repente irrigabo eam, ne quis laedat eam, nocte et die custodiam eam.
verses.english: I am the Lord that keep it; I will suddenly give it drink: lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.

verses.latin: In die illa erit canticum hoc in terra Juda. Civitas fortitudinis nostrae Sion: Salvator ponetur in ea murus et antemurale.
verses.english: In that day there shall be a vineyard of wine: sing ye to it.

verses.latin: Domine, Deus meus es tu: exaltabo te, et confitebor nomini tuo, quoniam fecisti mirabilia, cogitationes antiquas, fideles. Amen.
verses.english: Lord, You are my God; I will praise You, and I will give thanks to Your name because You do wonders, fulfilling ancient plans with faithfulness. Amen.

verses.latin: Quia posuisti civitatem lapidem, urbem munitam.
verses.english: For You have made the city into a heap of rubble, the fortified city.

verses.latin: Quoniam posuisti urbem in ruinam: civitatem in excidium, non erit aedificata in sempiternum.
verses.english: You have turned the city into ruins, and cast down its buildings never to be rebuilt.

verses.latin: Propter hoc laudabit te populus fortis, civitas gentium robustarum timebit te.
verses.english: Therefore, a strong people will praise You; the city of the powerful nations will fear You.

verses.latin: Quia factus es fortitudo pauperis, fortitudo egeno in tribulatione sua, refugium a turbine, umbraculum ab aestu: umbra enim potentium, quasi tempestas impetuosa.
verses.english: For You have become the refuge of the poor, the refuge of the needy in their distress, a shelter from the storm, and a shade from the heat. The shadow of the powerful is like an impetuous storm.

verses.latin: Sicut aestus in siti, conturbabis tumultum alienorum: sicut aestus in siti, humiliaberis superbia superbientium.
verses.english: Like heat in a dry land, You will calm the tumult of the foreigners. Like heat in a dry land, You will humble the pride of the arrogant.

verses.latin: Et faciet Dominus exercituum omnibus populis in monte isto, convivium pinguium, convivium vini in defaecato, pinguium medulla, vini in defaecato, colati.
verses.english: And the Lord of hosts will make for all peoples on this mountain a feast of rich foods, a feast of purified wine, of rich marrow, of purified wine, well-strained.

verses.latin: Et induet in monte isto faciem vinculi, ligatura quam alligavit omnes populos, et velamentum quod operuit universas gentes.
verses.english: And He will destroy on this mountain the veil that covers all peoples, the woven garment that covers all nations.

verses.latin: Absorbebit mortem in perpetuum: et auferet Dominus Deus lacrimam ab omni facie: et opprobrium populi sui auferet de universa terra, quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: He will swallow up death forever; and the Lord God will wipe away tears from all faces, and He will take away the reproach of His people from all the earth. The Lord has spoken.

verses.latin: Et dicetur in die illa: Ecce iste Deus noster, sustinuimus eum, et salvabit nos: iste Dominus, sustinuimus eum, exsultabimus et laetabimur in salutari ejus.
verses.english: In that day it will be said, “Behold, this is our God; we have waited for Him, and He will save us. This is the Lord; we have waited for Him; we will exult and rejoice in His salvation.”

verses.latin: Manus enim Domini requiescet in monte isto: et conteretur Moab sub eo, sicut conteritur stramentum in plaustro.
verses.english: For the hand of the Lord will rest on this mountain; and Moab will be trampled under Him, as straw is trampled in a cart.

verses.latin: Et extendet manus suas in ea, sicut extendit natans ad natandum: et humiliabit gloriam ejus cum conculcatione manuum.
verses.english: And He will stretch out His hands over them, as the swimmer stretches out to swim; and He will bring low their pride with the trampling of their hands.

verses.latin: Et munimenta excelsa murorum tuorum deprimet, et humiliabit, et usque ad terram detrahet ea.
verses.english: He will bring down the high fortifications of your walls, humble them, and cast them down to the ground.

verses.latin: In terra Juda civitas fortitudinis nostrae: salvator ponetur in ea. Ponetur in ea salvator.
verses.english: In the land of Judah, our strong city is located. The Savior will be placed there. The Savior will be present within her.

verses.latin: Aperite portas, et ingrediatur gens justa, custodiens veritatem.
verses.english: Open the gates! Let those enter who do what is right, who uphold the truth.

verses.latin: Vetus error abiit: servabis pacem; pacem, quia in te speravimus.
verses.english: The old error has passed away. You will preserve peace, because we put our hope in You.

verses.latin: Speravimus in te, Domine: in via judicii tui; memoria nominis tui, et desiderium animae.
verses.english: Lord, we put our hope in You along the path of Your judgment. The memory of Your name is our longing and desire.

verses.latin: In anima mea desideravi te in nocte; sed et spiritu meo in praecordiis meis de mane vigilabo ad te.
verses.english: I desired You in my soul at night, and with my spirit within me, I will rise early in the morning to meet You.

verses.latin: Quia cum iudicia tua terrae, justitiam didicerunt qui habitant orbem.
verses.english: For when Your judgments come to the earth, those who live on Earth will learn justice.

verses.latin: Si impius, auferetur, ut non videat gloriam Domini: erubescet, et zelus populi consumet eos: nunc ignis conteret adversarios.
verses.english: If the wicked are removed, they will not see the glory of the Lord. Shame will befall them, and the zeal of the people will consume them. Now, fire will consume the adversaries.

verses.latin: Domine, auferes pacem nobis: qui enim operatus es nobis, omnia opera nostra operatus es in nobis.
verses.english: Lord, You will grant us peace, for You have performed all our works for us.

verses.latin: Domine Deus noster, possederunt nos domini absque te: solum in te recordemur nominis tui.
verses.english: Lord our God, we have been dominated by lords other than You. But now we remember Your name only.

verses.latin: Moriemur, et non vivemus: cademus, et non resurgemus: ideo visitasti, et contrivisti eos, et perdidisti omnem memoriam eorum de terra.
verses.english: They are dead, they shall not live: they shall fall, and shall not rise again. Therefore, You have visited and punished them, and have destroyed all memory of them from the earth.

verses.latin: Addidisti gentem, Domine, addidisti gentem: glorificatus es; latum fecisti omnes fines terrae.
verses.english: You have increased the nation, Lord, You have increased the nation; You are glorified. You have widened all the borders of the land.

verses.latin: Domine, in tribulatione visitaverunt te; in angustia quasi in parturiente ululatus murmuravi.
verses.english: Lord, in tribulation they visited You. In times of distress, as in childbirth, I whispered a prayer.

verses.latin: Sicut qui concipit, cum pariat, dolet et clamat in doloribus suis, sic facti sumus prae conspectu tuo, Domine.
verses.english: As a woman with child cries out in her labor pains, so we have become before You, Lord.

verses.latin: Concepimus, et quasi parturivimus iniquitates: peperimus spiritum salutis.
verses.english: We conceived, and it seemed we gave birth to wickedness, but we have produced a spirit of salvation.

verses.latin: Non resurrexerunt mortui, nec resurgent omnes qui ceciderunt: ideo visitasti et contrivisti eos, et perdidisti omnem memoriam eorum.
verses.english: The dead will not live, nor will those who have fallen rise again. Therefore, You have visited and punished them, and have destroyed all memory of them.

verses.latin: Addidisti gentem, Domine, addidisti gentem: glorificatus es; transtulisti omnes terminos terrae.
verses.english: You have increased the nation, Lord, You have increased the nation; You are glorified. You have moved the borders of the earth.

verses.latin: Domine, in tribulatione visitaverunt te: in angustia clamorem quasi parturientes emiserunt.
verses.english: Lord, in tribulation they visited You, in times of distress they cried out as if in childbirth.

verses.latin: Quasi concepit in utero, et adpropinquavit ad partum, et doluit, et clamavit in doloribus suis: sic facti sumus, Domine, ante faciem tuam.
verses.english: As a woman in her pregnancy approaches childbirth and suffers, and cries out in her pain, so we are before You, Lord.

verses.latin: Vivunt mortui tui, resurgent cadavera eorum: expergiscimini, et laudate qui habitatis in pulvere: quia ros lucis ros tuus, et terram gigantum conteres.
verses.english: Your dead will live, their bodies will rise. Awake, and sing, you who dwell in the dust, for Your dew is the dew of light, and You will crush the land of giants.

verses.latin: Vade, populus meus, intra in conclavia tua, claude ostium tuum super te: abscondere te modicum, donec pertranseat ira.
verses.english: Go, my people, enter your chambers, close your door behind you. Hide yourself a little while, until the wrath passes.

verses.latin: Ecce enim Dominus egredietur de loco suo, ut visitet iniquitatem incola terrae: et aperiet terra sanguinem suum, et non velabit amplius mortuos suos.
verses.english: For the Lord will come out of His place to punish the iniquity of the inhabitant of the earth. The earth will reveal its blood, and it will no longer hide its dead.

verses.latin: In die illa cantabitur canticum istud in terra Juda:
verses.english: In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah:

verses.latin: Urbs fortitudinis nostrae Sion: salvator ponetur in ea murus et antemurale.
verses.english: Our strong city is Zion: God will place salvation in it like a wall and a rampart.

verses.latin: Aperite portas, et ingrediatur gens justa, custodiens veritatem.
verses.english: Open the gates, that the just nation may enter, the one that keeps the truth.

verses.latin: Vetus error abiit: custodias pacem, pacem: quia in te speravimus.
verses.english: The old error has passed away: keep peace, peace: because we have hoped in You.

verses.latin: Speravistis in Domino in saeculis, in Domino fortissimo; quare elidisti habitantes excelsos, civitatem sublimem.
verses.english: You have hoped in the Lord throughout the ages, in the Lord, the strongest; therefore, He has destroyed the inhabitants of the high places, a lofty city.

verses.latin: Humiliabit excelsa civitatem, humiliabit eam usque ad terram, detrahet eam usque ad pulverem.
verses.english: He will humble the high city, He will humble it to the ground, He will bring it down to the dust.

verses.latin: Conculcabit eam pes, pedes pauperum, gressus egeno- rum.
verses.english: The foot will tread it, the feet of the poor, the steps of the needy.

verses.latin: Sempiterna est enim Sion, et in ea habitabit pauper.
verses.english: For Zion is eternal, and the poor will dwell in it.

verses.latin: Et erit via directa, et iter sanctum vocabitur ei: non transibit per eam pollutus, et haec est via recta vobis, ita ut non erretis.
verses.english: And there will be a direct path, and it will be called the holy way: the polluted will not pass through it, and this is the right way for you, so that you do not go astray.

verses.latin: Non erit ibi leo, et bestia nociva non ascendet eam, nec invenietur ibi: sed ambulabunt qui liberati fuerint.
verses.english: There will not be a lion there, and the harmful beast will not ascend it, nor will it be found there: but those who have been freed will walk.

verses.latin: Et redempti a Domino convertentur, et venient in Sion cum laude, et gaudium sempiternum super caput eorum: gaudium et laetitiam obtinebunt, et fugiet dolor.
verses.english: And those redeemed by the Lord will return, and will come to Zion with praise, and everlasting joy upon their heads: they will obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow will flee away.

verses.latin: Ego, ego sum consolator vester. Quis es tu, ut timeris a facie hominis mortalis, et a filio hominis, qui quasi foenum arefactus est?
verses.english: I, I am your comforter. Who are you, that you should be afraid of the face of mortal man, and of the son of man, who is like grass that is dried up?

verses.latin: Et oblitus es Domini factoris tui, qui tetendit caelos, et fundavit terram? et timuisti semper tota die a facie furoris ejus, qui te tribulabat: ubi est furor tribulantis?
verses.english: And have you forgotten the Lord your Maker, who stretched out the heavens, and founded the earth? And you have been in constant fear all day long because of the face of the fury of the oppressor: where is the fury of the oppressor?

verses.latin: Cito veniet hic, qui clamat, et non morietur in fovea, nec deficiet panis ejus.
verses.english: Quickly he will come, who cries out, and he will not die in the pit, nor will his bread fail.

verses.latin: Ego autem sum Dominus Deus tuus, qui conturbo mare, et commovebo fluctus ejus: Dominus exercituum nomen mihi.
verses.english: But I am the Lord your God, who stirs up the sea, and moves its waves: the Lord of hosts is My name.

verses.latin: Et posui verba mea in ore tuo, et in umbra manus meae protexi te: ut plantes caelos, et fundes terram, et dicas Sioni: Populus meus es tu.
verses.english: And I have put My words in your mouth, and I have protected you in the shadow of My hand: that I may plant the heavens, and found the earth, and say to Zion: You are My people.

verses.latin: Exsurge, exsurge, sta, Jerusalem, quae bibisti de manu Domini calicem irae: usque ad fundum calicis ebrietatis potasti, et stillasti.
verses.english: Arise, arise, stand up, Jerusalem, who have drunk from the hand of the Lord the cup of wrath: you have drunk to the bottom of the cup of drunkenness, and you have drained it.

verses.latin: Non est qui dirigat eam ex omnibus filiis, quos genuit: et non est qui teneat manum ejus ex omnibus filiis, quos enutrivit.
verses.english: There is none to guide her from all the sons she has brought forth: and there is none who will hold her hand from all the sons she has nourished.

verses.latin: Duo sunt quae acciderunt tibi: quis contristabitur super te? Vastitas, et contritio, et fames, et gladius; quis consolabitur te?
verses.english: Two things have happened to you: who will grieve over you? Desolation, and destruction, and famine, and the sword; who will comfort you?

verses.latin: Filii tui lassati sunt, jacuerunt in capite omnium viarum quasi bubalus in laqueo, pleni indignationis Domini, irae Dei tui.
verses.english: Your sons have fainted, they have lain down at the head of all the ways like a buffalo in a snare, full of the indignation of the Lord, the wrath of your God.

verses.latin: Propter hoc audi haec, paupercula, et ebria, sed non a vino.
verses.english: Therefore, hear these things, you poor thing, and you who are drunk, but not with wine.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Dominus tuus, et Deus tuus, qui pugnabit pro populo suo: Ecce, tuli de manu tua calicem ebrietatis, calicem indignationis: non bibes illum ultra.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord your Lord, and your God, who will fight for His people: Behold, I have taken from your hand the cup of drunkenness, the cup of indignation: you will drink it no more.

verses.latin: Et ponam illud in manu eorum qui te humiliaverunt, qui dixerunt animae tuae: Incurvare, ut transeamus: et posuisti quasi terram cervicem tuam, et quasi viam transeuntibus.
verses.english: And I will put it in the hand of those who have humbled you, who have said to your soul: Bow down, that we may pass: and you have made your back as the ground, and as a way for those who pass by.

verses.latin: Vae coronae superbiæ ebriorum Ephraim, et flori decidenti gloriæ decori ejus, qui erant in vertice vallis pinguis, inflati vino.
verses.english: Woe to the proud wreath of the drunkards of Ephraim, to the fading flower that is their glorious beauty, those who are on the top of the fertile valley, overcome by wine.

verses.latin: Ecce dominus fortis et validus, quasi tempestas grandinis, turbo vastans, quasi impetus aquarum multarum inundans, mittet in terram manu valida.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord is strong and mighty; he shall come as a storm of hail, a devastating whirlwind, like a torrent of many waters overflowing. He will cast them down to earth with a strong hand.

verses.latin: Conculcabitur sub pedibus corona superbiæ ebriorum Ephraim.
verses.english: The proud wreath of the drunkards of Ephraim shall be trampled underfoot.

verses.latin: Et erit flos decidentis gloriæ, qui est in vertice vallis pinguis, quasi præcox fructus ante æstatem: quem cum viderit aspiciens, statim devorat eum, dum adhuc in manu sua est.
verses.english: And the fading flower of their glory, which is on the top of the fertile valley, will be like the first fruit before summer. Whoever sees it, immediately devours it while it is still in their hand.

verses.latin: In die illa erit Dominus exercituum corona gloriæ et corona exultationis reliquiis populi sui:
verses.english: In that day, the Lord of Hosts will be a crown of glory and a crown of joy to the remnant of His people:

verses.latin: et in spiritu judicii sedenti, et fortitudinis revertentibus ad prælium.
verses.english: And a spirit of judgment to the one who sits in judgment, and strength to those who return to battle.

verses.latin: Sed et hi errant præ vino, et in ebrietate vagantur: sacerdos et propheta ignoraverunt præ vino, absorpti sunt a vino, erraverunt in ebrietate, nescierunt videntem, ignoraverunt judicium.
verses.english: But even these err because of wine and stagger in drunkenness. The priest and the prophet have erred through wine, they are swallowed up by wine, they wander in drunkenness, they do not know the one who sees, they do not understand judgment.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnes mensæ repletæ sunt vomitu et sordibus, ita quod non est locus mundus.
verses.english: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no clean place.

verses.latin: Cui docebit scientiam? et cui narrabit auditum? lactantibus ablactatis a lacte, trahentibus a mamillis?
verses.english: Whom will he teach knowledge? To whom will he explain the message? To those just weaned, those removed from the breast?

verses.latin: Quia manda, manda, manda, præceptum super præceptum, præceptum super præceptum: modicum illic, modicum illic.
verses.english: For it is: precept upon precept, precept upon precept, a little here, a little there.

verses.latin: In loquela enim labii et linguæ alterius loquetur ad populum istum.
verses.english: For with stammering lips and a foreign tongue, he will speak to this people.

verses.latin: Quibus dixit: Hæc est requies mea, requiescite: et hoc est refrigerium meum. Et noluerunt audire.
verses.english: To whom he said: "This is my rest, take your rest." But they would not listen.

verses.latin: Et erit eis verbum Domini, præceptum super præceptum, præceptum super præceptum: modicum illic, modicum illic: ut vadant, et corruant retrorsum, et conterantur, et capiantur, et teneantur.
verses.english: So the word of the Lord will be to them: precept upon precept, precept upon precept, a little here, a little there; that they may go, and fall backward, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.

verses.latin: Propterea audite verbum Domini, viri inrisores, qui estis in populo isto, qui est in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Therefore, hear the word of the Lord, you scoffers, who are among this people in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Dixistis enim: Percussimus fœdus cum morte, et cum inferno fecimus pactum: cum flagellum inundans transierit, non veniet super nos: quia posuimus mendacium spem nostram, et in fallacia protecti sumus.
verses.english: Because you have said, "We have made a covenant with death, and with hell we have made a pact: when the overflowing scourge passes through, it will not come upon us, because we have made lies our refuge, and we are protected by deceit."

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego mittam in fundamenta Sion lapidem probatum, angularem, pretiosum, in fundamento fundatum: qui crediderit, non festinet.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will lay in Zion a stone, a tried stone, a cornerstone, precious, founded on the foundation: he who believes will not be in haste.

verses.latin: Et ponam in judicium pondus, et in æquitatem mensuram: et ventilabit grando refugium mendacii, et aquæ inundabunt absconditum.
verses.english: And I will make justice the measuring line, and righteousness the plumb line; and the hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters will overflow the hidden place.

verses.latin: Et delendum erit fœdus vestrum cum morte, et pactum vestrum cum inferno non permanebit: cum venerit flagellum inundans, eritis in eo conterriti.
verses.english: And your covenant with death will be annulled, and your pact with hell will not stand; when the overflowing scourge comes, you will be crushed by it.

verses.latin: Quotienscumque transierit, tollet vos: quia mane transiet, et per diem et per noctem: et erit terror solius auditus, ad adnuntiandum doctrinam.
verses.english: As often as it passes, it will take you away; for it will pass through every morning and through the day and through the night, and it will be terror, the mere hearing of the message.

verses.latin: Angustus est enim lectus, ita ut non possit extendi: et brevis est operimentum, ut non possit se operire.
verses.english: For the bed is too short to stretch out on, and the covering is too narrow to wrap oneself in.

verses.latin: Sicut enim in monte Perazim irascetur Dominus: sic in valle Gabaon movebitur, ut faciat opus suum, peregrinum opus suum: et urgeat negotium suum, alienum negotium suum.
verses.english: For as the Lord will be enraged on Mount Perazim, so will he be moved in the valley of Gabaon, to do his work, his strange work, and to accomplish his task, his alien task.

verses.latin: Et nunc nolite inrisores esse, ne forte contineantur funiculi, et consummatio decretoria super universam terram.
verses.english: So now do not be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong, for I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord God of Hosts, determined against the whole earth.

verses.latin: Auscultate et audite vocem meam, audite et audite sermonem meum.
verses.english: Give ear and hear my voice; listen and hear my speech.

verses.latin: Numquid tota die arabit arator ad seminandum? numquid aperiet et sarriet terram suam?
verses.english: Does the plowman plow all day to sow? Does he open and harrow his land all day?

verses.latin: Nonne cum æquaverit faciem ejus, sparget fœnicum, et cumin, et mittet in ea triticum per ordinem, et hordeum, et milium, et viciam in finibus ejus?
verses.english: Does he not level its surface and then scatter the dill, the cumin, and then sow the wheat, barley, and spelt in its proper place?

verses.latin: Et erudiet eum in judicio: Deus suus docebit eum.
verses.english: And God teaches him how to work, He instructs him.

verses.latin: Non enim in serris triturantur fœnices, neque rota carrorum super cumin vertitur: sed fœnicum de flagello excutitur, et cumin virga.
verses.english: For the dill is not threshed with a threshing sledge, nor is the wheel of a cart rolled over the cumin; but the dill is beaten out with a flail, and the cumin with a rod.

verses.latin: Panis contunditur: verumtamen non usquequaque triturabit illud, neque atteret illud rota carrorum, neque comminuet illud per ungulas.
verses.english: Bread is prepared by crushing it, but he will not always be threshing it; nor will he crush it with the wheel of a cart, nor break it with the hooves of his animals.

verses.latin: Et hoc ipsum egreditur a Domino exercituum, mirabile consilium, et magnificum opus.
verses.english: This also comes from the Lord of Hosts: his wondrous counsel, and his great work.

verses.latin: Vae Arioel, Arioel, urbs in qua habitavit David: additæ sunt annis annis: circulus, circulum: et ego coërcebo Arioel.
verses.english: Woe to Jerusalem, Jerusalem, city where David dwelled! Let the years pass: turn your cycles, and I will gather Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et tribular Arioel, et erit luctus et gemitus, et erit mihi quasi Arioel.
verses.english: Jerusalem shall be in distress and I will bring sorrow to the city. Jerusalem will become a city of pain for me.

verses.latin: Et circumdabo quasi globum, et quasi rotam circumdabo te.
verses.english: I will besiege Jerusalem and surround it like a ball or a wheel.

verses.latin: Et humiliaberis, de terra loqueris, et de humo audietur vox tua: et erit quasi pythonis de terra vox tua, et de humo grunnitus tuus audietur.
verses.english: Jerusalem will be humbled and speak from the earth. Your voice will be heard as if it came from the dust. You will be like a python, and your whispers will be heard from the ground.

verses.latin: Et erit sicut pulvis tenuis multitudo viventium tuorum: et sicut favilla transiens multitudo fortium: et erit subito cito.
verses.english: Your many enemies will be like dust. Their great power will be quickly destroyed.

verses.latin: A Domino exercituum visitaberis in tonitru, et in tremore, et in voce magna, venti et procellae, et flamma ignis devorantis.
verses.english: The Lord of hosts will come and punish you with thunder, with earthquake, with loud noise, with storm, with tempest, and with the flame of devouring fire.

verses.latin: Et erit sicut somnium visionis nocturnæ multitudo omnium gentium, quæ pugnaverunt contra Arioel: et universi qui militaverunt contra eam et obsederunt eam.
verses.english: And the multitude of all the nations that fought against Jerusalem will be like a dream. All those who battled against and besieged Jerusalem will be like a dream.

verses.latin: Et sicut esuriens somniat, et comedit, cum autem surrexerit, vacua est anima ejus: et sicut sitiens somniat, et bibit, et cum surrexerit, lassus est, et anima ejus sitiens: sic erit multitudo gentium quæ pugnaverunt contra montem Sion.
verses.english: As a hungry man dreams he is eating, but when he wakes, his stomach is empty, or as a thirsty man dreams he is drinking, but when he wakes, he is exhausted and his soul is still thirsty, so it will be with the multitude of all the nations that warred against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Obstupescete, et admiramini, voluptate afficimini, et clamate: et ebrii estote, et non a vino: movemini, et non a ebrietate.
verses.english: Be astonished, and wonder, and be delighted, and cry out. Be drunk, but not with wine, and stagger, but not with strong drink.

verses.latin: Proiecisti super vos spiritum soporis, clausisti oculos vestros: et obturasti oculos prophetarum vestrorum et vatum vestrorum, et clausisti.
verses.english: God has poured out a spirit of deep sleep on you, and closed your eyes. He has covered the eyes of your prophets and seers.

verses.latin: Et erit vobis visio omnis sicut verba libri signati, quem cum dederint scienti litteras, dicent: Lege hoc, et dicet: Non possum: signatus est enim.
verses.english: Every vision will be like the words of a sealed book. If you give the book to someone who can read, and you say, "Read this", he will reply, "I cannot; it is sealed."

verses.latin: Et dabitur liber nescienti litteras, diceturque ei: Lege hoc, et dicet: Nescio litteras.
verses.english: If the book is given to someone who cannot read and you say, "Read this," he will reply, "I do not know how to read."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus: Quia accedit populus iste labiis suis, et ore suo glorificant me: cor autem eorum longe est a me.
verses.english: The Lord has said, "Because this people approaches me with their mouth, and honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

verses.latin: Ergo ideo ecce ego mittam populo huic: populum: et populum, et doctrinam: et auferam sapientiam a sapientibus ejus, et intellectum a prudentibus ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, I will confound this people with new and wondrous actions, and I will take away the wisdom of the wise, and the understanding of the prudent.

verses.latin: Væ qui profundi estis corde ut abscondatis consilium vestrum a Domino: et fiunt in tenebris opera vestra, et dicitis: Quis videt nos? et quis novit nos?
verses.english: Woe to those who are deep in heart, and hide their counsel from the Lord, and whose works are in the dark, who say: "Who sees us? And who knows us?"

verses.latin: Perversa est hæc cogitatio vestra: quasi lutum figuli: et dicet factura factori suo: Non fecit me, et figmentum dicet figulo suo: Non intelligis.
verses.english: Your thinking is perverse, like the clay of the potter. Will the thing made say to the maker, "He did not make me?" Or will a work say to the craftsman, "He does not understand?"

verses.latin: Nonne adhuc in modico, et convertetur Libanus in Carmelum? et Carmelus in silvam reputabitur?
verses.english: In a little while, will Lebanon not be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted as a forest?

verses.latin: Et audient in die illa surdi verba libri, et de tenebris et caligine oculi cæcorum videbunt.
verses.english: In that day, the deaf will hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind will see after darkness and obscurity.

verses.latin: Et augebunt mites in Domino, et pauperes in gaudio Sancti Israel.
verses.english: The meek will increase their joy in the Lord, and the poor will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Quia consumptus est qui fortis est, et confecta est injuria, et succisi sunt omnes qui vigilabant in iniquitate.
verses.english: For the mighty will be brought to nothing, the oppressor will be finished, and all those who watched for iniquity will be cut off.

verses.latin: Qui peccare faciebant homines in verbo, et qui supplantabant eum qui arguebat in porta, et declinaverunt in vanitate justo.
verses.english: They cause men to sin in the word, and supplant those who rebuke in the gate, and they turn aside from the just.

verses.latin: Ideo hæc dicit Dominus ad domum Jacob, qui redemit Abraham: Non modo confundetur Jacob, nec modo contristabitur vultus ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord to the house of Jacob, who redeemed Abraham, "Jacob will not now be ashamed, nor will his face now be sad.

verses.latin: Sed cum viderit filios suos, opera manuum mearum in medio ejus, sanctificantes nomen meum: et sanctificabunt Sanctum Jacob, et Sanctum Israel timebunt.
verses.english: But when he sees his children, the works of my hands in their midst, sanctifying my name, they will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and will fear the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Et scient errantes spiritu intellectum, et murmuratores discent legem.
verses.english: And those who err in spirit will know understanding, and the murmurers will learn the law.

verses.latin: Vae filiis desertorum, dicit Dominus, qui inchoant consilium, et non ex me, et texunt telam, et non per spiritum meum, ut addant peccatum super peccatum.
verses.english: Woe to the sons of the desert, says the Lord, who begin plans that are not from Me, and weave a fabric of deception, not by My Spirit, so that they pile sin upon sin.

verses.latin: Qui ambulant ut descendant in Aegyptum, et os meum non interrogaverunt, sperantes in umbra Pharaonis, et protecti in umbraculo Aegypti.
verses.english: They travel to go down to Egypt, and have not asked My counsel, trusting in the shadow of Pharaoh, seeking protection in the shelter of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et erit vobis fortitudo Pharaonis in confusionem, et fiducia umbrae Aegypti in ignominiam.
verses.english: The strength of Pharaoh will be your shame, and the confidence you have in the shadow of Egypt will be to your disgrace.

verses.latin: Quoniam fuerunt in Tanios principes ejus, et nuntii ejus venerunt in Hanes.
verses.english: For the leaders of Egypt were at Tanis, and its envoys came to Hanes.

verses.latin: Omnes confusi sunt super populo, qui eis non proderit: non erunt in auxilio, neque in utilitatem, sed in confusionem et in ignominiam.
verses.english: All will be ashamed because of the people, who will not profit them: they will be of no help, nor of any use, but will bring shame and disgrace.

verses.latin: Onus bestiarum austri: in terra tribulationis et angustiae, leo, et leo a quo leo, et vipera regulus volans: portantes super humeros asellorum divitias suas, et super gibbum camelorum thesauros suos, ad populum qui eis proderit.
verses.english: The burden of the beasts of the south: in the land of tribulation and anguish, the lion, the lioness, the viper, and the flying serpent: they carry on the shoulders of asses their riches, and on the humps of camels their treasures, to a people who will not profit them.

verses.latin: Aegyptus frustra et in vanum auxiliabitur: propter hoc clamavi, superba, quiesce.
verses.english: Egypt will vainly help and give nothing: therefore I have cried out to Egypt, "Be still."

verses.latin: Nunc vade, scribe illud in libro, et in codice conpone, ut sit in die novissimo in testimonium usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: Now go, write this in a book, and record it on a tablet, so that it may be for the last day, as a testimony forever.

verses.latin: Populus enim inritans est, filii mendaces, filii nolentes audire legem Dei.
verses.english: For this is a rebellious people, lying children, children unwilling to hear the law of God.

verses.latin: Qui dicunt videntibus: Nolite videre: et videntibus: Nolite contemplari nobis ea quae recta sunt: loquimini nobis placentia, videte nobis errores.
verses.english: They say to the seers: “Do not see visions,” and to those who have visions, “Do not look at things that are right; speak to us smooth things, see for us delusions.”

verses.latin: Recedite de via, declinate de semita, auferte a facie nostra Sanctum Israël.
verses.english: Turn aside from the way, turn aside from the path, remove the Holy One of Israel from our sight.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Sanctus Israël: Pro eo quod projicitis verbum istud, et confiditis in calumnia et tumultu, et innitimini super eo:
verses.english: Therefore, the Holy One of Israel says: “Because you despise this word, and trust in deceit and rebellion, and rely on it:
