verses.english: Let your false gods come forward and tell us whatever things are yet to come. Declare to us the events of the past and explain their meaning, so that we may ponder them and understand their ultimate outcome. Or, even better, announce to us the things that are yet to come!

verses.latin: Annuntiate quae ventura sunt in futurum, et sciemus quia dii estis vos: et benefacite, vel malum facite, ut intelligamus, et videamus simul.
verses.english: Announce the things that will happen in the distant future, and then we will know that you truly are gods. Do something good, or do something evil—anything at all—so that we may understand and see it together as evidence.

verses.latin: Ecce vos estis nihil, et opus vestrum nihilum est: abominatio est qui elegit vos.
verses.english: Behold, you false gods are absolutely nothing, and anything you do or claim to do is equally nothing. Whoever chooses to worship you is an abomination.

verses.latin: Suscitavi ab aquilone, et veniet: ab ortu solis invocabo nomen ejus: et adducet magistratus quasi lutum, et quasi figulus conculcans humum.
verses.english: I have raised up a ruler from the north, and he will come. From the rising of the sun (the East), I will declare his name, and he will bring down rulers and officials as if they were mere mud, trampling them down like a potter treads clay.

verses.latin: Quis annuntiavit ab exordio, ut sciamus: et a prioribus, ut dicamus: Justus es? Nemo est qui annuntiet, neque aliquis est qui praedicat, neque aliquis est qui audiat sermones vestros.
verses.english: Which of your false gods has announced these things from the beginning, so that we might know? Which of them foretold events long ago, so that we might say: 'He is righteous and true'? There is no one among them who declares anything, no one who proclaims, and no one who even hears your words.

verses.latin: Primus ad Sion dicam: Ecce adsunt: et Jerusalem dabo evangelistam.
verses.english: I, the Lord, am the First to say to Sion: 'Behold, the promised events are already here!' And to Jerusalem, I will send a messenger who brings good news and proclaims it.

verses.latin: Et vidi, et non erat, ex istis, quisquam qui consuleret, vel interrogatus responderet verbum.
verses.english: And I, the Lord, looked, and there was not a single one among their idols or their prophets who could give any counsel, or who could answer a single word when asked.

verses.latin: Ecce omnes isti iniqua, et irrita: opera eorum nihil sunt, et ventus et inane, simulacra eorum.
verses.english: Behold, all of these idols are empty and worthless. Their works are absolutely nothing, and their sculpted images are mere wind and empty air.

verses.latin: Ecce servus meus, suscipiam eum, electus meus, complacuit sibi in illo anima mea: dedi spiritum meum super illum, judicium gentibus proferet.
verses.english: Look at My Servant. I uphold Him. He is My chosen one, and my very soul is delighted by Him. I have given My Spirit to rest upon Him; He will bring forth justice to all the nations of the world.

verses.latin: Non clamabit, nec accipiet personam, nec audietur vox ejus foris.
verses.english: He will not shout for attention, nor will He raise His voice in a boastful way. His voice will not be heard loudly in the public squares.

verses.latin: Calamum quassatum non conteret, et linum fumigans non extinguet: in veritate educet judicium.
verses.english: He will not break the weakest and most fragile among us, like a bruised reed. He will not extinguish a flickering flame, like a smoldering wick —He will preserve and restore even the weakest. He will faithfully bring forth justice, upholding the truth.

verses.latin: Non turbabitur, neque contristabitur, donec ponat in terra judicium: et legem ejus insulae expectabunt.
verses.english: He will not grow faint, nor will He be discouraged, until He has established true justice on the earth. Even the distant lands and all the islands will eagerly await His teaching and His law.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus, creans cælos, et extendens eos; firmans terram, et quæ germinant ex ea; dans flatum populo qui est super eam, et spiritum his qui ambulant in ea.
verses.english: This is what the Lord God says—He who created the entire universe and stretched out its vastness, He who established the Earth and all that grows from it, He who gives the very breath of life to all people upon it, and the spirit of life to all who walk on its surface.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus vocavi te in justitia, et apprehendi manum tuam: et servavi te, et dedi te in fœdus populi, et in lucem gentium.
verses.english: I, the Lord, have called you—My Servant—in righteousness, and I have taken hold of your hand. I have preserved you, and I have given you to be a New Covenant for all people, and a light to all the nations of the world.

verses.latin: Ut aperires oculos cæcorum, et educeres de conclusione vinctum, de domo carceris sedentes in tenebris.
verses.english: So that you would open the eyes of those who are spiritually blind. So that you would lead the bound captives out of their confinement. So that you would bring those who sit in the darkness of the prison house into the light.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus, hoc est nomen meum: gloriam meam alteri non dabo, et laudem meam sculptilibus.
verses.english: I am the Lord—this is My Name, the name above all names. I will not give My glory to any other, nor will I give the praise due to Me to idols or carved images.

verses.latin: Prima quæque a principio ecce venerunt: nova quoque ego annuntio, antequam oriantur, audita vobis faciam.
verses.english: Look, the former prophecies have already come to pass. Now I am announcing new things to you. Even before they come into being, I will cause you to hear about them.

verses.latin: Cantate Domino canticum novum, laus ejus ab extremis terræ. Qui descenditis in mare, et plenitudo ejus; insulæ, et habitatores earum.
verses.english: Sing a new song to the Lord. Let His praise resound from the uttermost ends of the Earth. Let all those who sail on the sea, and everything that fills it—every island, and all their inhabitants—sing praises.

verses.latin: Sublevetur desertum et civitates ejus; in domibus Cedar habitatores ejus lætentur. Laudate, qui habitatis petram; de capite montium clamate.
verses.english: Let the desert lands and all their cities lift up their voices in praise. Let the inhabitants of the tents of Kedar rejoice. Let those who dwell in the rock fortresses praise Him. Let them shout for joy from the tops of the mountains.

verses.latin: Ponant Domino gloriam, et laudem ejus in insulis nuntient.
verses.english: Let them give all glory to the Lord, and let them declare His praise throughout all the islands.

verses.latin: Dominus sicut fortis egredietur, sicut vir præliator suscitabit zelum: vociferabitur, et clamabit, super inimicos suos confortabitur.
verses.english: The Lord will go forth like a mighty warrior. He will stir up His holy zeal like a man of war. He will shout His battle cry and cry aloud. He will show His great power over all His enemies.

verses.latin: Tacui a longe, silui, patienter tuli, sicut parturiens loquar, dissipabo et absorbebo simul.
verses.english: I have been silent for a long time. I have been still and have patiently held Myself back. Now, like a woman in childbirth, I will cry out—I will pant and gasp, and I will destroy and consume all at once.

verses.latin: Desolabo montes et colles, et omne gramen eorum arefaciam: et ponam flumina in insulas, et stagna arefaciam.
verses.english: I will lay waste to the mountains and the hills, and I will dry up all their vegetation. I will turn rivers into dry land, like islands, and I will dry up all the stagnant pools.

verses.latin: Et ducam cæcos in viam quam nesciunt, et in semitis quas ignoraverunt, ingredi eos faciam: convertam tenebras ante eos in lucem, et prava in directa: hæc feci eis, et non dereliqui eos.
verses.english: And I will lead those who are spiritually blind in a way they do not know. I will make them walk in paths they have not known before. I will turn the darkness before them into brilliant light, and I will make the crooked paths straight. These are the things I have done for them, and I have not forsaken them.

verses.latin: Conversi sunt retrorsum: confundantur confusione, qui confidunt in sculptili, qui dicunt conflatili: Vos estis dii nostri.
verses.english: But those who have turned back to their idols will be utterly put to shame. Those who trust in carved images and those who say to molten images, “You are our gods”—they will be confused and humiliated.

verses.latin: Audite surdi, et intuemini cæci ad videndum.
verses.english: Listen, you who are spiritually deaf. Look intently, you who are spiritually blind, so that you may truly see.

verses.latin: Quis cæcus, nisi servus meus? et surdus, nisi ad quem Angelum meum misi? Quis cæcus, nisi is qui venundatus est? et quis cæcus, nisi servus Domini?
verses.english: Who is truly blind, except My servant Israel? Who is truly deaf, except the one to whom I have sent My messenger, the prophet? Who is truly blind, except he who has betrayed Me and been given over to his enemies? And who is truly blind, except this servant of the Lord?

verses.latin: Videns multa, non attendisti: aperiens aures, non audisti.
verses.english: You have seen many wonderful things, yet you did not pay attention. You have opened your ears, yet you did not truly hear.

verses.latin: Dominus voluit propter justitiam suam ut magnificaret, et honorificaret legem.
verses.english: The Lord, because of His own perfect righteousness, was pleased to make His law magnificent and to bring it great honor.

verses.latin: Ipse vero populus direptus est et vastatus: laqueus adolescentium omnes, et in domibus carcerum absconditi sunt. Facti sunt in rapinam, et non est qui eruat: in direptionem, et non est qui dicat: Redde.
verses.english: But this same people—Israel—has been plundered and ravaged. All of them are trapped in snares, and they are hidden away in prison cells. They have become prey, and there is no one to rescue them. They have been plundered, and there is no one who says, “Give it back!”

verses.latin: Quis est in vobis, qui audiat hoc, attendat, et auscultet in futurum?
verses.english: Who among you will truly listen to this warning? Who will pay attention and truly hear what I am saying about your future?

verses.latin: Quis dedit in direptionem Jacob, et Israel robbantis? Numquid non Dominus, cui peccavimus? Et noluerunt in viis ejus ambulare, et non audierunt legem ejus.
verses.english: Who handed Jacob over to be plundered, and Israel over to the robbers? Was it not the Lord Himself, against whom we have sinned? For they were unwilling to walk in His ways, and they refused to listen to His law.

verses.latin: Et effudit super eum iram furoris sui, et forte bellum, et combussit eum in circuitu, et non cognovit: et succendit eum, et non intellexit.
verses.english: So He poured out upon Israel the heat of His fierce anger and the might of a terrible war. It burned all around them, yet they did not recognize its divine cause. It consumed them with fire, yet they did not understand the meaning of it.

verses.latin: Et nunc haec dicit Dominus creans te Jacob, et formans te Israel: Noli timere, quia redemi te, et vocavi te nomine tuo: meus es tu.
verses.english: And now, the Lord who created you, Jacob, and who formed you, Israel, says these things: "Do not be afraid, for I have rescued you, and I have called you by your very own name. You are Mine, My special possession."

verses.latin: Cum transieris per aquas, tecum ero, et flumina non operient te: cum ambulaveris in igne, non combureris, et flamma non ardebit in te.
verses.english: When you pass through difficult waters, I will be with you; even mighty rivers will not overwhelm you. When you walk through fiery trials, you will not be burned, and the flame will not scorch you.

verses.latin: Quia ego Dominus Deus tuus, Sanctus Israel, Salvator tuus: dedi propitiationem tuam Aegyptum, Aethiopiam, et Saba pro te.
verses.english: For I am the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel, your Savior. As a ransom and a price for your freedom, I have given Egypt, Ethiopia, and Seba for you.

verses.latin: Ex quo honorabilis factus es in oculis meis, et gloriosus: ego dilexi te, et dabo homines pro te, et populos pro anima tua.
verses.english: Since you became precious and glorious in My eyes, I have loved you. I will give other people in exchange for you, and entire nations for the sake of your life.

verses.latin: Noli timere, quia tecum ego sum: ab oriente adducam semen tuum, et ab occidente congregabo te.
verses.english: Do not be afraid, for I am with you. I will bring your descendants from the east, and I will gather you from the west.

verses.latin: Dicam aquiloni: Da; et austro: Noli prohibere: affer de longinquo filios meos, et filias meas ab extremis terrae.
verses.english: I will say to the north: 'Give them up!' And to the south: 'Do not hold them back!' Bring My sons from distant lands, and My daughters from the farthest ends of the earth.

verses.latin: Et omnem qui invocat nomen meum, in gloriam meam creavi eum, formavi eum, et feci eum.
verses.english: Every person who invokes My name, I created them for My glory. I formed them, and I made them for this very purpose.

verses.latin: Educ foras populum caecum, et oculos habentem: et surdum, et aures illi sunt.
verses.english: Bring forth the people who are spiritually blind, though they possess physical eyes. Bring forth the people who are spiritually deaf, though they have physical ears.

verses.latin: Omnes gentes congregatae sunt simul, et collecti sunt populi. Quis ex eis annuntiet istud, et quae de primis nuntiate nobis? Afferant testes suos, et justificentur, et audiant, et dicant: Vere.
verses.english: All the nations have gathered together, and the peoples have assembled. Who among them can declare what is coming, and who can tell us what happened in the distant past? Let them bring their witnesses to justify themselves, so that they may hear and truly say: 'It is true!'

verses.latin: Vos estis testes mei, dicit Dominus, et servus meus, quem elegi: ut sciatis, et credatis mihi, et intelligatis quia ego ipse sum. Ante me non est factus Deus, et post me non erit.
verses.english: You are My witnesses, says the Lord, and My chosen servant. This is so that you may know Me, and believe in Me, and truly understand that I am He—the one true God. No other god was formed before Me, and no other god will exist after Me.

verses.latin: Ego, ego sum Dominus, et praeter me non est salvator.
verses.english: I, even I, am the Lord, and there is no other savior besides Me.

verses.latin: Ego annuntiavi, et salvavi: auditum feci, et non fuit in vobis alienus: vos testes mei, dicit Dominus, et ego Deus.
verses.english: I am the one who declared the future, and I am the one who brought salvation. I made it known to you, and there was no foreign god among you to do these things. You are My witnesses, says the Lord, and I am God.

verses.latin: Et ab initio ego ipse, et non est qui de manu mea eruat: operabor, et quis avertet illud?
verses.english: From the very beginning of all things, I am He. There is no one who can rescue anything from My hand. When I choose to act, who can possibly stop or reverse it?

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus redemptor vester, Sanctus Israel: Propter vos emisi in Babylonem, et detraxi universos vectes, et Chaldæos in navibus suis gloriantes.
verses.english: The Lord, your Rescuer, the Holy One of Israel, says these things: 'For your sake, I have sent forces against Babylon. I will bring down all its defensive bars and gates, and bring ruin to the Chaldeans who boast in their ships.'

verses.latin: Ego Dominus Sanctus vester, creans Israel, Rex vester.
verses.english: I am the Lord, your Holy One, the One who created Israel, your King.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus, qui dedit in mari viam, et in aquis torrentibus semitam.
verses.english: The Lord, who made a path through the sea (as in the Exodus), and a way through raging waters, says these things.

verses.latin: Qui eduxit in quadrigis et equis, in exercitu et robusto: simul dormierunt, et non surrexerunt: contriti sunt quasi linum, et exstincti.
verses.english: He is the One who led out chariots, horses, and a powerful, mighty army, (referring to the Egyptians). They all lay down together in death and did not rise again. They were crushed and extinguished like a wick of flax.

verses.latin: Nolite meminisse priorum, et antiqua ne cogitetis.
verses.english: Do not dwell on the past events; do not keep thinking about the ancient things.

verses.latin: Ecce ego facio nova, et nunc orietur quidem: numquid non scietis illam? Faciam in deserto viam, et in invio flumina.
verses.english: Behold, I am now doing something new, and it is already springing forth. Will you not perceive it? I will make a way in the wilderness, and I will create rivers in desolate places.

verses.latin: Honorificabit me bestia agri, dracones, et struthiones: quia dedi in deserto aquas, flumina in invio, ut darem potum populo meo, electo meo.
verses.english: The wild beasts of the field will honor Me, even the jackals and the ostriches, because I provide waters in the wilderness and rivers in desolate lands. I do this to give drink to My people, My chosen ones.

verses.latin: Populum istum formavi mihi, sermonem meum narrabit.
verses.english: This people I formed and made for Myself; they will proclaim My praise and declare My story to the world.

verses.latin: Non me invocasti, Jacob, nec laborasti in me, Israel.
verses.english: But you have not called upon Me, Jacob. And you have not toiled in worship or service for Me, Israel.

verses.latin: Non attulisti mihi arietem holocausti tui, et victimis tuis non glorificasti me: non servivi tibi in oblatione, nec praebui tibi laborem in thure.
verses.english: You did not bring Me a ram for your burnt offering, nor did you glorify Me with your animal sacrifices. I did not burden you with grain offerings, nor did I impose upon you the toil of providing incense.

verses.latin: Non emisti mihi argento calamum, et adipe victimarum tuarum non inebriasti me: sed servire me fecisti in peccatis tuis, et iniquitatibus tuis præbuisti mihi laborem.
verses.english: You did not buy Me sweet cane (for incense) with silver, nor did you satisfy Me with the fat of your sacrifices. Instead, you have made Me serve you with your sins, and you have burdened Me with your iniquities.

verses.latin: Ego, ego sum qui deleo iniquitates tuas propter me, et peccatorum tuorum non recordabor.
verses.english: I, even I, am He who blots out your transgressions for My own sake, because of My own nature and honor. And I will not remember your sins anymore.

verses.latin: Reduc me in judicium: narra si quid habes ut justificeris.
verses.english: Challenge Me to a trial: present your case. Tell Me if you have anything to justify yourself.

verses.latin: Pater tuus primus peccavit, et interpretes tui prævaricati sunt in me.
verses.english: Your first ancestral father sinned, and your own spokesmen and mediators have rebelled against Me.

verses.latin: Et contaminavi principes sanctos, et dedi ad internecionem Jacob, et in opprobrium Israel.
verses.english: Therefore, I have profaned your holy princes, and I have given Jacob over to utter destruction, and Israel to disgrace and reproach.

verses.latin: Et nunc audi, Iacob, serve meus, et Israel, quem elegi.
verses.english: And now, listen, Jacob, My servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus te faciens et formans ab utero, auxiliator tuus: Noli timere, serve meus Iacob, et recte dirige, Israel, quem elegi.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says, He who made you and formed you from the womb, your helper: Do not fear, My servant Jacob, and be steadfast, Israel, whom I have chosen.

verses.latin: Effundam enim aquas super sitientem, et fluenta super aridam: effundam spiritum meum super semen tuum, et benedictionem meam super stirpem tuam.
verses.english: For I will pour refreshing waters upon the thirsty, and abundant streams upon the dry land; I will pour My Spirit upon your offspring, and My blessing upon your descendants.

verses.latin: Et nascentur quasi inter herbas, sicut salices juxta praeterfluentes aquas.
verses.english: And they will grow up quickly, like grass among other plants, like willows next to flowing water.

verses.latin: Iste dicet: Domini ego sum: et ille vocabit nomine suo Iacob: et alius scribet manu sua, Domini, et nomine Israel assimilabitur.
verses.english: One person will say: 'I belong to the Lord.' Another will declare himself by the name of Jacob. Another will write with his own hand, 'I am the Lord's,' and will be called by the name of Israel.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus rex Israel, et redemptor ejus Dominus exercituum: Ego primus, et ego novissimus, et absque me non est Deus.
verses.english: This is what the Lord, the King of Israel, says, and its Redeemer, the Lord of all creation: I am the first, and I am the last, and besides Me there is no God.

verses.latin: Et quis similis mei? Vocet, et annuntiet, et ordinem suum disponat mihi, ex quo constitui populum antiquum: et futura et quae ventura sunt annuntient vobis.
verses.english: And who is like Me? Let him call out, and let him declare; let him set forth his claims to Me—from the time I established the ancient people—and let them announce to you the things to come and what will happen.

verses.latin: Nolite timere, neque conturbemini: ex tunc audita fecistis mihi, et annuntiastis. Nonne ab initio ego sum, et extra me non est Deus? Nec est ultra lapis, quem non cognovi.
verses.english: Do not fear, nor be troubled. Have I not made you hear and proclaimed these things from that time? Is it not true that I am from the beginning, and there is no God besides Me? There is no other 'rock'—no other false god—that I do not know exists.

verses.latin: Fabricatores idoli omnes nihil sunt, et amantissima eorum, non proderunt eis: ipsi sunt testes eorum, quia non vident, neque intelligunt, ut confundantur.
verses.english: All who make idols are worthless, and their most cherished creations will not profit them. These idol-makers themselves are witnesses that the idols neither see nor understand, so that those who worship them may be put to shame.

verses.latin: Quis formavit deum, et sculptile conflavit ad nihilum?
verses.english: Who formed a god? And who cast a graven image that does absolutely nothing?

verses.latin: Ecce omnes participes ejus confudentur: fabri ex hominibus sunt: conveniant omnes, stent, et paveant, et simul confundantur.
verses.english: Behold, all who participate in this will be put to shame. The craftsmen are merely human beings. Let them all gather, let them stand forth, and let them be terrified, and together be utterly confounded.

verses.latin: Faber ferrarius lima operatur, in carbonibus, et in malleis format illud, et operatur in brachio fortitudinis suae: esurit denique, et deficit, bibit aquam, et lassescit.
verses.english: The blacksmith works with a file, heating it in coals; with hammers he shapes it. He works with the full strength of his arm, but eventually, he hungers and grows faint. He drinks water and becomes weary.

verses.latin: Artifex lignarius, mensura extendit, et in runcina delineavit illud: fecit illud in angularibus, et in circino tornavit illud: et fecit imaginem viri quasi pulchri hominis, et sedentem in domo.
verses.english: The wood craftsman stretches out his measuring line, and with a marking tool he sketches it out. He makes it with corners, and with a compass he rounds it. He then fashions an image of a man, as if of a handsome man, and sets it up to sit in a house.

verses.latin: Caedit sibi cedros, assumit ilicem, et quercum, quae creverat inter ligna saltus: plantavit pinum, et pluvia nutrivit.
verses.english: He cuts down cedars for himself; he takes a holm oak and an oak that grew among the trees of the forest. He plants a pine tree, and the rain nourishes it.

verses.latin: Et erit homini in fomitem, et assumit ex eis ut calefaciat: et succendit, et coquit panes: et de reliquis operatur deum, et adorat: facit sculptile, et curvatur ante illud.
verses.english: And some of it will be for a man as fuel. He takes part of it to warm himself, and he kindles it and bakes bread. But from the rest of it, he makes a god and worships it. He carves an idol and bows down before it.

verses.latin: Medium ejus combussit igni, et de medio ejus carnes comedit, assuitque assaturam, et saturatus est: et calefactus est, et dixit: Vah, calefactus sum, vidi ignem.
verses.english: Half of the wood he burns in the fire, and with it he cooks meat; he roasts his roast and is satisfied. He gets warm and says: 'Ah, I am warm! I have seen the fire!'

verses.latin: Et reliquum ejus in deum fecit, in sculptile sibi: curvatur ante illud, et adorat, et obsecrat dicens: Salva me, quia deus meus es tu.
verses.english: And the rest of it he makes into a god, into a carved image for himself. He bows down before it, and worships, and implores it, saying: 'Save me, for you are my god!'

verses.latin: Nescierunt, neque intellexerunt: obvoluta est enim ne viderent, et ne intelligerent corda eorum.
verses.english: They have neither known nor understood, for their eyes are covered so that they cannot see, and their hearts cannot understand.

verses.latin: Non cogitat in mente sua, neque cognoscit, neque intelligit ut dicat: Medium ejus combussi igni, et coxi super carbones ejus panes: assui carnes, et comedi: et de reliquo ejus idolum faciam? ante truncum ligni prosternar?
verses.english: Such a person does not think in his mind, nor does he know or understand enough to say: 'I burned half of it with fire, and I baked bread over its coals. I roasted meat and ate it. And from the rest of it, shall I make an idol? Shall I prostrate myself before a mere block of wood?'

verses.latin: Cinerem nutrit cor ejus: et errans in mente sua declinavit, et animam suam eruere non poterit, neque dicere: Non, mendacium est in dextera mea.
verses.english: His heart feeds on ashes. He has wandered astray in his mind and cannot deliver his soul, nor can he even recognize and say: 'Surely, there is a lie in my right hand!'

verses.latin: Memento horum, Iacob, et Israel, quoniam servus meus es tu. Formavi te, servus meus es tu: Israel, ne obliviscaris mei.
verses.english: Remember these things, Jacob, and Israel, because you are My servant. I formed you, you are My servant. Israel, do not forget Me.

verses.latin: Delevi ut nubem iniquitates tuas, et sicut nebulam peccata tua: revertere ad me, quoniam redemi te.
verses.english: I have blotted out your iniquities like a cloud, and your sins like a mist. Return to Me, because I have redeemed you.

verses.latin: Laudate, caeli, quoniam fecit Dominus: jubilate, montes, laudem, et saltus, et omne lignum ejus: quoniam redemit Dominus Iacob, et Israel gloriabitur.
verses.english: Praise, O heavens, because the Lord has accomplished this! Shout for joy, mountains, and offer praise! Let the forests and every tree in them rejoice! For the Lord has redeemed Jacob, and Israel will glorify Him!

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus redemptor tuus, et formans te ex utero: Ego sum Dominus, faciens omnia, extendens caelos solus, firmans terram, et nullus mecum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord, your Redeemer, says, and He who formed you from the womb: I am the Lord, who makes all things, who stretches out the universe alone, who establishes the earth, and no one was with Me.

verses.latin: Qui irrita facio signa arusorum, et divinos quasi stultos efficio: qui converto sapientes retrorsum, et scientiam eorum stultam facio:
verses.english: It is I who frustrate the signs of diviners and make fortune-tellers seem like fools. I am He who turns the wise backward and makes their knowledge seem foolish.

verses.latin: Qui confirmo sermonem servi mei, et consilium nuntiorum meorum compleo: qui dico Ierusalem: Aedificaberis: et civitatibus Iuda: Reaedificabimini: et deserta ejus suscitabo:
verses.english: It is I who confirm the word of My servant and fulfill the counsel of My messengers. I am He who says to Jerusalem: 'You shall be built!' and to the cities of Judah: 'You shall be rebuilt!' and I will raise up its desolate places.

verses.latin: Qui dico profundo: Desolare, et flumina tua arefeciam:
verses.english: It is I who say to the deep waters: 'Be desolate!' and 'I will dry up your rivers!'

verses.latin: Qui dico Cyro: Pastor meus es, et omnem voluntatem meam complebis: qui dico Ierusalem: Aedificaberis: et templo: Fundaberis.
verses.english: It is I who say to Cyrus: 'You are My shepherd, and you shall fulfill all My will!' I am He who says to Jerusalem: 'You shall be built!' and to the Temple: 'You shall be founded!'

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus uncto meo Cyro, cujus apprehendi dexteram, ut subjiciam ante faciem ejus gentes, et dorsa regum vertam, et aperiam coram eo januas, et portae non claudantur:
verses.english: This is what the Lord says to Cyrus, His anointed one—His chosen instrument, whom I have grasped by his right hand. I have empowered him to subdue nations before him, to make kings turn and flee, and to open city gates before him so that no city gates can be shut against him.

verses.latin: Ego ante te ibo, et gloriosos terrae humiliabo: portas aereas conteram, et vectes ferreos confringam:
verses.english: I Myself will go before you, Cyrus, and bring down the mighty rulers of the earth. I will shatter gates of bronze and break into pieces the iron bars of cities.

verses.latin: Et dabo tibi thesauros absconditos, et arcana secretorum: ut scias quia ego Dominus, qui voco nomen tuum, Deus Israël.
verses.english: I will give you hidden treasures and the secret riches stored away in the dark places of conquered cities, so that you may know that I am the Lord. I am the One who calls you by your name, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Propter servum meum Jacob, et Israël electum meum, et vocavi te nomine tuo, et assimilavi te, et non cognovisti me.
verses.english: It is for the sake of My servant Jacob, for the sake of Israel, My chosen people, that I have called you, Cyrus, by your name and given you a significant title and purpose—even though you do not know Me personally.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus, et non est ultra Deus absque me: non est Deus: accinxi te, et non cognovisti me,
verses.english: I am the Lord, and there is no other God besides Me. There is absolutely no other God. I have armed you and prepared you for your mission, Cyrus, even though you have not known Me.

verses.latin: ut sciant ab ortu solis et ab occidente, quoniam absque me non est Deus: ego Dominus, et non est alter.
verses.english: I do this so that from the rising of the sun to its setting—throughout the entire world—people will know that there is no God besides Me. I am the Lord, and there is no other God.

verses.latin: Ego formans lucem et creans tenebras, faciens pacem et creans malum: ego Dominus faciens omnia hæc.
verses.english: I am the One who forms light and creates darkness, just as in the beginning of the universe. I am the One who brings about peace and allows calamity to occur for My purposes. I am the Lord who does all these things.

verses.latin: Rorate, cæli, desuper, et nubes pluant justum: aperiatur terra, et germinet Salvatorem, et justitia oriatur simul: ego Dominus creavi illud.
verses.english: Let the skies shower down from above, and let the clouds rain down the Righteous One. Let the earth open up and bring forth a Savior, and let righteousness spring up alongside Him. I, the Lord, have created all of this.

verses.latin: Væ qui contradicit fictori suo, testula de testaceis terræ. Numquid dicet lutum figulo suo: Quid facis, et opus tuum absque manibus est?
verses.english: Woe to the one who argues with his Maker—a mere piece of pottery among the earthen vessels! Does the clay say to its potter, 'What are you making?' or 'Your work lacks skill!'

verses.latin: Væ qui dicit patri: Quid generas? et mulieri: Quid parturis?
verses.english: Woe to the one who says to a father, 'What kind of child are you bringing into the world?' and to a mother, 'What are you bringing forth in childbirth?'

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus, Sanctus Israël, et plastes ejus: futura interrogate me super filios meos, et super opus manuum mearum mandastis mihi.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says—the Holy One of Israel, your Maker and Former: 'Do you question Me about the future concerning My children? And do you presume to command Me concerning the work of My hands?'

verses.latin: Ego feci terram, et hominem super eam creavi: ego manus meae tetenderunt cælos, et omni militiae eorum mandavi.
verses.english: I Myself made the earth, and I created mankind upon it. My own hands stretched out the universe, and I gave commands to all the stars and celestial bodies within it.

verses.latin: Ego suscitavi illum ad justitiam, et omnes vias ejus dirigam: ipse ædificabit civitatem meam, et captivitatem meam dimittet, non in pretio, neque in muneribus, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: I have raised him up—Cyrus—for a righteous purpose, and I will make all his paths straight. He will command the rebuilding of My city, Jerusalem, and he will release My captive people, the Israelites, not for any ransom or bribe, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Labor Ægypti, et negotiatio Æthiopiae, et Sabaim viri sublimes ad te transibunt, et tui erunt: post te ambulabunt, vincti manibus transibunt, et te adorabunt, teque deprecabuntur. Non est, inquiunt, Deus absque te, et non est Deus alter præter te.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: 'The wealth of Egypt and the merchandise of Ethiopia, and the tall men of Saba, shall come over to you, O Israel, and be yours. They shall follow behind you, coming over to you in chains of submission. They will bow down to you and plead with you, declaring: "Surely, God is only found with you, and there is no other God besides Him! There is absolutely no other God!"'

verses.latin: Vere tu es Deus absconditus, Deus Israël, Salvator.
verses.english: Truly, You are a God who remains hidden in Your ways, O God of Israel, our Savior.

verses.latin: Confusi sunt, et erubuerunt omnes: simul abierunt in confusionem fabricatores erroris.
verses.english: All those who worship idols will be confused and ashamed. Together, the makers of false gods will go into confusion and disgrace.

verses.latin: Israël salvatus est in Domino salute æterna: non confundemini, et non erubescetis usque in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: But Israel is saved by the Lord with an everlasting salvation. You will never be put to shame or disgraced, for all eternity.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus creans cælos, ipse Deus formans terram, et faciens eam, ipse firmavit eam, non inane creavit eam, ut habitaretur formavit eam: Ego Dominus, et non est alter.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says—the One who created the universe. He is God, the One who formed the earth, made it, and established it firmly. He did not create it to be a formless void or empty chaos; He formed it specifically to be inhabited. I am the Lord, and there is no other God.

verses.latin: Non in abscondito locutus sum, in loco terræ tenebroso: non dixi semini Jacob frustra: Quaerite me. Ego Dominus loquens justitiam, annuntians recta.
verses.english: I have not spoken in secret ways, nor from a dark, hidden place of the earth. I have not said to the descendants of Jacob, 'Seek Me in vain.' I am the Lord, speaking truth and declaring what is right.

verses.latin: Congregamini, et venite, et accedite simul, qui salvati estis ex gentibus: nescierunt qui levant lignum sculptile suum, et rogant deum non salvantem.
verses.english: Assemble yourselves and come, draw near together, you who have been rescued from the nations! They have no knowledge—those who carry around their wooden idols and pray to a god that is powerless to save them.

verses.latin: Annuntiate, et venite, et consiliamini simul: quis annuntiavit ab initio, ex tunc, et praedixit hæc? numquid non ego Dominus? et non est ultra Deus absque me Deus justus, et salvans non est præter me.
verses.english: Declare it, and come forth, and consult together among yourselves! Who has declared these things from the beginning, from ancient times, and foretold them? Was it not I, the Lord? And there is no other God besides Me. There is no just God and no Savior apart from Me.

verses.latin: Convertimini ad me, et salvi eritis, omnes fines terræ: quia ego Deus, et non est alius.
verses.english: Turn to Me, and be saved, all you ends of the earth! For I am God, and there is no other God.

verses.latin: Per me ipsum juravi, de ore meo egressum est verbum justitiæ, et non revertetur: Quia mihi flectetur omne genu, et jurabit omnis lingua.
verses.english: I have sworn by My very Self; a word of righteousness has gone out from My mouth, and it will not return to Me unfulfilled: 'For to Me every knee shall bow, and every tongue shall swear allegiance.'

verses.latin: Ergo in Domino, dicet, meae sunt justitiæ et imperium: ad eum venient, et confundentur omnes qui repugnant ei.
verses.english: Surely, in the Lord alone, they will say, 'I have righteousness and strength.' To Him shall they come, and all who raged against Him will be put to shame.

verses.latin: In Domino justificabitur, et laudabitur omnis semen Israël.
verses.english: In the Lord, all the descendants of Israel shall be justified, and they shall glory and praise Him.

verses.latin: Incurvatus est Beel, curvatus est Nabo: facta sunt simulacra eorum bestiis et jumentis; onera vestra gravia, usque ad lassitudinem.
verses.english: The idol god Bel has bowed down low, and the idol god Nebo has also stooped low. Their carved images, which you thought were gods, are now merely carried away on the backs of beasts of burden and other animals. These images are a heavy, tiring load for the animals carrying them.

verses.latin: Curvatus est, et incurvatus est simul: non potuit salvare portantem, et anima eorum in captivitatem ducetur.
verses.english: Both Bel and Nebo have stooped and bowed together, defeated. They could not even save the one who carried their images, nor could they protect the people who worshipped them. The very souls of their devotees will be led away into captivity.

verses.latin: Audite me, domus Jacob, et omne residuum domus Israel, qui portamini a me ab utero, qui gestamini a me ex matris vulva.
verses.english: Listen to me, O house of Jacob, and every last one of you from the house of Israel: I am the One who has carried you from your mother’s womb; I am the One who has borne you from the moment you were conceived.

verses.latin: Usque ad senectam ego ipse, et usque ad canos ego portabo: ego feci, et ego feram, ego portabo et salvabo.
verses.english: Even as you grow old, I Myself will be with you; even until your hair turns gray, I will carry you. I am the One who made you, and I am the One who will continue to bear your burdens. I will carry you, and I will save you.

verses.latin: Cui assimilastis me, et adaequastis, et comparastis me, et fecistis similem?
verses.english: To whom could you possibly compare Me? Who could you make My equal, or match Me against? Who could you claim is similar to Me?

verses.latin: Qui effundunt aurum de sacculo, et argentum statera ponderant: mercedem dant fabri, ut faciat deum, et adorant, et incurvant se.
verses.english: Look at those who pour out gold from their money pouches and weigh silver on a scale. They pay a craftsman good wages to shape this metal into what they call a 'god,' and then they worship it and bow down to it.

verses.latin: Portant illum in humeris, gestant, et ponunt in loco suo, et stabit, et de loco suo non movebitur: sed et cum clamaverint ad eum, non exaudiet: de tribulatione non salvabit eos.
verses.english: They have to carry it on their shoulders and bear its weight. Then they place it in its specific spot, and there it stands, unable to move from that place on its own. If they cry out to it for help, it cannot hear them, nor can it save them from any distress.

verses.latin: Mementote hoc, et confundamini: redite praevaricatores ad cor.
verses.english: Remember these things, and consider how foolish they are, and be ashamed. Return to your senses, you transgressors, and truly reflect on your hearts.

verses.latin: Recordamini priorum saeculorum, quoniam ego sum Deus, et non est ultra Deus, nec est similis mei.
verses.english: Remember the events of ancient ages, for I am God, and there is no other God besides Me. There is absolutely no one like Me in all of existence.

verses.latin: Annuntians ab initio novissimum, et ab exordio quae nondum facta sunt, dicens: Consilium meum stabit, et omnis voluntas mea fiet.
verses.english: I am the One who declares the very end from the beginning of all things, and I announce from ancient times events that have not yet even occurred. I alone declare, 'My divine plan will stand, and My entire will shall be accomplished.'

verses.latin: Vocans ab oriente avem, et de terra longinqua virum consilii mei: locutus sum, et adducam illud: creavi, et faciam illud.
verses.english: I am calling a swift bird from the east, and from a far-off land, I am calling forth the man of My divine counsel. I have declared this, and I will bring it to pass. I have planned it, and I will surely accomplish it.

verses.latin: Audite me, immunes corde, qui longe estis a justitia.
verses.english: Listen to me, you who are hardened of heart, those of you who are far away from true righteousness.

verses.latin: Prope feci justitiam meam, non elongabitur: et salus mea non morabitur: et dabo in Sion salutem, et in Israel gloriam meam.
verses.english: I have brought My righteousness near to you; it will not remain distant. My salvation will not be delayed. And I will grant salvation in Zion, and bestow My glory upon Israel.

verses.latin: Descende, sede in pulvere, virgo filia Babylon, sede in terra: non est solium unigenitae filiae Chaldaeorum, ultra non vocaberis mollis et tenera.
verses.english: Descend now, O virgin daughter of Babylon, and sit in the dust. Sit on the ground, for there is no longer a throne for you, O only daughter of the Chaldeans. You will never again be called delicate and tender.

verses.latin: Tolle molam, et mole farinam: denuda turpitudinem tuam, denuda humerum, denuda crura, transi flumina.
verses.english: Take the millstone and grind flour (like a slave). Uncover your shame, bare your shoulder, bare your legs as you cross the rivers (because you will be exiled and treated as a slave).

verses.latin: Revelabitur ignominia tua, et videbitur opprobrium tuum: ultionem capiam, et non resistet mihi homo.
verses.english: Your nakedness and disgrace will be revealed for all to see. I will take vengeance, and no one will be able to stop Me.

verses.latin: Redemptor noster, Dominus exercituum nomen illius, Sanctus Israël.
verses.english: For our Redeemer is the Lord of all armies, and His name is the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Sede tacens, et intra in tenebras, filia Chaldaeorum: quia non vocaberis ultra domina regnorum.
verses.english: Sit in silence, and go into the darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans. For you will no longer be called the mistress of kingdoms (because your dominion is over).

verses.latin: Iratus sum super populum meum, contaminavi haereditatem meam, et dedi eos in manu tua: non posuisti eis misericordiam, ad senem aggravasti jugum tuum vehementer.
verses.english: I was angry with My people, so I let My inheritance be defiled and gave them into your hand (so you could conquer them). But you showed them no mercy, and you greatly intensified your cruel oppression even upon the elderly.

verses.latin: Et dixisti: In sempiternum ero domina. Non posuisti haec super cor tuum, neque recordata es novissimi tui.
verses.english: You said in your heart, 'I will be a sovereign queen forever!' You did not consider these things (your cruelty and the temporary nature of your power), nor did you ever think about what your ultimate end would be.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audi hæc, deliciosa, et sedens securam, quæ dicis in corde tuo: Ego sum, et non est amplius præter me: non sedebo vidua, et ignorabo sterilitatem.
verses.english: Therefore, listen to these things, O luxurious one who sits so securely (in your false sense of safety). You say in your heart, 'I am the only power, and there is no one else like me! I will never be a widow (losing my king or power), nor will I ever experience the sorrow of barrenness (losing my people or prosperity).'

verses.latin: Venient tibi duo hæc subito in die una, sterilitas et viduitas: omnis amaritudo super te veniet propter multitudinem maleficiorum tuorum, et propter duritiam incantatorum tuorum vehementem.
verses.english: But these two things will come upon you suddenly, in one single day: barrenness (the loss of your people) and widowhood (the loss of your king and power). All this bitter sorrow will come upon you because of the multitude of your evil sorceries, and because of the immense, powerful enchantments of your sorcerers (which will not save you).

verses.latin: Et fiduciam habuisti in malitia tua, et dixisti: Non est qui videat me. Sapientia tua et scientia tua, haec decepit te. Et dixisti in corde tuo: Ego sum, et absque me alius non est.
verses.english: You had confidence in your wickedness, and you said, 'No one sees me' (meaning, no one can judge me). Your wisdom and your knowledge, which you boasted of, have utterly deceived you. And again, you said in your heart, 'I am the only power, and there is no one else like me!'

verses.latin: Et veniet super te malum, et nescies ortum ejus: et irruet super te calamitas, quam non poteris expiare: et veniet super te repente miseria, quam nescies.
verses.english: Therefore, evil will come upon you, and you will not know its true origin or how to stop it. Calamity will rush upon you, which you will not be able to expiate or atone for. And misery will come upon you suddenly, which you will not know how to deal with.

verses.latin: Sta cum incantatoribus tuis, et cum multitudine maleficiorum tuorum, in quibus laborasti ab adolescentia tua, si forte quod prosit tibi, aut si possis esse fortior.
verses.english: Now stand firm with your enchanters and with the multitude of your sorceries, in which you have labored (and placed your trust) from your youth. See if perhaps they can profit you, or if you can, through them, become stronger (against this coming doom).

verses.latin: Defecisti in multitudine consiliorum tuorum: stent et salvent te aruspices cæli, qui contemplabantur sidera, et annuntiabant menses ex quibus ventura sunt tibi.
verses.english: You are exhausted by the multitude of your (useless) counsels. Let your diviners of the heavens now stand up and save you—those who gazed at the stars and proclaimed monthly what would come upon you.

verses.latin: Ecce facti sunt quasi stipula ignis, non liberabunt animam suam de manu flammae: non sunt carbones quibus foveantur, nec ignis ut sedeant ad eum.
verses.english: Look, they have become like mere stubble for the fire (easily consumed and gone). They cannot even save themselves from the power of the flame. They will offer you no comfort like warming coals, nor be a fire to sit by for guidance.

verses.latin: Sic facta sunt tibi in quibus laborasti: negotiatores tui ab adolescentia tua, unusquisque in via sua erraverunt, nemo est qui salvet te.
verses.english: This is what will become of those for whom you have labored (your sorcerers, enchanters, and diviners). Your merchants, with whom you have traded since your youth, have all gone their own way (abandoning you in your time of need). There is no one left to save you.

verses.latin: Audite haec, domus Jacob, qui cognominamini nomine Israel, et de aquis Juda existis, qui juratis in nomine Domini, et Dei Israel mementini, non in veritate neque in justitia.
verses.english: Listen to these words, O house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel and have descended from the lineage of Judah. You swear oaths in the name of the Lord and recall the God of Israel, but you do not do so with sincerity or with justice.

verses.latin: De civitate enim sancta vocati sunt, et super Deum Israel firmati sunt: Dominus exercituum nomen ejus.
verses.english: For indeed, you were called out from the holy city, Jerusalem. You claimed to rely on the God of Israel, whose name is the Lord of all creation.

verses.latin: Prima ex multis annuntiavi; et de ore meo exierunt, et audita sunt: repente feci, et venerunt.
verses.english: The first things I declared to you long ago; they came forth from My mouth and were heard. I suddenly brought them to pass, and they happened just as I said.

verses.latin: Sciens quia durus es tu, et nervus ferreus cervix tua, et aes frons tua.
verses.english: I knew that you are stubborn, and your neck is like an iron sinew, making you stiff-necked and rebellious. Your forehead is like bronze, making you hard-headed and unyielding.

verses.latin: Praedixi tibi ex tunc: antequam venirent, indicavi tibi, ne forte diceres: Idola mea fecerunt haec, et sculptilia mea et statua mea mandaverunt ista.
verses.english: I foretold these things to you from that very time. Before they happened, I revealed them to you so that you could not possibly say, 'My idols have done these things, and my carved images and my statues commanded them to happen.'

verses.latin: Audita sunt, vide: omnia ego annuntiavi tibi. Numquid non audietis? Exaudita feci nova ex nunc, et abscondita tibi, et non cognovisti ea.
verses.english: You have heard it all; now see these things! I have announced everything to you. Will you not listen? From this moment on, I will make you hear new things, things hidden from you, which you have not yet known.

verses.latin: Nunc creata sunt, et non ex tunc: et ante diem et in saeculum non audisti ea, ne forte dicas: Ecce ego cognovi ea.
verses.english: These new things are created and revealed now, not from before this moment. You have not heard them, not yesterday, nor at any time previously, so that you cannot possibly say, 'Behold, I already knew these things.'

verses.latin: Et audisti, et cognovisti, et apertum est auris tua: non enim utique audiisti, quia scio praevaricans praevaricatus es, et transgressorem ex utero vocavi te.
verses.english: You have heard and you have known, and your ear has supposedly been opened; but in truth, you have not truly listened. For I know that you have acted with treachery, and I have called you a transgressor from the moment of your birth.

verses.latin: Propter nomen meum longe faciam furorem meum: et laude mea infrenabo te, ne perires.
verses.english: For the sake of My holy name, I will hold back My intense fury. For My own glory, I will restrain Myself and not let My wrath consume you, so that you do not utterly perish.

verses.latin: Ecce igne excoqui te feci, sed non quasi argentum: elegi te in camino paupertatis.
verses.english: Behold, I have refined you in fire, but not with the intention of purifying you perfectly like silver. Rather, I have chosen to refine you in the furnace of affliction and hardship.

verses.latin: Propter me, propter me faciam, ut non blasphemer: et gloriam meam alteri non dabo.
verses.english: For My own sake, yes, for My very own sake, I will do these things so that My holy name may not be blasphemed. My glory I will not give to any other god or being.

verses.latin: Audi me, Jacob, et Israel quem ego voco: ego ipse, ego primus, et ego novissimus.
verses.english: Listen to Me, O Jacob, and you, Israel, whom I have called into existence. I Myself am the one true God, I am the First, and I am the Last.

verses.latin: Manus mea fundavit terram, et dextera mea librabit caelos: ego vocabo eos, et stabunt simul.
verses.english: My hand established the earth, and My right hand spread out the entire universe. When I call them, they all stand firm in their places.

verses.latin: Congregamini omnes vos, et audite: quis de vobis annuntiavit ista? Dominus dilexit eum, faciet voluntatem suam in Babylone, et brachium ejus super Chaldaeos.
verses.english: Gather together, all of you, and listen! Who among your false prophets or idols has announced these things beforehand? The Lord has chosen His servant, and that servant will accomplish His will against Babylon. His strong arm will come against the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Ego locutus sum, et vocavi eum; adduxi eum, et prosperum feci viam ejus.
verses.english: I have spoken, and I Myself called him forth. I brought him to his task, and I have made his path successful.

verses.latin: Accedite ad me, et audite haec: non a principio in abscondito locutus sum: ex quo factum est, ibi eram: et nunc Dominus Deus misit me, et Spiritus ejus.
verses.english: Come close to me and listen to these things: From the very beginning of time, I have not spoken in secret. From the moment it happened, I was there. And now, the Lord God has sent me on this mission, and His Spirit is with me.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus, redemptor tuus, Sanctus Israel: Ego Dominus Deus tuus, docens te utilia, gubernans te in via qua ambulas.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: I am the Lord your God, teaching you what is truly beneficial. I am guiding you along the precise path you should walk.

verses.latin: Utinam attendisses mandata mea! facta fuisset sicut flumen pax tua, et justitia tua sicut gurgites maris.
verses.english: Oh, if only you had paid attention to My commands! Then your peace would have flowed like a mighty river, and your righteousness would have been like the surging waves of the sea.

verses.latin: Et fuisset quasi arena semen tuum, et stirps uteri tui velut calculorum ejus: non interisset et non fuisset contritum nomen ejus a facie mea.
verses.english: Your offspring would then have been as numerous as the sand, and your descendants like its countless grains. Their name would never have been cut off or destroyed from before My presence.

verses.latin: Exite de Babylone, fugite a Chaldaeis, in voce exsultationis annuntiate, et auditum facite hoc, et efferte illud usque ad extrema terrae: Dicite: Redemit Dominus servum suum Jacob.
verses.english: Go forth from Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans! Proclaim with shouts of exultation, make this known, and spread it even to the farthest reaches of the earth! Declare: 'The Lord has ransomed His servant, the people of Israel!'

verses.latin: Non sitierunt in deserto, cum educeret eos: aquam de petra eduxit eis, et scidit petram, et fluxerunt aquae.
verses.english: They did not suffer thirst in the desert when He led them out. He made water flow for them from the rock; He split open the rock, and water gushed out for them to drink.

verses.latin: Non est pax impiis, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: The Lord God says: There is no true peace for the wicked.

verses.latin: Audite insulae, et attendite populi de longe: Dominus ab utero vocavit me, de ventre matris meae recordatus est nominis mei.
verses.english: Listen, you distant peoples and remote lands! The Lord called me before I was born. From my mother's womb, He remembered my name and knew who I was.

verses.latin: Et posuit os meum quasi gladium acutum: in umbra manus suae protexit me, et posuit me sicut sagittam electam: in pharetra sua abscondit me.
verses.english: He made my words like a sharp sword. He protected me under the shadow of His hand, and made me like a chosen arrow, keeping me hidden in His quiver until the right time.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Servus meus es tu Israel, quia in te gloriabor.
verses.english: And He told me, 'You are My Servant, Israel,' for through you, I will show forth My glory.

verses.latin: Et ego dixi: In vacuum laboravi, sine causa et vane fortitudinem meam consumpsi: verumtamen judicium meum cum Domino, et merces mea cum Deo meo.
verses.english: But I had thought, 'I have toiled for nothing! I have spent my strength uselessly and in vain!' Yet, my vindication truly rests with the Lord, and my reward is with my God.

verses.latin: Et nunc dicit Dominus, formans me ex utero servum sibi, ut reducam Jacob ad ipsum, et Israel non congregabitur ad illum: et glorificatus sum in oculis Domini, et Deus meus factus est fortitudo mea.
verses.english: Now the Lord speaks, He who formed me from the womb to be His Servant, so that I may bring Jacob back to Him. Even if Israel is not gathered to Him by me, still, I am honored in the sight of the Lord, and my God has become my strength.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Parum est ut sis mihi servus ad suscitandas tribus Jacob, et fæces Israel convertendas: ecce dedi te in lucem Gentium, ut sis salus mea usque ad extremum terræ.
verses.english: And He said: 'It is too small a thing for you to be My Servant only to raise up the tribes of Jacob and to restore the remnant of Israel. Look, I have appointed you as a light to the nations, that you may be My salvation to the ends of the earth.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus, Redemptor Israel, Sanctus ejus, ad contemnendum animam, ad abominandam gentem, ad servum dominorum: Reges videbunt, et consurgent principes, et adorabunt Dominum tuum, et Sanctum Israel, qui elegit te.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, His Holy One, to the One despised in soul, to the nation abhorred, to the servant of rulers: 'Kings will see and rise, and princes will worship your Lord, even the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: In tempore placito exaudivi te, et in die salutis auxiliatus sum tui: et servavi te, et dedi te in fœdus populi, ut suscitares terram, et possideres hæreditates dissipatas:
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: 'At an acceptable time, I have heard you, and in the day of salvation, I have helped you. I have preserved you, and I have given you as a covenant to the people, so that you may restore the land and reclaim the desolate inheritances;'

verses.latin: ut diceres his qui vincti sunt: Exite; et his qui in tenebris: Revelamini. Super vias pascentur, et in omnibus planis pascua eorum.
verses.english: to say to those who are bound: 'Come forth!' and to those who are in darkness: 'Be revealed!' They will feed along the roads, and their pastures will be on all the bare heights.

verses.latin: Non esurient neque sitient, et non percutiet eos æstus et sol, quia miserator eorum reget eos, et ad fontes aquarum potabit eos.
verses.english: They will neither hunger nor thirst, nor will the scorching heat or the sun strike them, for their merciful One will lead them, and He will guide them to springs of water.

verses.latin: Et ponam omnes montes meos in viam, et semitæ meæ exaltabuntur.
verses.english: And I will turn all My mountains into a clear path, and My highways will be raised up.

verses.latin: Ecce isti de longe venient, et ecce illi ab aquilone et mari, et isti de terra Australi.
verses.english: Look, some will come from afar, and behold, others from the north and from the west, and still others from the southern land.

verses.latin: Laudate cæli, et exsulta terra, jubilate montes laudem, quia consolatus est Dominus populum suum, et pauperum suorum miserebitur.
verses.english: Praise, O universe! Rejoice, O earth! Mountains, burst forth with praise! For the Lord has comforted His people, and He will have compassion on His afflicted ones.

verses.latin: Et dixit Sion: Dereliquit me Dominus, et Dominus oblitus est mei.
verses.english: But Zion said, 'The Lord has abandoned me, and my Lord has forgotten me.'

verses.latin: Numquid oblivisci potest mulier infantem suum, ut non misereatur filio uteri sui? Et si illa oblita fuerit, ego tamen non obliviscar tui.
verses.english: Can a woman forget her infant child, or fail to have compassion for the son she bore? Even if she could forget, I, your God, will never forget you.

verses.latin: Ecce in manibus meis descripsi te, et muri tui coram me sunt jugiter.
verses.english: Look, I have inscribed your name on the palms of My hands—a sign of permanent remembrance and possession—and your walls are constantly before My eyes.

verses.latin: Festinant structores tui; contra te autem demolientes et dissipantes a te exíbunt.
verses.english: Your builders are hurrying to rebuild you, while those who laid you waste and demolished you will quickly depart from you.

verses.latin: Leva in circuitu oculos tuos, et vide: omnes isti congregati sunt, venerunt tibi. Vivo ego, dicit Dominus, quia omnibus his velut ornamento vestieris, et sicut sponsa componeris.
verses.english: Lift up your eyes all around, and see! All these who come are gathering to you. 'As I live,' declares the Lord, 'for you will dress yourself with all of them as with an ornament, and you will array yourself with them like a bride,' a metaphor for the Church adorned with its new members.

verses.latin: Quia deserta, et solitaria, et terra ruinæ tuæ, nunc angusta erit præ habitatoribus: et longe fugabuntur qui devorabant te.
verses.english: For your desolate and ruined land will now be too narrow for its inhabitants. And those who devoured you will be driven far away.

verses.latin: Adhuc dicent in auribus tuis filii sterilitatis tuæ: Angustus est mihi locus, fac spatium mihi ut habitem.
verses.english: The children born to you during your desolation will still say in your hearing: 'The place is too confined for me; make room for me to dwell!'

verses.latin: Et dices in corde tuo: Quis genuit mihi istos? Ego sterilis, et non pariens, transmigrata, et captiva: et istos quis enutrivit? Ego destituta et sola: et isti ubi erant?’
verses.english: Then you will say in your heart: 'Who has given birth to all these for me? I was barren and childless, an exile and a captive; so who raised all these? I was forsaken and alone; where then did these come from?'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce levabo ad gentes manum meam, et ad populos exaltabo signum meum: et afferent filios tuos in ulnis, et filias tuas super humeros portabunt.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: 'Look, I will lift up My hand to the nations and raise My banner to the peoples, and they will bring your sons in their arms and carry your daughters on their shoulders.'

verses.latin: Et erunt reges nutritii tui, et reginæ nutrices tuæ: vultu ad terram demisso adorabunt te, et pulverem pedum tuorum lingent. Et scies quia ego Dominus, et non confundentur qui expectant me.
verses.english: And kings will be your guardians and queens your nurses. They will bow down to you with their faces to the ground and lick the dust from your feet. Then you will know that I am the Lord; and those who wait for Me will not be put to shame.

verses.latin: Numquid aufertur a forti præda? Aut quod captum fuerit a robusto, salvari potest?
verses.english: Can plunder be taken from a mighty warrior? Or can a captive be rescued from a powerful tyrant?

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus: Quia et robustos capientur, et quod ablatum fuerit a forti, salvabitur. Eos vero qui judicaverunt te, ego judicabo: et filios tuos ego salvabo.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord: 'Indeed, even the mighty will be taken captive, and what was seized by the strong will be rescued. And those who have judged you, I Myself will judge; and your children, I Myself will save.'

verses.latin: Et cibabo inimicos tuos carnibus suis: et quasi musto sanguine suo inebriabuntur: et sciet omnis caro quia ego Dominus salvans te, et Redemptor tuus Fortis Jacob.
verses.english: I will make your enemies eat their own flesh—a metaphor for self-destruction and divine retribution—and they will be drunk with their own blood as with new wine. Then all flesh will know that I am the Lord, your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Quae est epistola repudii matris vestrae, qua dimisi eam? aut quis est creditor meus, cui vendidi vos? Ecce in iniquitatibus vestris venditi estis, et in sceleribus vestris dimisi matrem vestram.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: "Where is the divorce decree for your mother – the one with which I supposedly dismissed her? Or which of My creditors can you name, to whom I supposedly sold you as payment? Look, it was because of your own sins and wicked deeds that you were sold into captivity, and it was because of your crimes that your mother – the nation of Israel – was divorced from the covenant."

verses.latin: Quia veni, et non est vir: vocavi, et non est qui audiat. Numquid abbreviata et parva facta est manus mea, ut non possim redimere? aut non est in me virtus ad liberandum? Ecce in increpatione mea desertum facio mare, pono flumina in siccum: computrescunt pisces absque aqua, et moriuntur in siti.
verses.english: "Why is it that when I came to you, there was no one present to hear Me? When I called out, there was no one to answer Me. Has My arm of power become so short and weak that I cannot redeem you? Do I lack the strength to deliver you? Watch how, with a single rebuke from Me, I can turn the sea into a desert, and make the rivers run dry. The fish in them will rot away without water, and they will die of thirst."

verses.latin: Induo cælos tenebris, et saccus erit operimentum eorum.
verses.english: I can even clothe the sky itself with darkness, making sackcloth its covering, like a symbol of mourning.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus dedit mihi linguam eruditam, ut sciam sustentare eum qui lassus est, verbo: erigit mane, mane erigit mihi aurem, ut audiam quasi magistrum.
verses.english: The Lord God has given Me a trained tongue, so that I may know how to sustain the weary with a word of encouragement and truth. Every morning, He awakens My ear, training Me to listen as a disciple is taught.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus aperuit mihi aurem: et ego non contradico, retrorsum non abii.
verses.english: The Lord God has opened My ear to listen, and I have not rebelled against His will; I have not turned away from Him.

verses.latin: Corpus meum dedi percutientibus, et genas meas vellentibus: faciem meam non averti ab increpantibus et conspuentibus in me.
verses.english: I gave My back to those who struck Me, and My cheeks to those who tore out My beard. I did not hide My face from insult and from those who spat upon Me.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus auxiliator meus, ideo non sum confusus: ideo posui faciem meam ut petram durissimam, et scio quoniam non confundar.
verses.english: The Lord God is My helper, therefore I have not been disgraced. Therefore, I have set My face like a very hard rock, knowing that I will not be put to shame.

verses.latin: Juxta est qui justificat me: quis contradicit mihi? stemus simul: quis est adversarius meus? accedat ad me.
verses.english: He who justifies Me is near. Who would dare to dispute My claim? Let us stand together and face each other! Who is My adversary? Let him come near to Me!

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus Deus auxiliator meus: quis est iste qui condemnet me? Ecce omnes isti quasi vestimentum conterentur: tinea comedet eos.
verses.english: Look, the Lord God is My helper! So then, who is the one who will condemn Me? Behold, all of these accusers will wear out like a garment; a moth will consume them.

verses.latin: Quis ex vobis timet Dominum, audit vocem servi ejus? qui ambulavit in tenebris, et non est lumen ei? speret in nomine Domini, et innitatur Deo suo.
verses.english: Who among you fears the Lord and listens to the voice of His Servant? For he who walks in deep darkness, with no light to guide him, let him put his hope in the Name of the Lord and lean on his God for support.

verses.latin: Ecce omnes vos accendentes ignem, accincti flammis, ambulate in lumine ignis vestri, et in flammis quas succendistis: de manu mea factum est hoc vobis; in doloribus dormietis.
verses.english: But look, all of you who kindle your own fire, who gird yourselves with your own flames of self-reliance, go ahead and walk in the light of your own fire and in the flames you yourselves have kindled! This judgment comes from My hand upon you; you will lie down in sorrow and pain.

verses.latin: Audite me, qui sequimini justitiam, et quæritis Dominum: Attendite ad petram unde excisi estis, et ad cavernam laci de qua præcisi estis.
verses.english: Listen to me, you who pursue righteousness and who seek the Lord. Look back at the rock from which you were carved—the very quarry from which you were dug.

verses.latin: Attendite ad Abraham patrem vestrum, et ad Saram quæ peperit vos: Quia solum vocavi eum, et benedixi ei, et multiplicavi eum.
verses.english: Look to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave birth to you. Remember, I called him when he was alone; then I blessed him, and I made him into a multitude.

verses.latin: Consolabitur ergo Dominus Sion, et consolabitur omnes ruinas ejus: et ponet desertum ejus quasi delicias, et solitudinem ejus quasi hortum Domini. Gaudium et lætitia invenietur in ea, gratiarum actio et vox laudis.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord will bring comfort to Zion. He will comfort all her desolate places and turn her desert into a garden of delights, like the very Garden of the Lord. Joy and gladness will be found there, with heartfelt thanksgiving and the sound of praise.

verses.latin: Attendite ad me populus meus, et tribus mea, aure mea auscultate: Quia lex de me exiet, et judicium meum in lucem populorum requiescet.
verses.english: Pay attention to me, My people. Listen closely, My nation. For My Law will go forth from Me, and My justice will rest upon the nations as a light for all to see.

verses.latin: Prope est justus meus, egressus est salvator meus, et brachium meum populos judicabit: Me insulæ expectant, et brachium meum sustinebunt.
verses.english: My righteousness is near, My salvation has already gone out. My mighty arm will judge all the peoples. The distant nations are waiting for Me, and they will rely on My mighty arm.

verses.latin: Elevate in cælum oculos vestros, et videte subter terram: Quia cæli sicut fumus liquescent, et terra sicut vestimentum atteretur, et habitatores ejus sicut et hæc interibunt: Salus autem mea in sempiternum erit, et justitia mea non deficiet.
verses.english: Lift up your eyes to the physical universe, and then look down upon the earth. For the very heavens will vanish like smoke, and the earth will wear out like a garment. All its inhabitants will perish just like these things. But My salvation will last forever, and My righteousness will never fail.

verses.latin: Audite me, qui scitis justum, populus cordis mei, in cujus ore lex mea est: Nolite timere opprobrium hominum, et blasphemias eorum ne timeatis.
verses.english: Listen to Me, you who know what is right—you, the people of My heart, in whose mouth My Law resides. Do not be afraid of human scorn, and do not fear their blasphemies against you.

verses.latin: Sicut enim vestimentum, sic comedet eos vermis: et sicut lanam, sic devorabit eos tinea. Salus autem mea in sempiternum erit, et justitia mea in generationes generationum.
verses.english: For a worm will consume them just as it consumes a garment. A moth will devour them just as it devours wool. But My salvation will last forever, and My righteousness will endure for all generations.

verses.latin: Consurge, consurge, induere fortitudinem, brachium Domini: Consurge sicut in diebus antiquis, in generationibus sæculorum. Numquid non tu percussisti superbam, vulnerasti draconem?
verses.english: Awaken, awaken! Clothe yourself with strength, O mighty arm of the Lord! Awaken as in the ancient days, as in generations long past. Was it not you who struck down Rahab—the proud one—and wounded the dragon? —This refers to God's defeat of Egypt and its pharaoh.

verses.latin: Numquid non tu siccasti mare, aquas abyssi vehementis: quæ posuisti profundum maris viam, ut transirent liberati?
verses.english: Was it not you who dried up the sea, the waters of the mighty deep? Was it not you who made the depths of the sea a path for the redeemed to pass through?

verses.latin: Et nunc redempti a Domino, revertentur, et venient in Sion laudantes: Et lætitia sempiterna super capita eorum: Gaudium et lætitiam tenebunt, fugiet dolor et gemitus.
verses.english: And now, those redeemed by the Lord will return. They will come to Zion with songs of praise. Everlasting joy will crown their heads. They will obtain gladness and joy, and all sorrow and groaning will flee away.

verses.latin: Ego ipse consolator vester: Quis es tu, ut timeas ab homine mortali, et a filio hominis qui quasi fœnum marcescet?
verses.english: I myself am your Comforter. Who are you to fear a mortal man? Why are you afraid of a mere son of man who withers like grass?

verses.latin: Et oblitus sis Domini factoris tui, qui tetendit cælos, et fundavit terram: et formidasti jugiter tota die a facie furoris opprimentis, et parantis ad perdendum: ubi est nunc furor opprimentis?
verses.english: Yet you have forgotten the Lord, your Maker, who stretched out the universe and laid the foundations of the earth. You have lived in constant fear all day long because of the fury of the oppressor who was ready to destroy. But where is the fury of that oppressor now?

verses.latin: Cito veniet gradiens ad aperiendum, et non interficiet usque ad interitum, nec deficiet panis ejus.
verses.english: The captive will soon be set free, walking out of his bonds. He will not die in the pit, nor will his food fail him.

verses.latin: Ego autem sum Dominus Deus tuus, qui conturbo mare, et intumescunt fluctus ejus: Dominus exercituum nomen meum.
verses.english: For I am the Lord your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar. The Lord of hosts is My Name.

verses.latin: Posui verba mea in ore tuo, et in umbra manus meæ protexi te, ut plantes cælos, et fundes terram, et dicas Sion: Populus meus es tu.
verses.english: I have put My words in your mouth, and in the shadow of My hand I have protected you. This is so that you may establish a new order for My people, just as if you were planting the heavens and laying the foundations of the earth. And to Zion, you will declare: 'You are My people!'

verses.latin: Consurge, consurge, consurge Jerusalem, quæ bibisti de manu Domini calicem iræ ejus usque ad fundum, calicem soporis hauristi, et epotasti.
verses.english: Awaken, awaken, awaken, O Jerusalem! You have drunk from the Lord’s hand the cup of His wrath, draining it to the very dregs. You have consumed and emptied the cup of staggering.

verses.latin: Non est qui sustentet eam ex omnibus filiis quos genuit: et non est qui apprehendat manum ejus, ex omnibus filiis quos enutrivit.
verses.english: Among all the sons she bore, there is no one to support her. Among all the sons she nourished, there is no one to take her by the hand.

verses.latin: Duo sunt quæ acciderunt tibi: Quis contristabitur super te? Vastitas, et contritio, et fames, et gladius: quis consolabitur te?
verses.english: These two calamities have befallen you—who then will mourn for you? It is desolation and destruction, famine and the sword. Who will comfort you now?

verses.latin: Filii tui projecti sunt, jacuerunt in capite omnium viarum, quasi cervus in laqueo, pleni indignatione Domini, increpatione Dei tui.
verses.english: Your sons lie helpless, cast away at the head of every street, like a stag caught in a net. They are filled with the Lord’s indignation, overwhelmed by the rebuke of your God.

verses.latin: Idcirco audi hoc, paupercula, et ebria non a vino.
verses.english: Therefore, hear this, you afflicted one, you who are drunk, but not with wine.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominator tuus Dominus, et Deus tuus, qui pugnavit pro populo suo: Ecce tuli de manu tua calicem soporis, cyathum indignationis meæ: non adjicies ut bibas illum ultra.
verses.english: Thus says your Sovereign Lord, your God, who fights for His people: 'Behold, I have taken from your hand the cup of staggering, the chalice of My indignation. You will never drink from it again.'

verses.latin: Et ponam illum in manu eorum qui te humiliaverunt, et qui afflixerunt te: quoniam dixisti animæ tuæ, Curvare ut transeamus: et posuisti quasi terram corpus tuum, et quasi viam transeuntibus.
verses.english: And I will place that cup into the hand of those who humiliated you and who afflicted you. For you said to your soul: 'Bow down, so that we may pass over.' And you made your body like the ground itself, and like a street for those who walked over you.

verses.latin: Surge, surge, induere fortitudine tua, Sion; induere vestimentis gloriae tuae, Jerusalem civitas Sancti, quia non adiciet ultra ut pertranseat per te incircumcisus et immundus.
verses.english: Arise, arise! Put on your strength, O Zion. Put on your glorious garments, Jerusalem, O city of the Holy One of Israel. For no one uncircumcised or unclean will ever again pass through your gates.

verses.latin: Excutere de pulvere, consurge, sede, Jerusalem; solve vincula colli tui, captiva filia Sion.
verses.english: Shake yourself free from the dust, stand up, and be seated in honor, Jerusalem. Release the chains from your neck, O captive daughter of Zion.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Gratis venundati estis, et sine argento redimemini.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord says: You were sold into slavery for no price at all, and you will be redeemed without any payment.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus Deus: In Ægyptum descendit populus meus in principio, ut colonus esset ibi; et Assur absque ulla causa oppressit eum.
verses.english: For this is what the Lord God says: My people went down into Egypt in the beginning to live there as temporary residents. And then, without any just cause, Assyria oppressed them.

verses.latin: Et nunc quid mihi est hic? dicit Dominus, quoniam ablatus est populus meus gratis. Dominatores ejus inique agunt, dicit Dominus, et jugiter tota die nomen meum blasphematur.
verses.english: And now, what is left for Me here? says the Lord. For My people have been taken captive for no reason. Their rulers act unjustly, says the Lord, and My holy name is constantly blasphemed all day long because of this injustice.

verses.latin: Propter hoc sciet populus meus nomen meum in die illa, quia ego ipse qui loquebar, ecce adsum.
verses.english: Therefore, My people will truly know My name on that day. They will understand that I, the very one who has been speaking to them, am now truly present to act.

verses.latin: Quam pulchri super montes pedes annuntiantis et prædicantis pacem, annuntiantis bonum, prædicantis salutem, dicentis Sion: Regnavit Deus tuus!
verses.english: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of the messenger who announces and proclaims peace, who announces what is truly good, who proclaims salvation, and who says to Zion: 'Your God reigns as King!'

verses.latin: Vox speculatorum tuorum: levaverunt vocem, simul laudabunt, quia oculi ad oculos videbunt cum converterit Dominus Sion.
verses.english: Listen! The voice of your watchmen! They have lifted up their voices in joyful song; together they will praise the Lord! For they will see eye to eye, with perfect clarity and shared understanding, when the Lord restores Zion and brings His people home.

verses.latin: Jubilate, et laudate simul, deserta Jerusalem, quia consolatus est Dominus populum suum; redemit Jerusalem.
