verses.english: Break forth into joyful shouts and sing praises together, O desolate Jerusalem! For the Lord has already comforted His people; He has redeemed Jerusalem, a certainty for the future.

verses.latin: Paravit Dominus brachium sanctum suum in oculis omnium Gentium; et videbunt omnes fines terræ salutare Dei nostri.
verses.english: The Lord has revealed His holy arm, His mighty power to act, in the sight of all the Gentile nations. And all the ends of the earth will see the salvation that comes from our God.

verses.latin: Recedite, recedite, exite inde, pollutum nolite tangere; exite de medio ejus, mundamini qui fertis vasa Domini.
verses.english: Depart, depart! Go out from there, from Babylon! Do not touch anything unclean. Go out from her midst; purify yourselves, you who carry the sacred vessels of the Lord intended for His temple.

verses.latin: Quoniam non in tumultu exibitis, nec in fuga properabitis; præcedet enim vos Dominus, et colliget vos Deus Israel.
verses.english: For you will not go out in panicked confusion, nor will you flee in haste like the Exodus from Egypt. For the Lord Himself will go before you, leading the way, and the God of Israel will gather you, protecting your rear.

verses.latin: Ecce intelliget servus meus, exaltabitur, et elevabitur, et sublimis erit valde.
verses.english: Behold, My servant will act with great wisdom and insight, fulfilling God's plan. He will be exalted and lifted up, and He will be exceedingly high in glory, speaking of His future resurrection and ascension.

verses.latin: Sicut obstupuerunt super te multi, sic erit absque specie inter viros aspectus ejus, et forma ejus inter filios hominum.
verses.english: Just as many people were utterly astonished at His appearance, so disfigured was His form, beyond that of any man, and His appearance among the sons of men was beyond recognition due to suffering.

verses.latin: Iste asperget gentes multas; super ipsum continebunt reges os suum, quia quæ non sunt narrata eis videbunt, et quæ non audierunt contemplabuntur.
verses.english: This Servant will sprinkle many nations, performing a priestly purification and cleansing them. Kings will be utterly silent in His presence, standing in awe, for what had never been told to them they will now see, and what they had never heard they will now deeply contemplate regarding God's mysterious plan.

verses.latin: Quis credidit auditui nostro? et brachium Domini cui revelatum est?
verses.english: Who has truly believed the message we have delivered? And to whom has the powerful, saving strength of God been revealed?

verses.latin: Et ascendet sicut virgultum coram eo, et sicut radix de terra sitienti: non est species ei, neque decor, et vidimus eum, et non erat aspectus, et desideravimus eum.
verses.english: He grew up before God, humble and unassuming, like a new shoot or a root from dry ground. He had no striking appearance, no outward splendor that would attract us. When we looked at Him, there was nothing in His visible form that would make us desire Him.

verses.latin: Despectum, et novissimum virorum, virum dolorum, et scientem infirmitatem: et quasi absconditus vultus ejus et despectus, unde nec reputavimus eum.
verses.english: He was despised and considered the lowest of men. He was a Man intimately acquainted with sorrows and suffering. His face was as if hidden from us by His suffering, or as if we turned our faces from Him in contempt. Indeed, He was so despised that we did not consider Him worthy of any regard.

verses.latin: Vere languores nostros ipse tulit, et dolores nostros ipse portavit: et nos putavimus eum quasi leprosum, et percussum a Deo, et humiliatum.
verses.english: But in truth, He Himself carried our weaknesses and sicknesses, and He Himself bore the burden of our sorrows. Yet we thought of Him as if He were a leper, struck by God's judgment and humiliated.

verses.latin: Ipse autem vulneratus est propter iniquitates nostras, attritus est propter scelera nostra: disciplina pacis nostrae super eum, et livore ejus sanati sumus.
verses.english: But He Himself was truly wounded because of our own rebellious sins. He was crushed and broken because of our wicked deeds. The severe punishment that brought about our peace with God was laid upon Him. And by the bruised marks of His scourging, we are spiritually healed.

verses.latin: Omnes nos quasi oves erravimus, unusquisque in viam suam declinavit: et Dominus posuit in eo iniquitatem omnium nostrum.
verses.english: All of us, like wayward sheep, have gone astray. Each one of us has turned aside onto his own sinful path. And the Lord God placed upon Him the collective guilt and sin of all of us.

verses.latin: Oblatus est quia ipse voluit, et non aperuit os suum: sicut ovis ad occisionem ducetur, et quasi agnus coram tondente obmutescet, et non aperuit os suum.
verses.english: He willingly allowed Himself to be offered as a sacrifice, and He did not open His mouth to defend Himself. He was led like a sacrificial sheep to the slaughter. And like a lamb that remains silent before its shearer, so He remained silent, truly not opening His mouth during His trial and suffering.

verses.latin: De angustia, et de judicio sublatus est: generationem ejus quis enarrabit? quia abscissus est de terra viventium: propter scelus populi mei percussi eum.
verses.english: He was taken away from oppression and from a biased judgment. And who can truly recount the story of His unique life or His spiritual descendants, seeing that His earthly life was cut short and He was cut off from the land of the living? For it was because of the rebellious sins of My people that I, God the Father, allowed Him to be struck down in death.

verses.latin: Et dabunt impii sepulchrum ejus, et divites in morte sua: eo quod iniquitatem non fecerit, neque dolum in ore suo.
verses.english: He was indeed appointed a grave with the wicked, but in His death, His actual burial was with the rich. This was so because He had committed no sin, nor was there any deceit found in His words or actions.

verses.latin: Et Dominus voluit conterere eum in infirmitate: posuit animam ejus pro peccato. Si posuerit animam suam pro peccato, videbit semen longævum, et voluntas Domini in manu ejus dirigetur.
verses.english: Yet it was the Lord God's divine will to crush Him with profound suffering. He laid down His very life as a perfect sin offering. Because He offered His life as a sin offering, He will see His spiritual offspring, the Church, live eternally. And through His work, the will and divine plan of the Lord will be perfectly accomplished.

verses.latin: Propter laborem animæ suæ videbit, et saturabitur: in scientia sua justificabit justus servus meus multos, et iniquitates eorum ipse portabit.
verses.english: Because of the immense suffering and anguish of His soul, He will see the glorious result of His sacrifice and be completely satisfied. Through His perfect knowledge and the divine wisdom He embodies, My righteous Servant, Jesus Christ, will make many people righteous, and He Himself will carry the burden of their accumulated sins.

verses.latin: Idcirco dabo ei partem plurimorum, et cum fortibus dividet spolia, pro eo quod tradidit in mortem animam suam, et cum sceleratis reputatus est, et ipse peccata multorum tulit, et pro transgressoribus rogavit.
verses.english: Therefore, I will grant Him a place of supreme honor among the great, and He will distribute the spoils of His victory with the triumphant mighty ones. This ultimate reward is because He willingly surrendered His life unto death, and was counted among common criminals. He Himself bore the full weight of the sins of many, and He interceded in prayer on behalf of all transgressors.

verses.latin: Lauda, sterilis, quae non paris: decanta laudem, et jubila, quae non parturis: quoniam multi filii desertae, magis quam ejus quae habet virum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Rejoice, O barren one who has not given birth! Sing praise and shout for joy, you who have not known the pains of childbirth! For the Lord God says: the children of the deserted woman will be more numerous than those of the woman who has a husband.

verses.latin: Dilata locum tabernaculi tui, et pelles tabernaculorum tuorum extende, ne parcas: longos fac funiculos tuos, et clavos tuos consolida.
verses.english: Enlarge the place of your tent. Stretch out the curtains of your dwelling places, do not hold back! Lengthen your ropes, and strengthen your tent stakes.

verses.latin: Ad dexteram enim et ad sinistram dilataberis: et semen tuum haereditabit gentes, et civitates desertas inhabitabit.
verses.english: For you shall spread out to the right and to the left, and your descendants will inherit the nations, and they will inhabit the cities that were once deserted.

verses.latin: Noli timere, quia non confunderis: neque erubescas, quia non eris pudore afficienda: quia confusionis adolescentiae tuae oblivisceris, et opprobrii viduitatis tuae non recordaberis amplius.
verses.english: Do not be afraid, for you will not be put to shame. Do not be disgraced, for you will not suffer reproach. For you will forget the shame of your youth, and you will no longer remember the disgrace of your widowhood.

verses.latin: Quia quasi virum reliquit te Dominus, et spiritu moeroris vocavit te in mulierem adolescentiae. Dixit sponsus tuus, Dominus exercituum nomen ejus: et redemptor tuus, Sanctus Israel, Deus omnis terrae vocabitur.
verses.english: For the Lord God, acting as a husband, abandoned you for a time. But then, with a spirit of compassion and sadness, He called you back to be His wife, the wife of His youth. Your Husband says this, and His name is the Lord of Armies. And your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel, He shall be called the God of all the earth.

verses.latin: Ad momentum in modico dereliqui te, et in miserationibus magnis congregabo te.
verses.english: For a brief, fleeting moment, I abandoned you. But with great acts of mercy, I will gather you back to Myself.

verses.latin: In flagelli momento abscondi faciem meam parumper a te: et in misericordia sempiterna misertus sum tui, dixit Dominus redemptor tuus.
verses.english: In a moment of My judgment, I hid My face from you for a short time. But with an everlasting act of mercy, I have had compassion on you, says the Lord God, your Redeemer.

verses.latin: Hae mihi quasi aquae Noe, cui juravi ne super terram ultra transmitterentur: sic juravi ut non irascar tibi, et non increpem te.
verses.english: This covenant of My faithfulness is for Me like the waters of Noah, concerning which I swore that they should never again flood the earth. So now I have sworn that I will not be angry with you, and I will not rebuke you.

verses.latin: Montes enim transferentur, et colles contremiscent: misericordia autem mea non recedet a te, et foedus pacis meae non movebitur, dixit Dominus propitiator tuus.
verses.english: For even if the mountains are removed and the hills tremble and shake, My mercy shall not depart from you. And My covenant of peace will not be shaken, says the Lord God who shows you mercy.

verses.latin: Paupercula, tempestate convulsa, absque ulla consolatione, ecce ego sternam per ordinem lapides tuos, et fundabo te in sapphiris.
verses.english: O poor little one, tossed and battered by a storm, without any earthly comfort: behold, I Myself will lay your foundation stones in their proper order, and I will lay your foundations with sapphires.

verses.latin: Et ponam jaspidem propugnacula tua, et portas tuas in carbunculis, et omnes terminos tuos in lapidibus desiderabilibus.
verses.english: And I will make your battlements of jasper, and your gates of carbuncles, and all your borders of beautiful, precious stones.

verses.latin: Omnes filii tui docibiles Domini, et multa pax filiis tuis.
verses.english: All your children shall be taught directly by the Lord God Himself, and the peace of your children will be abundant.

verses.latin: Et in justitia fundaberis: recede a calumnia, quia non timebis: et a terrore, quoniam ad te non appropinquabit.
verses.english: And you shall be established in true justice. Stay far from all false accusation and slander, for you will have no reason to fear. And keep away from terror, for it will not come near you.

verses.latin: Ecce qui congregabantur adversum te, consilio non meo: quicumque congregrati fuerint contra te, corruent ad te.
verses.english: Behold, those who gathered against you did so, but not by My counsel. Therefore, whoever gathers against you will surely fall because of you.

verses.latin: Ecce ego creavi fabrum sufflantem in igne carbones, et proferentem vas in opus suum, et ego creavi interfectorem ad disperdendum.
verses.english: Behold, I Myself created the craftsman who blows the coals in the fire and brings forth a weapon to perform his work. And I Myself created the destroyer to bring about ruin.

verses.latin: Omne vas quod fabricatum est contra te, non dirigetur: et omnem linguam resistentem tibi in judicio, judicabis. Haec est haereditas servorum Domini, et justitia eorum apud me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: No weapon that is forged against you will succeed. And you shall condemn every tongue that rises against you in judgment. This is the promised inheritance of the servants of the Lord God, and their righteousness comes directly from Me, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Omnes sitientes venite ad aquas: et qui non habetis argentum properate, emite, et comedite: venite, emite absque argento, et absque ulla commutatione vinum et lac.
verses.english: All of you who are thirsty, come to the living waters! And you who have no money, hurry, come and buy food and drink. Come and buy wine and milk without any money or cost.

verses.latin: Quare expenditis argentum in panibus non suis, et laborem vestrum in satietate non in pane? Audite me, et comedite bonum: et delectabitur in crassitudine anima vestra.
verses.english: Why do you spend your money on food that does not truly nourish you, and your labor on things that never genuinely satisfy? Listen to Me, and you will eat what is truly good. Your soul will find delight and richness in true abundance.

verses.latin: Inclinate aurem vestram, et venite ad me: audite, et vivet anima vestra, et feriam vobis pactum sempiternum, in misericordiis David fidelibus.
verses.english: Turn your ear toward Me and come to Me. Listen, and your soul will live. And I will make an everlasting covenant with you, according to the faithful mercies promised to David, which are now fulfilled in the Messiah.

verses.latin: Ecce testem populis dedi eum, ducem et præceptorem gentibus.
verses.english: Indeed, I have given Him (the Messiah) as a witness to all peoples, a leader and a teacher for all the nations.

verses.latin: Ecce gentem nescientem te vocabis: et gentes quæ te non cognoverunt ad te current, propter Dominum Deum tuum, et Sanctum Israël: quia glorificavit te.
verses.english: Behold, you, O Messiah, will call a nation that does not know you. And nations that did not recognize you will run to you because of the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel, for He has brought you glory.

verses.latin: Quærite Dominum, dum inveniri potest: invocate eum, dum prope est.
verses.english: Seek the Lord while He may be found. Call upon Him while He is near.

verses.latin: Derelinquat impius viam suam, et vir iniquus cogitationes suas, et revertatur ad Dominum, et miserebitur ejus: et ad Deum nostrum, quoniam multus est ad ignoscendum.
verses.english: Let the wicked abandon his sinful path, and the unrighteous man his evil thoughts. Let him return to the Lord, and He will have mercy on him, and to our God, for He is rich in forgiving.

verses.latin: Quia non sunt cogitationes meæ, cogitationes vestræ: neque viæ vestræ, viæ meæ, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: For My thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways My ways, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia sicut exaltantur cæli a terra, sic exaltatæ sunt viæ meæ a viis vestris, et cogitationes meæ a cogitationibus vestris.
verses.english: For as the expanse of the sky is higher than the earth, so are My ways higher than your ways, and My thoughts higher than your thoughts.

verses.latin: Et sicut descendit imber et nix de cælo, et illuc ultra non revertitur, sed inebriat terram, et infundit eam, et germinare eam facit, et dat semen serenti, et panem comedenti:
verses.english: For just as the rain and snow come down from the sky and do not return there, but rather thoroughly water the earth, making it fertile and causing it to sprout, providing seed to the sower and bread to the eater—

verses.latin: sic erit verbum meum, quod egredietur de ore meo: non revertetur ad me vacuum, sed faciet quæcumque volui, et prosperabitur in his ad quæ misi illud.
verses.english: So also will be My Divine Word that comes forth from My mouth. It will not return to Me unfulfilled, but it will accomplish all that I desire, and it will prosper in every mission for which I have sent it.

verses.latin: Quoniam in gaudio egrediemini, et in pace deducemini: montes et colles cantabunt coram vobis laudem, et omnia ligna regionis plaudent manu.
verses.english: Indeed, you will go out with joy, and you will be led forth in peace. The mountains and hills will burst into song before you, and all the trees of the field will clap their branches in joy.

verses.latin: Pro saliunca ascendet abies, et pro urtica nascetur myrtus: et erit Dominus nominibus, in signum æternum, quod non auferetur.
verses.english: Instead of the thorny briar, the fragrant fir tree will grow. And in place of the stinging nettle, the beautiful myrtle tree will flourish. This will bring honor and renown to the Lord, an everlasting sign that will never be removed.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Custodite judicium, et facite justitiam: quia juxta est salus mea ut veniat, et justitia mea ut reveletur.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: "Guard the divine law and live righteously, because my saving grace is coming soon, and my righteousness is about to be revealed."

verses.latin: Beatus vir qui facit hoc, et filius hominis qui apprehendit istud: custodiens sabbatum ne polluat illud, custodiens manus suas ne faciat omne malum.
verses.english: Blessed is the man who does these things, and blessed is the human who keeps hold of these truths. This person keeps the Sabbath holy and does not profane it. This person keeps their hands from doing any evil.

verses.latin: Et dicat filius alienigenae, qui adhaeret Domino, loquens: Separatione separavit me Dominus a populo suo. Et eunuchus non dicat: Ecce ego lignum aridum.
verses.english: Let no foreign person who has joined himself to the Lord say, "The Lord has surely separated me from His people." And let no eunuch say, "Behold, I am like a barren tree that cannot bear fruit."

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus ad eunuchos: Quicumque custodierint sabbata mea, et elegerint quae placuerunt mihi, et tenuerint foedus meum,
verses.english: For the Lord God says this to the eunuchs: "Whoever keeps my Sabbaths, and chooses what pleases me, and holds fast to my covenant with Him..."

verses.latin: dabo eis in domo mea, et in muris meis locum, et nomen melius a filiis et filiabus: nomen sempiternum dabo eis, quod non peribit.
verses.english: ...I will give them a place in my holy house, within my sacred walls, and a name that is better than having sons and daughters. I will give them an everlasting name that will never perish."

verses.latin: Et filios alienigenae, qui adhaerent Domino, ut colant eum, et diligant nomen ejus, ut sint ei servi: omnes custodientes sabbatum ut non polluant illud, et tenentes foedus meum:
verses.english: And the foreign people who have joined themselves to the Lord to worship Him and to love His name, to be His servants — all of them who keep the Sabbath without profaning it and who hold fast to my covenant —

verses.latin: adducam eos in montem sanctum meum, et laetificabo eos in domo orationis meae: holocausta eorum, et victimae eorum placere mihi super altari meo: quia domus mea, domus orationis vocabitur cunctis populis.
verses.english: — I will bring them to my holy mountain and make them joyful in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be pleasing to me upon my altar, because my house will be called a house of prayer for all peoples."

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus Deus, qui congregat dispersos Israel: Adhuc congregabo super eum, qui congregati sunt ejus.
verses.english: The Lord God, who gathers the dispersed children of Israel, says this: "I will gather still more people to them, beyond those who are already gathered."

verses.latin: Omnes bestiae agri, venite ad devorandum, universae bestiae saltus.
verses.english: "All you wild beasts of the open field, come to devour! All you wild beasts of the forest, come!"

verses.latin: Speculatores ejus caeci omnes, nescierunt universi: canes muti non valentes latrare, videntes vana, dormientes et amantes somnia.
verses.english: "All of their watchmen are blind; they know nothing at all. They are like mute dogs, unable to bark a warning. They see useless visions, they are always sleeping, and they love to dream."

verses.latin: Et canes impudentissimi, nescierunt saturitatem: ipsi pastores ignoraverunt intelligentiam: omnes in viam suam declinaverunt, unusquisque ad avaritiam suam, a summo usque ad novissimum.
verses.english: "They are like greedy dogs that can never be satisfied. These very shepherds have no understanding. Every one of them has turned aside to their own way, each one consumed by their own greed, from the highest leader to the lowest."

verses.latin: Venite, capi am vinum, et impleamur ebrietate: et erit sicut hodie, sic et cras, et multo amplius.
verses.english: "They say: 'Come, let us get wine and fill ourselves with drunkenness! And it will be just as it is today, so shall it be tomorrow, and even more abundantly so!'"

verses.latin: Iustus perit, et non est qui recogitet in corde suo; et viri misericordiae colliguntur, quia non est qui intelligat: a facie enim malitiae collectus est iustus.
verses.english: The righteous person dies, and no one takes it to heart. Merciful men are taken away, because no one understands why this is happening. For the righteous person is taken away from the presence of evil.

verses.latin: Veniat pax, requiescat in cubili suo, qui ambulavit in directione sua.
verses.english: Let them come to a peaceful rest. Those who lived righteously will rest in their dwelling place.

verses.latin: Vos autem accedite huc, filii malefici, semen adulteri et fornicariae.
verses.english: But you, come here, you children of sorcery and wickedness, you offspring of adulterers and harlots.

verses.latin: Super quem luditis? super quem dilatatis os, et ejicitis linguam? numquid non vos estis filii scelesti, semen mendax?
verses.english: At whom do you make sport? Against whom do you widen your mouth and stick out your tongue? Are you not children of rebellion, a deceitful offspring?

verses.latin: Qui consolamini in diis, sub omni ligno frondoso, immolantes parvulos in torrentibus, sub eminentioribus petrarum.
verses.english: You who burn with lust for idols under every leafy tree, sacrificing children in the valleys, under the high rocks.

verses.latin: In partibus silicum levium, pars tua; haec est sors tua: et ipsis effudisti libamina, obtulisti sacrificium. Numquid super his non indignabor?
verses.english: Among the smooth stones, that is your chosen portion; this is your destiny. And to them you poured out drink offerings and offered sacrifices. Will I not be indignant over these things?

verses.latin: Super montem excelsum et arduum posuisti cubile tuum, et illuc ascendisti ut immolares victimas.
verses.english: Upon a high and lofty mountain you set up your idolatrous altar, and there you ascended to offer sacrifices to idols.

verses.latin: Et post januam et post postem posuisti memoriale tuum; nam longe a me nudasti te, et ascendisti: dilatasti cubile tuum, et pepigisti cum eis pactum: dilexisti stratum eorum, manu aperta.
verses.english: And behind the door and behind the doorpost you have placed your pagan symbols. For far from Me, you exposed yourselves and ascended to these high places. You widened your place for such acts and made a covenant with them. You loved their idolatrous rituals, giving yourselves completely to them.

verses.latin: Et ornasti te regi unguento, et multiplicasti pigmenta tua. Misisti legatos tuos procul, et humiliata es usque ad inferos.
verses.english: And you adorned yourself for the foreign king with perfume and oil, and you used many pigments. You sent your envoys far away, and you debased yourself, descending to the very depths of the underworld.

verses.latin: In multitudine viae tuae laborasti; non dixisti: Desinam. Vitam manus tuae invenisti; propterea non es emortua.
verses.english: You wearied yourself with your many, sinful ways, yet you did not say: "I will stop." You found renewed strength in your own efforts; therefore you did not utterly faint.

verses.latin: Pro quo sollicita et timuisti, quia mentita es, et mei non es recordata, neque cogitasti in corde tuo? propter hoc, et ego silui, et quasi non viderem, et praebuisti malitiam, et timuisti me.
verses.english: For whom were you anxious, and whom did you fear, since you were false and did not remember Me, nor did you consider Me in your heart? Because of this, I also was silent, as if I saw nothing. And you committed evil, yet you thought you had nothing to fear from Me.

verses.latin: Ego annuntiabo justitiam tuam, et opera tua non proderunt tibi.
verses.english: I will expose your supposed righteousness, and your deeds will not bring you any benefit.

verses.latin: Cum clamaveris, liberent te collecti tui: ventus omnes tollet, aura auferet. Qui autem fiduciam habet in me, haereditabit terram, et possidebit montem sanctum meum.
verses.english: When you cry out, let the idols you have gathered deliver you. A mere breath of wind will carry all of them away, sweeping them off completely. However, he who trusts in Me will inherit the land and will possess My holy mountain (meaning, the true Temple of God).

verses.latin: Et dicam: Sternite, sternite, facite viam, auferte offendicula de via populi mei.
verses.english: And I will say: "Level the road, level it, make the path clear, remove all obstacles from the path of My people."

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Excelsus, et Sublimis, habitans aeternitatem, et sanctum nomen ejus, et cum contrito, et humili spiritu, ut vivificet spiritum humilium, et vivificet cor contritorum.
verses.english: For thus says the Exalted and Sublime One, who inhabits eternity, and whose name is Holy: "I, the Holy One, dwell with the contrite and humble in spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble and to revive the heart of the contrite."

verses.latin: Non enim in perpetuum litigabo, neque usque ad finem irascar: quia spiritus a facie mea egredietur, et halitum faciam.
verses.english: For I will not contend forever, nor will I always be angry. This is because the human spirit comes forth from My presence, and it is I who give all life and breath.

verses.latin: Propter iniquitatem avaritiae ejus iratus sum, et percussi eum; abscondi a te faciem meam, et iratus sum: et abiit vagus in via cordis sui.
verses.english: Because of the iniquity of his greed, I became angry and struck him. I hid My face from you, and I was intensely angry. And he continued to wander in the way of his own stubborn heart.

verses.latin: Vias ejus vidi, et sanavi eum, et reduxi eum, et reddidi consolationes ipsi, et lugentibus ejus.
verses.english: I have seen their ways (of wandering), and I healed them, and I led them back to Me. And I restored comfort to them and to those who mourned for them.

verses.latin: Creavi fructum labiorum, pacem, pacem illi qui longe est, et illi qui prope est, dixit Dominus, et sanavi eum.
verses.english: I create the fruit of the lips—peace, peace to him who is far off and to him who is near (meaning both Gentiles and Jews, or those far in sin and those struggling nearby), says the Lord, and I heal him.

verses.latin: Impii autem quasi mare fervens, quod quiescere non potest, et redundant fluctus ejus in spumam.
verses.english: But the wicked are like a restless, churning sea that cannot be still, and its waves keep tossing up mire and filth.

verses.latin: Non est pax impiis, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: "There is no peace for the wicked," says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Clama, ne cesses, quasi tuba exalta vocem tuam, et annuntia populo meo scelera eorum, et domui Jacob peccata eorum.
verses.english: Cry out, do not be silent! Raise your voice like a trumpet, and announce to My people their serious crimes, and to the household of Jacob—the entire nation of Israel—their sins.

verses.latin: Me quippe de die in diem quærunt, et scire vias meas volunt, quasi gens quæ justitiam fecit, et judicium Dei sui non dereliquit: rogant me judicia justitiæ, appropinquare Deo volunt.
verses.english: Indeed, they seek Me day after day, and they claim to want to know My ways, acting as if they were a nation that truly practiced justice and and never abandoned the divine judgment of their God. They ask Me for just decisions and claim to want to draw near to God.

verses.latin: Quare jejunavimus, et non aspexisti? humiliamus animas nostras, et nescisti? Ecce, in die jejunii vestri invenitur voluntas vestra, et omnes debitores vestros repetitis.
verses.english: They ask: “Why have we fasted, and You have not noticed? We humble ourselves, and You do not acknowledge it?” But behold, on the very day of your supposed fast, you seek only your own selfish desires, and you exact payment from all your debtors.

verses.latin: Ecce, ad lites et contentiones jejunatis, et percutitis pugno impie. Nolite jejunare sicut usque ad hanc diem, ut audiatur in excelso clamor vester.
verses.english: Look! You fast only to engage in strife and quarrels, and you strike others with wicked fists. Do not fast as you have done up to this very day if you expect your cries to be heard on high by God.

verses.latin: Numquid tale est jejunium quod elegi: per diem affligere hominem animam suam? numquid incurvare quasi circulum caput suum, et saccum et cinerem sternere? numquid istud vocabis jejunium, et diem acceptabilem Domino?
verses.english: Is this the kind of fast that I, the Lord, have chosen? Is it merely for a person to afflict their body for one day? Is it to bow their head like a drooping reed and spread sackcloth and ashes beneath them? Would you call this a true fast and a day acceptable to the Lord?

verses.latin: Nonne hoc est magis jejunium quod elegi: dissipa colligationes impietatis, solve fasciculos deprimentes, dimitte eos qui confracti sunt liberos, et omne onus dirumpe?
verses.english: Is not this, rather, the genuine fast that I have chosen: to loosen the bonds that tie people to wickedness, to untie the heavy loads of oppression, to let those who are crushed go free, and to break every oppressive yoke?

verses.latin: Frange esurienti panem tuum, et egenos vagosque induc in domum tuam: cum videris nudum, operi eum, et carnem tuam ne despexeris.
verses.english: It is to share your bread with the hungry, and to bring the poor and homeless into your own house. When you see someone naked, it is to clothe them; and you must not turn away from your own kin, ignoring their needs.

verses.latin: Tunc erumpet quasi mane lumen tuum, et sanitas tua citius orietur, et anteibit faciem tuam justitia tua, et gloria Domini colliget te.
verses.english: Then your light will burst forth like the morning dawn, and your healing will quickly spring up. Your righteousness will go before you, guiding your path, and the glory of the Lord will gather and protect you.

verses.latin: Tunc invocabis, et Dominus exaudiet: clamabis, et dicet: Ecce adsum. Si abstuleris de medio tui catenam, et desieris loqui quod non prodest, et extendere digitum, et loqui mendacium.
verses.english: Then you will call upon the Lord, and He will answer; you will cry out, and He will say: “Here I am!” This will happen if you remove the yoke of oppression from your midst, and stop speaking worthless words, and cease pointing the finger of scorn or accusation, and speaking lies.

verses.latin: Cum effuderis esurienti animam tuam, et animam afflictam repleveris: orietur in tenebris lumen tuum, et tenebræ tuæ erunt sicut meridies.
verses.english: If you truly pour out your soul to the hungry, extending your whole self to them, and satisfy the needs of the afflicted soul, then your light will rise even in the midst of darkness, and your deep gloom will become as bright as the noonday sun.

verses.latin: Et requiem tibi dabit Dominus semper, et replebit splendoribus animam tuam, et ossa tua liberabit: et eris quasi hortus irriguus, et sicut fons aquarum cujus non deficient aquæ.
verses.english: And the Lord will give you constant rest and peace forever. He will fill your soul with splendid blessings and invigorate your whole being, strengthening your very bones. You will be like a well-watered garden, and like a spring of water whose life-giving waters never run dry.

verses.latin: Et ædificabuntur ex te deserta sæculorum: fundamenta generationis et generationis suscitabis: et vocabitur nomen tuum, ædificator sepium, et restaurator semitarum.
verses.english: And people will rebuild the long-desolate places through you. You will raise up the foundations that can last for many generations. You will be called “the repairer of the broken walls” and “the restorer of the ancient paths to dwell in.”

verses.latin: Si averteris a sabbato pedem tuum, facere voluntatem tuam in die sancto meo: et vocaveris sabbatum delicatum, et sanctum Domini gloriosum: et glorificaveris eum, dum non facis vias tuas, et non invenitur voluntas tua, ut loquaris sermonem.
verses.english: If you turn your foot away from trampling the Sabbath—that is, from doing your own selfish will on My holy day—and if you call the Sabbath a true delight, and the Lord’s holy day glorious, and you truly honor it by not pursuing your own personal ways, and your own will is not found in idle talk or personal business, then these blessings will be yours.

verses.latin: Tunc delectaberis super Domino, et elevabo te super altitudines terræ, et cibabo te hæreditate Jacob patris tui. Os enim Domini locutum est.
verses.english: Then you will find your true delight in the Lord. I will lift you up above all the high places of the earth and feed you with the rich inheritance of Jacob your father. For the mouth of the Lord Himself has spoken these promises.

verses.latin: Ecce non est abbreviata manus Domini, ut salvare nequeat : neque ingravata est auris ejus, ut non exaudiat.
verses.english: Look now, the power of the Lord is not too short or weak that He cannot save; nor is His ear too heavy or deaf to hear the prayers of His people.

verses.latin: Sed iniquitates vestrae diviserunt inter vos et Deum vestrum : et peccata vestra absconderunt faciem ejus a vobis, ne exaudiret.
verses.english: But your moral failures have created a division between you and your God. Your sinful actions have hidden His presence from you, preventing Him from hearing your prayers.

verses.latin: Manus enim vestrae polluta sunt sanguine, et digiti vestri iniquitate : labia vestra locuta sunt mendacium, et lingua vestra iniquitatem fecerunt.
verses.english: For your hands are stained with the guilt of bloodshed, and your fingers are defiled by wickedness. Your lips have spoken lies, and your tongue has uttered malicious falsehoods.

verses.latin: Non est qui invocet justum, neque est qui judicet veraciter : sed confidunt in nihilo, et loquuntur vanitates : conceperunt laborem, et pepererunt iniquitatem.
verses.english: There is no one who calls for justice, nor anyone who judges with truthfulness. Instead, they put their trust in emptiness, and they speak what is false and useless. They conceive evil schemes, and they bring forth wickedness.

verses.latin: Ova aspidum ruperunt, et telas araneae texuerunt. Qui comederit de ovis eorum, morietur : et quod confotum est, erumpet in regulum.
verses.english: They hatch the eggs of poisonous serpents, and they weave the webs of spiders. Whoever eats of their eggs will die from the venom, and what they carefully nourish will burst forth as a viper.

verses.latin: Telae eorum non erunt in vestimentum, neque operientur de operibus suis : opera enim eorum opera iniquitatis, et opus iniquum in manibus eorum.
verses.english: Their spider-like webs of schemes will not serve as clothing for anyone, nor will they be covered by the results of their own actions. For their works are works of injustice, and their hands perform wicked deeds.

verses.latin: Pedes eorum ad malum currunt, et festinant ut effundant sanguinem innocentem : cogitationes eorum cogitationes inutiles, vastitas et contritio in viis eorum.
verses.english: Their feet run quickly towards evil, and they rush to shed innocent blood. Their thoughts are worthless and destructive thoughts. Ruin and destruction mark their paths.

verses.latin: Viam pacis nescierunt, et non est judicium in gressibus eorum : semitae eorum incurvatae sunt eis : omnis qui calcat in ea, nescit pacem.
verses.english: They have not known the way of peace, and there is no true justice in their footsteps—meaning their actions and decisions. Their paths are twisted and crooked for them; everyone who walks on such paths will not know peace.

verses.latin: Propter hoc elongatum est judicium a nobis, et non apprehendet nos justitia : expectavimus lucem, et ecce tenebrae : splendorem, et in caligine ambulavimus.
verses.english: Because of this, divine justice has moved far away from us, and righteousness does not reach us. We hoped for light, but behold, there is only darkness; we looked for brightness, but we walk in thick gloom.

verses.latin: Palpavimus quasi caeci parietem, et quasi absque oculis attrectavimus : impegimus meridie quasi in tenebris, in opimis quasi mortui.
verses.english: Like blind people, we grope along a wall, and like those without eyes, we stumble forward. We trip at midday as if it were dark, and in places of abundance, we are like the dead.

verses.latin: Rugiemus quasi ursi omnes, et quasi columbae meditantes gememus. Expectavimus judicium, et non est : salutem, et elongata est a nobis.
verses.english: We all roar like bears in distress, and we moan mournfully like doves. We have waited for divine judgment to set things right, but it has not come; we have hoped for salvation, but it remains far from us.

verses.latin: Multiplicatae sunt enim iniquitates nostrae coram te, et peccata nostra responderunt nobis : quia scelera nostra nobiscum sunt, et iniquitates nostras cognovimus.
verses.english: For our moral failures have multiplied before You, O God, and our sins themselves bear witness against us. Indeed, our wicked deeds are with us always, and we have recognized our own unrighteousness.

verses.latin: Dissimulare et mentiri Domino : et aversi sumus ne gressus sequeremur Dei nostri : loqui calumniam et detractionem, concipere et proferre de corde verba mendacii.
verses.english: We have been false and lied to the Lord, and we have turned away from following the steps of our God. We have spoken slander and defamation, conceiving and uttering from our hearts words of deceit.

verses.latin: Et conversum est retrorsum judicium, et justitia longe stetit : quia corruit in platea veritas, et aequitas non potuit ingredi.
verses.english: And true justice has been turned back, and righteousness stands far off. For truth has fallen in the public square, and equity has been unable to enter there.

verses.latin: Et facta est veritas in oblivionem : et qui recessit a malo, præda factus est : et vidit Dominus, et malum apparuit in oculis ejus, quia non est judicium.
verses.english: And truth has been forgotten, and he who turns away from evil becomes prey. And the Lord saw this, and it displeased Him that there was no justice being rendered.

verses.latin: Et vidit quia non est vir : et adtonitus est, quia non est qui occurrat : et salvavit eum brachium suum, et justitia ejus ipsa robusta est.
verses.english: And He saw that there was no man to intervene—no one to act righteously. He was astonished that there was no one to intercede. So His own mighty power brought salvation for His people, and His righteousness itself sustained them.

verses.latin: Indutus est justitia ut lorica, et galeam salutis in capite ejus : indutus est vestimentis ultionis, et opertus est quasi pallio zelo.
verses.english: He clothed Himself with righteousness as a breastplate, and put a helmet of salvation upon His head. He dressed Himself with garments of vengeance, and was covered with zeal like a cloak.

verses.latin: Sicut ad vindictam, sicut ad retributionem indignationis inimicis suis, et vicissitudinem inimicis suis : insulis vicissitudinem reddet.
verses.english: He will come for vengeance, for a just repayment of His indignation against His enemies, and He will render recompense to His adversaries. He will pay back the distant lands according to their deeds.

verses.latin: Et timebunt qui ab occidente sunt, nomen Domini : et qui ab ortu solis, gloriam ejus : cum venerit quasi fluvius violentus spiritus Domini qui cogit eum.
verses.english: And those from the west will fear the Name of the Lord, and those from the rising of the sun will fear His glory, when He comes like a rushing river driven by the very Spirit of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et venerit Sion Redemptor, et his qui revertuntur ab iniquitate in Jacob, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And the Redeemer will come to Mount Zion, and to those in the house of Jacob who turn away from their moral failures, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Hoc fœdus meum cum eis, dicit Dominus : spiritus meus qui est in te, et verba mea quæ posui in ore tuo, non recedent de ore tuo, et de ore seminis tui, et de ore seminis seminis tui, dicit Dominus, a præsenti et usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: "This is My covenant with them," says the Lord: "My Spirit who rests in you, and My words which I have placed in your mouth, will not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your descendants, nor from the mouth of your children's children," says the Lord, "from this present time and even unto eternity."

verses.latin: Surge, illuminare Jerusalem: quia venit lumen tuum, et gloria Domini super te orta est.
verses.english: Arise, Jerusalem, and shine forth, for your light has come. The glory of the Lord has risen upon you.

verses.latin: Quia ecce tenebrae operient terram, et caligo populos: super te autem orietur Dominus, et gloria ejus in te videbitur.
verses.english: Behold, thick darkness will cover the earth, and deep gloom will encompass the peoples. But the Lord will rise upon you, and His glory will be visible in you.

verses.latin: Et ambulabunt gentes in lumine tuo, et reges in splendore ortus tui.
verses.english: And nations will walk by means of your light, and kings by the brightness of your rising.

verses.latin: Leva in circuitu oculos tuos, et vide: omnes isti congregati sunt, venerunt tibi: filii tui de longe venient, et filiae tuae de latere surgent.
verses.english: Lift up your eyes all around you and see: all these people have gathered and come to you. Your sons will come from far away, and your daughters will be carried at your side (tenderly, as one carries a beloved child).

verses.latin: Tunc videbis, et afflues, et mirabitur, et dilatabitur cor tuum, quando conversa fuerit ad te multitudo maris, fortitudo gentium venerit tibi.
verses.english: Then you will see this, and you will overflow with joy. Your heart will be amazed and greatly expanded, when the abundance of the sea and the wealth of the nations is turned towards you and comes to you.

verses.latin: Inundatio camelorum operiet te, dromedarii Madiam et Epha: omnes de Saba venient, aurum et thus deferentes, et laudem Domino annuntiantes.
verses.english: Vast numbers of camels will cover your land, dromedaries from Midian and Ephah. All of them will come from Sheba, bringing gold and frankincense, and proclaiming the praise due to the Lord.

verses.latin: Omnes greges Cedar congregabuntur tibi, arietes Nabaioth ministrabunt tibi: offerentur super placabile altare meum, et domum majestatis meae glorificabo.
verses.english: All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered for your sake; the rams of Nebaioth will serve you. They will be offered upon My altar, which makes propitiation, and I will glorify the house of My majesty.

verses.latin: Qui sunt isti qui ut nubes volant, et quasi columbae ad fenestras suas?
verses.english: Who are these who fly like clouds, and like doves returning swiftly to their dovecotes?

verses.latin: Me enim insulae expectant, et naves maris in principio: ut adducam filios tuos de longe, argentum eorum, et aurum eorum cum eis, nomini Domini Dei tui, et Sancto Israel: quia glorificavit te.
verses.english: For the distant lands await Me, and the ships of the sea are prepared (ready to sail), so that I may bring your sons from afar, bringing their silver and their gold with them, to the Name of the Lord your God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because He has glorified you.

verses.latin: Et aedificabunt filii peregrinorum muros tuos, et reges eorum ministrabunt tibi: ad iracundiam enim percussi te, et in propitiatione mea misertus sum tui.
verses.english: And the sons of foreigners will build your walls, and their kings will serve you. For in My wrath I struck you, but in My favor and mercy, I have had compassion on you.

verses.latin: Et aperientur portae tuae jugiter die ac nocte, ut afferatur ad te fortitudo gentium, et reges eorum adducantur.
verses.english: And your gates will be opened continuously, day and night, so that the wealth of the nations may be brought to you, and their kings may be led in.

verses.latin: Gens enim et regnum, quod non servierit tibi, peribit: et gentes solitudine vastabuntur.
verses.english: For any nation and kingdom that will not serve you will perish; indeed, those nations will be utterly laid waste and left desolate.

verses.latin: Gloria Libani ad te veniet, abies, et buxus, et pinus simul ad ornandum locum sanctificationis meae: et locum pedum meorum glorificabo.
verses.english: The glory of Lebanon will come to you—the fir, the boxwood, and the pine together—to adorn the place of My sanctuary. And I will glorify the place where My feet rest (the Temple or My holy habitation).

verses.latin: Et venient ad te curvi filii eorum qui humiliaverunt te, et adorabunt vestigia pedum tuorum omnes qui detrahebant tibi: et vocabunt te Civitatem Domini, Sion Sancti Israel.
verses.english: And the sons of those who humbled you will come bowed down to you. All who scorned you will prostrate themselves at the soles of your feet. And they will call you the City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Pro eo ut fueris derelicta, et odio habita, et non esset qui pertransiret per te, ponam te in superbiam saeculorum, gaudium in generatione et generatione.
verses.english: In place of your former state, when you were forsaken and hated, and no one would even pass through you, I will make you an eternal glory, a joy for every generation.

verses.latin: Et suges lac gentium, et mammam regum suges: et scies quia ego Dominus salvans te, et redemptor tuus Fortis Jacob.
verses.english: You will draw sustenance from the nations and be nourished by kings. And you will know that I am the Lord, your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

verses.latin: Pro aere afferam aurum, et pro ferro afferam argentum: et pro lignis aes, et pro lapidibus ferrum: et ponam visitationem tuam pacem, et exactores tuos justitiam.
verses.english: Instead of bronze, I will bring you gold; and instead of iron, I will bring you silver; and instead of wood, bronze; and instead of stones, iron. I will make your governance to be peace, and your taskmasters to be justice.

verses.latin: Non audietur ultra in terra tua iniquitas, vastitas et contritio in finibus tuis: et occupabit muros tuos salus, et portas tuas laudatio.
verses.english: Violence will no longer be heard in your land, nor devastation or destruction within your borders. Salvation will occupy your walls, and praise will guard your gates.

verses.latin: Non erit tibi ultra sol ad lucendum per diem, neque splendor lunae illuminabit te: sed erit tibi Dominus in lucem sempiternam, et Deus tuus in gloriam tuam.
verses.english: The sun will no longer be your light during the day, nor will the brilliance of the moon illuminate you. Instead, the Lord will be your everlasting light, and your God will be your glory.

verses.latin: Non occidet ultra sol tuus, et luna tua non minuetur: quia Dominus erit tibi in lucem sempiternam, et complebuntur dies luctus tui.
verses.english: Your sun will never set again, and your moon will no longer wane, for the Lord will be your everlasting light, and the days of your mourning will come to an end.

verses.latin: Et populus tuus omnes justi, in perpetuum haereditabunt terram: germen plantationis meae, opus manus meae ad glorificandum.
verses.english: Then all your people will be righteous; they will inherit the land forever. They are the branch of My planting, the work of My hands, intended for My glory.

verses.latin: Minimus erit in mille, et parvulus in gentem robustissimam: ego Dominus in tempore ejus subito faciam istud.
verses.english: The smallest among you will become a thousand, and the least will become a mighty nation. I, the Lord, will accomplish this swiftly in its appointed time.

verses.latin: Spiritus Domini Dei super me, eo quod unxerit Dominus me: ad evangelizandum mansuetis misit me, ut sanarem contritos corde, et prædicarem captivis indulgentiam, et clausis apertionem:
verses.english: The Spirit of the Lord God is upon me, because the Lord has anointed me for a specific mission. He has sent me to preach good news to those who are humble and teachable, to heal those whose hearts are broken by sorrow, to announce freedom to those who are held captive, and to declare release to those who are imprisoned.

verses.latin: ut prædicarem annum placabilem Domino, et diem ultionis Dei nostri: ut consolarer omnes lugentes:
verses.english: He has sent me to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor—a time of grace and salvation—and to declare the day of our God’s justice, when He will bring judgment against His enemies. My mission is also to comfort all who mourn.

verses.latin: ut ponerem consolationem lugentibus Sion, et darem eis coronam pro cinere, oleum gaudii pro luctu, et pallium laudis pro spiritu mœroris: et vocabuntur in ea fortes justitiæ, plantatio Domini ad glorificandum.
verses.english: I am sent to bring comfort to the mourners in Zion, and to give them a crown instead of ashes, the oil of joy instead of mourning, and a garment of praise instead of a spirit of heaviness and despair. They will then be called mighty oaks of righteousness, a planting of the Lord for His own glory.

verses.latin: Et ædificabunt deserta a sæculo, et ruinas antiquas erigent, et instaurabunt civitates desertas, dissipatas in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: They will rebuild the ancient ruins that have been desolate for ages. They will restore the cities that were laid waste and scattered throughout many generations.

verses.latin: Et stabunt alieni et pascent pecora vestra: et filii peregrinorum agricolæ vestri, et vinitores vestri erunt.
verses.english: And foreigners will stand ready to tend your flocks. The children of strangers will be your farmers and your vinedressers, helping you with your labor.

verses.latin: Vos autem sacerdotes Domini vocabimini, ministri Dei nostri dicemini: fortitudinem gentium comedetis, et in gloria earum superbietis.
verses.english: But you, the redeemed people, will be called priests of the Lord. You will be named ministers of our God, serving Him in His holy temple. You will feed on the strength and wealth of the nations, and you will glory in their splendor.

verses.latin: Pro confusione vestra duplici, et rubore, laudabunt partem eorum: propter hoc in terra sua duplicia possidebunt, lætitia sempiterna erit eis.
verses.english: Instead of the double shame and disgrace you have endured, your people will praise their portion. Because of this, they will possess double in their own land, and everlasting joy will be theirs.

verses.latin: Quia ego Dominus diligens judicium, et odio habens rapinam in holocausto: et dabo in veritate mercedem eorum, et fœdus perpetuum feriam eis.
verses.english: For I, the Lord, love justice and hate robbery and injustice, even when offered as a burnt offering to me. Therefore, I will truly give them their reward, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

verses.latin: Et scietur in gentibus semen eorum, et germen eorum in medio populorum: omnes qui viderint eos, cognoscent illos, quia isti sunt semen cui benedixit Dominus.
verses.english: Their offspring will be known among the nations, and their descendants among the peoples. All who see them will recognize them, that they are the offspring whom the Lord has blessed.

verses.latin: Gaudens gaudebo in Domino, et exsultabit anima mea in Deo meo: quia induit me vestimentis salutis, et indumento justitiæ velut sponsum decoratum corona, et quasi sponsam ornatam monilibus suis.
verses.english: I will greatly rejoice in the Lord. My soul will exult and triumph in my God, for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation and wrapped me in the robe of righteousness. He has adorned me like a bridegroom with a garland, and like a bride bedecked with her jewels.

verses.latin: Sicut enim terra profert germen suum, et sicut hortus semina sua germinat, sic Dominus Deus germinabit justitiam et laudem coram omnibus gentibus.
verses.english: For just as the earth brings forth its sprouts, and just as a garden causes its seeds to grow, so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.

verses.latin: Propter Sion non tacebo, et propter Jerusalem non quiescam, donec egrediatur ut splendor justus ejus, et Salvator ejus accendatur sicut lampas.
verses.english: For the sake of the City of God, I will not be silent. For the sake of the people of Jerusalem, I will not rest, until her righteousness shines forth like brilliant light, and her salvation burns brightly like a lamp.

verses.latin: Et videbunt Gentes justum tuum, et omnes reges inclytum tuum: et vocabitur tibi nomen novum, quod os Domini nominabit.
verses.english: Then the nations will see your righteousness, and all kings will behold your glory. You will be called by a new name, a name that the mouth of the Lord Himself will declare.

verses.latin: Et eris corona gloriae in manu Domini, et diadema regni in dextera Dei tui.
verses.english: You will be a crown of splendor in the hand of the Lord, a royal diadem in the right hand of your God.

verses.latin: Non vocaberis ultra derelicta, et terra tua non vocabitur amplius desolata: sed vocaberis Voluntas mea in ea, et terra tua habitata. Quia complacuit Domino in te: et terra tua habitabitur.
verses.english: You will no longer be called 'Forsaken', and your land will no longer be called 'Desolate'. Instead, you will be called 'My Delight is in Her' (which means God takes pleasure in you), and your land 'Inhabited'. For the Lord Himself takes delight in you, and your land will be settled with people.

verses.latin: Habitant enim juvenis cum virgine, et habitabunt in te filii tui: et gaudebit sponsus super sponsam, et gaudebit super te Deus tuus.
verses.english: For just as a young man settles down with a virgin, so your sons will settle and live within you. And just as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, so your God will rejoice over you.

verses.latin: Super muros tuos Jerusalem, constitui custodes; tota die et tota nocte in perpetuum non tacebunt. Qui reminiscimini Domini, ne taceatis,
verses.english: Upon your walls, O Jerusalem, I have placed watchmen. All day and all night, they will never be silent. You who bring the Lord to remembrance, never be silent.

verses.latin: et ne demus silentium ei, donec stabiliat et donec ponat Jerusalem laudem in terra.
verses.english: And do not give Him any rest, until He establishes Jerusalem and makes her a city praised throughout the earth.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus in dextera sua, et in brachio fortitudinis suae: Si dedero ultra triticum tuum escam inimicis tuis: et si bibant filii alieni vinum tuum, pro quo laborasti.
verses.english: The Lord has sworn by His right hand and by His mighty arm: 'I will no longer give your grain as food for your enemies. Foreigners will no longer drink the wine for which you have toiled.'

verses.latin: Quia qui collegerint illud, comedent, et laudabunt Dominum: et qui comportaverint illud, bibent in atriis sanctuarii mei.
verses.english: Instead, those who harvest the grain will eat it and praise the Lord. And those who gather the wine will drink it in the courtyards of My holy sanctuary.

verses.latin: Transite, transite per portas, praeparate viam populo, planum facite iter, eligite ex lapidibus, levate signum ad populos.
verses.english: Go out, go out through the gates! Prepare the way for the people! Make the highway level, clear away the stones! Raise a banner for all the nations!

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus auditum fecit in novissimo terrae. Dicite filiae Sion: Ecce Salvator tuus venit: ecce merces ejus cum eo, et opus ejus coram illo.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord has made a proclamation to the furthest ends of the earth! Say to the Daughter of Zion: 'Behold, your Savior comes! His reward is with Him, and His just recompense is before Him.'

verses.latin: Et vocabunt eos Populum sanctum, Redemptum a Domino: tu autem vocaberis Quaesita, et Civitas non derelicta.
verses.english: And they will be called 'The Holy People', 'The Redeemed of the Lord'. And you, O Jerusalem, will be called 'Sought Out' and 'A City Never Forsaken'.

verses.latin: Quis est iste qui venit de Edom, tinctis vestibus de Bosra? Iste speciosus in stola sua, gradiens in multitudine fortitudinis suae? Ego qui loquor justitiam, et propugnator sum ad salvandum.
verses.english: Who is this one coming from the land of Edom, his garments stained crimson from the city of Bozrah? Who is this one, so glorious in his robe, marching forth in the fullness of his power? He answers, “I am the one who proclaims righteousness, and I am a mighty defender to save.”

verses.latin: Quare ergo rubrum est indumentum tuum, et vestimenta tua sicut calcantium in torculari?
verses.english: So why then are your garments red, and your robes like those of someone treading grapes in a winepress?

verses.latin: Torcular solus calcavi, et de gentibus non est vir mecum: et conculcavi eos in furore meo, et conculcavi eos in ira mea: et aspersus est sanguis eorum super vestimenta mea, et omnia indumenta mea inquinavi.
verses.english: I alone have trodden the winepress, and of all the nations, there was no one with me to help. I trampled them down in my burning fury, and I crushed them in my hot wrath. Their lifeblood splattered upon my garments, and I have stained all my clothing with it.

verses.latin: Dies enim ultionis in corde meo: annus retributionis meae venit.
verses.english: For the day of vengeance was determined in my heart, and the year for my people’s deliverance and retribution upon their enemies has now come.

verses.latin: Circumspexi, et non erat auxiliator: quaesivi, et non fuit qui adjuvaret: et salvavit me brachium meum, et indignatio mea ipsa auxiliata est mihi.
verses.english: I looked all around, but there was no helper; I sought, but there was no one to assist. So my own mighty arm brought me victory, and my fierce indignation sustained me and gave me strength.

verses.latin: Et conculcavi populos in furore meo, et inebriavi eos in indignatione mea, et detraxi in terram virtutem eorum.
verses.english: And I trampled down entire nations in my fury, and I overwhelmed them with my indignation as if they were drunk. And I brought their power crashing down to the earth.

verses.latin: Miserationum Domini recordabor, laudem Domini super omnibus quæ reddidit nobis Dominus, et multitudinem bonorum domui Israël, quæ reddidit eis secundum multitudinem miserationum suarum, et secundum multitudinem misericordiæ suæ.
verses.english: I will recount the manifold mercies of the Lord; I will sing praises to the Lord for all He has bestowed upon us. I will recall the abundance of good things He has given to the house of Israel, which He bestowed upon them according to the greatness of His compassion and the multitude of His tender mercies.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Verumtamen populus meus est, filii non negantes: et factus est eis salvator.
verses.english: And He said: “Surely they are My people, My children who will not prove false to Me.” And so, He became their Savior.

verses.latin: In omni tribulatione eorum non est tribulatus, et angelus faciei ejus salvavit eos: in dilectione sua et in indulgentia sua ipse redemit eos, et portavit eos, et elevavit eos cunctis diebus sæculi.
verses.english: In all their affliction, He Himself was not afflicted, for the angel of His presence saved them. In His boundless love and His tender compassion, He personally redeemed them. He carried them and lifted them up throughout all the days of the ages.

verses.latin: Ipsi autem provocaverunt, et exacerbaverunt spiritum sanctum ejus: et conversus est eis in inimicum, et ipse debellavit eos.
verses.english: But they, in turn, rebelled and grieved His Holy Spirit. So He turned against them as an enemy, and He Himself fought against them.

verses.latin: Et recordatus est dierum sæculi, Moysi, et populi sui: Ubi est qui eduxit de mari pastores gregis sui? ubi est qui posuit in medio ejus spiritum sanctum suum?
verses.english: Then He remembered the days of old, the days of Moses and His people. The Lord asked, “Where is He who brought out from the sea the shepherds of His flock? Where is He who placed His Holy Spirit within them?”

verses.latin: Qui deduxit ad dexteram Moysen, brachio majestatis suæ, scindens aquas ante faciem eorum, ut faceret sibi nomen sempiternum:
verses.english: It was He who led Moses by his right hand, by His glorious majestic arm. He divided the waters of the sea before them to make for Himself an everlasting name for all time.

verses.latin: Qui eduxit eos de abyssis, quasi equum in deserto non impingentem:
verses.english: He led them through the deep waters as easily as a horse walks through the desert without stumbling.

verses.latin: Quasi animal in campum revertens, spiritus Domini ductor ejus fuit: sic adduxisti populum tuum, ut faceres tibi nomen gloriæ.
verses.english: Just like cattle returning to their pasture, the Spirit of the Lord was their guide. In this way, You led Your people, to make for Yourself a glorious name.

verses.latin: Attende de cælo, et vide de habitaculo sancto tuo et gloriæ tuæ: ubi est zelus tuus, et fortitudo tua, mutlitudo viscerum tuorum, et miserationum tuarum super me contentio est?
verses.english: Look down, O Lord, from the highest heavens, and behold us from Your holy and glorious dwelling place. Where is Your zealous care and Your mighty power? Where are the multitude of Your tender mercies and Your deep compassion? Are they now withheld from me?

verses.latin: Tu enim pater noster, et Abraham ignoravit nos, et Israël non cognovit nos: tu Domine pater noster, redemptor noster, a sæculo nomen tuum.
verses.english: For You alone are our Father. Even if Abraham did not know us, and Jacob did not acknowledge us, You, O Lord, are our Father, our Redeemer! From all eternity, this is Your name.

verses.latin: Cur errare nos fecisti, Domine, de viis tuis, obtinuxasti cor nostrum ne timeremus te? Convertere propter servos tuos, tribus hæreditatis tuæ.
verses.english: Why, O Lord, have You allowed us to wander from Your ways? Why have You hardened our hearts so that we no longer revere You? Turn back, we pray, for the sake of Your servants, the tribes of Your own inheritance.

verses.latin: Ut quid detraxisti parumper populum sanctum tuum? Possederunt hostes nostri sanctuarium tuum.
verses.english: Why have You momentarily brought low Your holy people? Our enemies have now taken possession of Your holy sanctuary.

verses.latin: Facti sumus quasi de initio, cum non dominareris in nobis, neque invocaretur nomen tuum super nos.
verses.english: We have become as though we were from the very beginning, when You had not yet ruled over us, and Your name was not yet invoked upon us.

verses.latin: Si scindisses caelos et descenderes: a facie tua montes defluerent,
verses.english: If only you would tear open the sky and come down to us, the mountains would melt away at your presence and power!

verses.latin: sicut exustio ignis tabescerent, sicut ardor ignis decoqueret aquas: ut notum faceres nomen tuum inimicis tuis: a facie tua gentes turbarentur.
verses.english: Just as a fire burns away brushwood, and as a roaring fire makes water boil, so too would these mountains vanish and be utterly consumed. Do this so that you might make your power known to your enemies, and the nations would be terrified at your presence.

verses.latin: Cum feceris mirabilia, exspectabimus: descendisti, et a facie tua montes defluxerunt.
verses.english: When you have performed awesome, terrible deeds, we have waited for your appearance. You have descended in the past, and the mountains melted away at your presence and power.

verses.latin: A saeculo non audivimus, neque auribus percepimus: oculus non vidit, Deus absque te, quae praeparasti iis qui te exspectant.
verses.english: Since the beginning of time, no one has heard, no ear has perceived, no eye has seen, O God, any other god but you who has prepared such wonders for those who wait for you.

verses.latin: Occurristi laetanti, et facienti justitiam: in viis tuis recordabuntur tui. Ecce tu iratus es, et peccavimus: in ipsis fuimus semper, et salvabimur.
verses.english: You come to meet those who rejoice in doing what is right and just. They will remember you as they walk in your paths. But truly, you were angry, and we sinned against you. We have remained in our sins and have been living in them constantly. Yet, even so, we trust that we shall be saved!

verses.latin: Et facti sumus ut immundus omnes nos, et quasi pannus menstruatae universae justitiae nostrae: et cecidimus quasi folium universi, et iniquitates nostrae quasi ventus abstulerunt nos.
verses.english: Indeed, all of us have become like something ritually unclean, and all our supposed good deeds are like a soiled, discarded cloth. We have all withered and fallen away like a leaf, and our sins, like a strong wind, have swept us away into darkness.

verses.latin: Non est qui invocet nomen tuum: qui consurgat et apprehendat te: abscondisti faciem tuam a nobis, et allisisti nos in manu iniquitatis nostrae.
verses.english: There is no one among us who truly calls upon your name, no one who truly rises up to seek and take hold of you. You have hidden your presence from us, and you have crushed us and delivered us into the power of our own sins.

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine pater noster es tu, nos lutum, et tu figulus noster: et opera manuum tuarum omnes nos.
verses.english: And yet now, O Lord, you are still our Father. We are merely the clay, and you are our divine Potter. All of us are the complete work of your own hands.

verses.latin: Ne irascaris Domine nimis, et ne ultra memineris iniquitatis nostrae: ecce respice, populus tuus omnes nos.
verses.english: Do not be angry beyond measure, O Lord, and please do not remember our sins forever! Look upon us, we beg you—we are all your own people.

verses.latin: Civitas Sancti tui facta est deserta, Sion deserta facta est: Jerusalem desolata est.
verses.english: Your holy city has become a desolate wasteland. Zion itself has become a barren wilderness. Jerusalem is utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Domus sanctificationis nostrae et gloriae nostrae, ubi laudaverunt te patres nostri, facta est in exustionem ignis, et omnia desiderabilia nostra versa sunt in ruinam.
verses.english: The very Temple, the house of our holiness and our glory, where our fathers praised you, has been utterly consumed by fire. And all our precious, desirable things have been reduced to rubble and ruin.

verses.latin: Numquid super his cohibebis te Domine, tacebis, et affliges nos vehementer?
verses.english: Despite all these things, O Lord, will you continue to hold yourself back? Will you remain silent and afflict us so severely, allowing us to be utterly destroyed?

verses.latin: Quaesierunt me qui non rogaverunt: invenerunt me qui non quaesierunt me. Dixi: Ecce ego, ecce ego, ad gentem quæ non invocabat nomen meum.
verses.english: Those who had not previously asked Me, searched for Me. Those who had not sought Me, found Me. I said, 'Here I am! Here I am!' to a nation—meaning the Gentiles—that never called upon My name.

verses.latin: Expandi manus meas tota die ad populum incredulum, qui graditur in via non bona post cogitationes suas.
verses.english: I continually extended My hands all day long to a disobedient people—My chosen nation, Israel—who walked in a path that was not good, choosing to follow their own rebellious thoughts.

verses.latin: Populus qui provocat me jugiter ante faciem meam: qui immolat in hortis, et sacrificat super lateres.
verses.english: This is a people who constantly provoke My anger right before My face. They offer sacrifices in pagan gardens and burn incense on altars made of bricks, instead of honoring Me according to My law.

verses.latin: Qui habitant in sepulchris, et in delubris idolorum dormiunt: qui comedunt carnem suillam, et jus profanum in vasis eorum.
verses.english: These are people who dwell in tombs and sleep in pagan shrines, seeking to consult the dead. They eat the flesh of swine and have the broth of unclean things in their vessels—all of which are an abomination to Me.

verses.latin: Qui dicunt: Recede a me, non appropinques mihi, quia immundus es: isti fumus erunt in furore meo, ignis ardens tota die.
verses.english: These are the ones who say, 'Keep away from me, do not come near me, for I am holier than you, and you would make me unclean!' Such people will be like smoke, consumed by My fiery anger, a fire that burns continuously throughout the day.

verses.latin: Ecce scriptum est coram me: Non tacebo, sed reddam: et retribuam in sinu eorum.
verses.english: Behold, it is written before Me: I will not remain silent, but I will surely repay. I will give them the full measure of their just retribution into their very laps.

verses.latin: Iniquitates vestras, et iniquitates patrum vestrorum simul, dicit Dominus, qui sacrificaverunt super montes, et super colles exprobraverunt mihi: et reddam mensuram primam in sinu eorum.
verses.english: Your wickedness, along with the wickedness of your fathers together, says the Lord, who offered pagan sacrifices upon the mountains and publicly insulted Me upon the hills—I will repay the full measure of all their past sins into their laps.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Sicut invenitur granum in botro, et dicitur: Ne dissipes illud, quoniam benedictio est in eo: sic faciam propter servos meos, ut non disperdam totum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: 'Just as when a cluster of grapes is found to have one good grape, people say, 'Do not destroy it, for there is a blessing within it,' so also will I do for the sake of My faithful servants, so that I will not utterly destroy all of My people.

verses.latin: Et educam de Jacob semen, et de Juda hæreditatem montium meorum: et possidebunt hæreditate electi mei, et servi mei habitabunt ibi.
verses.english: And I will bring forth a remnant from Jacob, and from Judah will come those who inherit My holy mountains. My chosen ones will possess this land as their inheritance, and My faithful servants will live there securely.

verses.latin: Et erunt campestria in caulas gregum, et vallis Achor in cubile armentorum, populo meo qui requisierunt me.
verses.english: And the plains will become lush pastures for flocks of sheep, and the Valley of Achor—once a place of trouble—will become a peaceful resting place for herds of cattle. This will be for My people who have faithfully sought Me.

verses.latin: Et vos qui dereliquistis Dominum, qui obliti estis montem sanctum meum, qui ponitis fortunæ mensam, et præparatis Lyao libamina.
verses.english: But as for you who have abandoned the Lord, you who have forgotten My holy mountain of Zion, you who set a table in honor of the pagan god of Fortune, and who prepare wine offerings for the pagan goddess of Destiny—

verses.latin: Ego numerabo vos in gladio, et omnes in cæde corruetis: eo quod vocavi, et non respondistis: locutus sum, et non audistis: et fecistis malum in oculis meis, et quæ mihi displicuerunt, elegistis.
verses.english: I will count you out for the sword, and all of you will fall in a great slaughter. This is because when I called, you did not answer; when I spoke, you did not listen. Instead, you did what was evil in My sight and deliberately chose what greatly displeased Me.

verses.latin: Propter hoc hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce servi mei comedent, et vos esurietis: ecce servi mei bibent, et vos sitietis: ecce servi mei lætabuntur, et vos confundemini.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: 'Behold, My faithful servants will eat and be satisfied, but you who rebelled will hunger. Behold, My servants will drink and be refreshed, but you will thirst. Behold, My servants will rejoice with gladness, but you will be put to utter shame.

verses.latin: Ecce servi mei laudabunt præ exsultatione cordis, et vos clamabitis præ dolore cordis, et præ contritione spiritus ululabitis.
verses.english: Behold, My servants will sing praises with overflowing joy from their hearts, but you will cry out with bitter sorrow in your hearts, and you will wail from the crushing despair of your spirit.

verses.latin: Et dimittetis nomen vestrum in juramentum electis meis: et interficiet te Dominus Deus, et servos suos vocabit nomine alio.
verses.english: And you who rebelled will leave your names as a curse and an oath for My chosen ones—meaning, 'May God do to me what He did to them.' The Lord God will put you to death, but He will call His faithful servants by a new name, signifying their new identity in Him.

verses.latin: In quo benedictus est super terram, benedicetur in Deo amen: et qui jurat in terra, jurabit in Deo amen: quia oblivioni traditæ sunt angustiæ primæ, et absconditæ sunt ab oculis meis.
verses.english: So that whoever is blessed upon the earth will be blessed in the God of Truth, and whoever takes an oath on earth will swear by the God of Truth. This will happen because the former troubles and sorrows are completely forgotten and hidden from My eyes forever.

verses.latin: Ecce enim creo cælos novos, et terram novam: et non erunt in memoria priora, et non ascendent super cor.
verses.english: For behold, I am about to create new heavens and a new earth—a completely renewed creation. The former things, filled with sorrow and sin, will not even be remembered, nor will they ever come to mind.

verses.latin: Sed gaudebitis et exsultabitis usque in sempiternum in his quæ ego creo: quia ecce ego creo Jerusalem exsultationem, et populum ejus gaudium.
verses.english: Instead, you will rejoice and be utterly exultant forever in the things that I am creating. For behold, I am creating Jerusalem to be a source of great rejoicing, and her people to be a source of profound joy.

verses.latin: Et exsultabo in Jerusalem, et gaudebo in populo meo: et non audietur in eo ultra vox fletus, et vox clamoris.
verses.english: And I Myself will exult in Jerusalem and rejoice in My people. In that renewed city and among My people, the sound of weeping and the sound of distressful crying will never be heard again.

verses.latin: Non erit ibi ultra infans dierum, et senex qui non impleat dies suos: quoniam puer centum annorum morietur, et peccator centum annorum maledictus erit.
verses.english: In that time, there will no longer be an infant who lives only a few days, nor an old person who fails to complete the full measure of their years. For the one who dies at a hundred years old will be considered a mere child; but the sinner who lives a hundred years will still be cursed and face judgment.

verses.latin: Et ædificabunt domos, et habitabunt: et plantabunt vineas, et comedent fructus earum.
verses.english: They will build houses and live in them securely. They will plant vineyards and enjoy their fruit.

verses.latin: Non ædificabunt, et alius habitabit: non plantabunt, et alius comedet: secundum dies enim ligni vitæ erunt dies populi mei, et opera manuum eorum.
verses.english: They will not build a house for someone else to live in; they will not plant a vineyard for someone else to eat its fruit. For the days of My people will be like the days of the Tree of Life itself, and they will fully enjoy the work of their hands.

verses.latin: Non laborabunt frustra, neque generabunt in conturbatione: quia semen benedictorum Domini est, et nepotes eorum cum eis.
verses.english: They will not labor in vain, nor will they bear children destined for trouble or calamity. For they and their descendants are the blessed offspring of the Lord, and their grandchildren will remain with them.

verses.latin: Eritque antequam clament, ego audiam: adhuc illis loquentibus, ego exaudiam.
verses.english: And it will be that even before they call out to Me, I will hear them. While they are still speaking their prayers, I Myself will immediately answer them.

verses.latin: Lupus et agnus pascentur simul, et leo et bos comedent paleas, et pulli draconum pulvis panis eorum. Non nocebunt, et non occident in omni monte sancto meo, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: The wolf and the lamb will feed together in peace, and the lion will eat straw like the ox—its predatory nature transformed. As for the young serpents, dust will remain their food, signaling the final triumph over evil. There will be no harm or destruction anywhere on My holy mountain of creation, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Caelum sedes mea, et terra scabellum pedum meorum: quae domus aedificabitis mihi? aut quis locus requietionis meae?
verses.english: The Lord says these things: "The entire universe is My throne, and the earth is where I rest My feet. What kind of house could you possibly build for Me? And what kind of place could be My resting place?"

verses.latin: Omnia haec manus mea fecit, et facta sunt universa ista, dicit Dominus: ad quem autem intuebor, nisi ad pauperculum, et contritum spiritu, et trementem sermones meos?
verses.english: "My hand made all these things, and all of them came into being," declares the Lord. "But who am I going to look upon with favor? Only those who are humble in spirit, those who have a contrite spirit, and those who tremble at My words."

verses.latin: Qui immolat bovem, quasi occidat virum; qui mactat pecus, quasi cerebrum canis occidat; qui offert oblationem, quasi sanguinem porci; qui recordatur thuris, quasi benedicat idolo. Haec omnia elegerunt in viis suis, et in abominationibus suis anima eorum placuit eis.
verses.english: "Whoever sacrifices an ox, yet has no true devotion, is like someone who murders a man.
