Whoever sacrifices a lamb, yet has no true devotion, is like someone who sacrifices a dog's brain, which is an abomination. Whoever offers a grain offering, yet has no true devotion, is like someone who offers pig's blood, which is unclean. Whoever burns incense as a memorial, yet has no true devotion, is like someone who blesses an idol. All of these are things they have chosen according to their own corrupted ways, and their souls have delighted in their abominable practices."

verses.latin: Ergo et ego eligam vexationes eorum, et inducam eis quae timebant; eo quod vocavi, et non erat qui responderet; locutus sum, et non audierunt: et fecerunt malum in oculis meis, et quae nolui, elegerunt.
verses.english: "Therefore, I will also choose their vexations, and I will bring upon them the very things they feared. This is because I called out to them, and there was no one who responded. I spoke, and they did not listen. Instead, they did evil in My sight, and they chose what I did not desire."

verses.latin: Audite verbum Domini, qui tremetis sermonem ejus: Dixerunt fratres vestri odientes vos, et abjicientes propter nomen meum: Vade procul a nobis, quia honoratus est Dominus: et apparebit in laetitia vestra, et illi confundentur.
verses.english: "Listen to the word of the Lord, you who tremble at His word. Your brethren, who hate you and cast you out because of My name, have said, 'Go far from us, for the Lord is honored!' But the Lord will appear in your joy, and those who persecuted you will be put to shame."

verses.latin: Vox populi de civitate, vox de templo, vox Domini reddentis retributionem inimicis suis.
verses.english: There is a voice of a people crying out from the city. There is a voice crying out from the Temple. It is the voice of the Lord, rendering retribution to His enemies.

verses.latin: Antequam parturiret, peperit; antequam veniret partus ejus, peperit masculum.
verses.english: Before she was in labor, she gave birth. Before her pains came, she bore a male child.

verses.latin: Quis audivit umquam tale? et quis vidit sic? Numquid parturiet terra in die una, aut parietur gens simul? quia parturivit, et peperit Sion filios suos.
verses.english: Who has ever heard such a thing? And who has seen things like this? Will a land give birth to an entire nation in one day? Or will a whole people be born all at once? For Zion has travailed and given birth to her children.

verses.latin: Numquid ego claudam os vulvae, et non pariam, dicit Dominus: vel qui format omnia, claudet, dicit Deus tuus?
verses.english: "Will I, who brings to the point of birth, then close the womb and not let her give birth?" declares the Lord. "Or will I, who forms all things, then shut the womb and prevent new life?" says your God.

verses.latin: Laetamini cum Jerusalem, et exsultate in ea, omnes qui diligitis eam: gaudete cum ea gaudio, universi qui lugetis super eam:
verses.english: Rejoice with Jerusalem, and exult in her, all you who love her. Rejoice with her with joy, all you who mourn over her.

verses.latin: ut sugatis, et repleamini ab ubere consolationis ejus: ut mulgeatis, et deliciis affluatis ab omnimoda gloria ejus.
verses.english: so that you may nurse and be filled from the breast of her consolation. So that you may draw milk and overflow with delights from her abundant glory.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus: Ecce ego declinabo super eam quasi fluvium pacis, et quasi torrentem inundantem gloriam gentium, quam sugetis: ad ubera portabimini, et super genua blandientur vobis.
verses.english: For the Lord says these things: "Behold, I will extend peace to Jerusalem like a flowing river, and like an overflowing torrent, the glory and wealth of the nations will come to you, which you will draw from. You will be carried on her sides, and on her knees, you will be tenderly cared for."

verses.latin: Quomodo si cui mater blandiatur, ita ego consolabor vos: et in Jerusalem consolabimini.
verses.english: "Just as a mother comforts her child, so will I comfort you. And in Jerusalem, you will find consolation."

verses.latin: Videbitis, et gaudebit cor vestrum, et ossa vestra quasi herba germinabunt, et cognoscetur manus Domini servis ejus, et irascetur inimicis suis.
verses.english: "You will see it, and your heart will rejoice, and your bones will flourish like fresh grass, full of new life. And the hand of the Lord will be known to His servants, but He will show His wrath to His enemies."

verses.latin: Quia ecce Dominus in igne veniet, et quasi turbo quadrigae ejus, reddere in indignatione furorem suum, et increpationem suam in flamma ignis.
verses.english: For behold, the Lord will come in fire, and His chariots will be like a whirlwind, to render His fury in indignation and His rebuke in a flame of fire.

verses.latin: Quia in igne Dominus, et in gladio suo judicabit omnem carnem, et multi erunt interfecti a Domino.
verses.english: For the Lord will judge with fire and by His sword He will judge all flesh, and many will be slain by the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui sanctificabantur, et mundos se putabant in hortis post tergum unius intrinsecus, qui comedunt carnes suum, et abominationem, et murem, simul consumentur, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: "Those who sanctify themselves and purify themselves in the gardens, following one among them in secret rituals, those who eat swine's flesh, and abominable things, and even mice—they will all be consumed together," declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Ego enim opera eorum, et cogitationes eorum: venio ut congregem cum omnibus gentibus, et linguis: et venient, et videbunt gloriam meam.
verses.english: "For I know their works and their thoughts. I am coming to gather all nations and tongues. And they will come and see My glory."

verses.latin: Et ponam in eis signum, et mittam ex eis qui salvati fuerint, ad gentes in mari, in Africa, et Lydia, tendentes sagittam: in Italiam et Graeciam, ad insulas longe, ad eos qui non audierunt de me, et non viderunt gloriam meam, et annuntiabunt gloriam meam gentibus.
verses.english: "And I will set a sign among them. And from those who are saved among them, I will send them to the nations by the sea: to Africa and Lydia, nations known for their skilled archers; to Italy and Greece; to distant islands, to those who have not heard of Me and have not seen My glory. And they will declare My glory among the nations."

verses.latin: Et adducent omnes fratres vestros de cunctis gentibus donum Domino, in equis, et in quadrigis, et in lecticis, et in mulis, et in carrucis, ad montem sanctum meum Jerusalem, dicit Dominus, quasi offerant filii Israel munus in vasis mundis in domo Domini.
verses.english: "And they will bring all your brethren from all nations as an offering to the Lord, conveyed on horses, in chariots, in litters, on mules, and in wagons, to My holy mountain Jerusalem," declares the Lord. "This will be just as the sons of Israel bring their offering in clean vessels into the house of the Lord."

verses.latin: Et assumam ex eis sacerdotes, et Levitas, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: "And I will also choose some of them, even from the Gentiles, to serve as priests and as Levites," declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia sicut caeli novi, et terra nova, quae ego facio stare coram me, dicit Dominus: sic stabit semen vestrum, et nomen vestrum.
verses.english: "For just as the new heavens and the new earth, which I am making, will stand firm before Me," declares the Lord, "so also will your offspring and your name stand firm forever."

verses.latin: Et erit mensis ex mense, et sabbatum ex sabbato, veniet omnis caro ut adoret coram facie mea, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: "And it will be that from one new moon to the next new moon, and from one Sabbath to the next Sabbath, all flesh will come to worship before My face," declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Et egredientur, et videbunt cadavera virorum qui praevaricati sunt in me: vermis eorum non morietur, et ignis eorum non extinguetur: et erunt usque ad satietatem visionis omni carni.
verses.english: "And they will go out and see the corpses of the men who transgressed against Me. Their worm will not die, and their fire will not be extinguished. And they will be a terrifying spectacle to all flesh, a perpetual warning against sin."
